loans.name: Doctor Toryale Group

texts.en:
Samena is the leader of the Doctor Toryale group. She is married with four children, and lives in the 11th district of Kabul, Afghanistan.
Samena wants to take a loan for her business of quilt making. She has been involved in this business for more than 15 years and is quite experienced. She wants to expand and progress her business and support her children in acquiring a good education. With her loan, she wants to buy essential things for her business.
Samena wants to express her happiness about this effective process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for her business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim S., a trader in used clothing, is single and has two dependents (younger brothers) living with him.  He inherited the sales of used clothing from his father, and knowing full well that the trade is profitable, he thought it fit to maintain the same product.  With 15 years of experience in trade, Ibrahim is now seeking a loan to acquire more stock and generate more income which he will eventually use to improve his and his brothers'  education. He is also determined to construct a dwelling house for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is an employee of the Palestinian National Authority.  Yaser is married and has two daughters, three and two years old. His salary was the family's only source of income till his wife came up with the idea of opening a small beauty salon in one of the rooms of their house to help her husband support their family.

It's been less than a year since she started offering services to her family and the women who live in the same neighborhood of Tulkarem city where she lives, and the number of customers is noticeably increasing.

Yaser wanted to help his wife improve her salon so he took a US$ 800 loan from FATEN so she can buy the needed equipment and materials such as make-up kits and hair-coloring creams. He tells us that this will increase the number of customers she has and the income from the project which might prepare her for a salon outside the house.

Yaser stands in the picture at FATEN's office in Tulkarem.

loans.use: Purchase beauty shop tools and equipment

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia B. is from the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 52 years old. Sofia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Sofia owns annd operates a business providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling plastics and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Sofia has been engaged in her business for more than 19 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Sofia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Sofia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from ASKI. Sofia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Sofia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Khai

texts.en: Mrs. Khai K. is married to Mr. Seak Orem. They have four children. Two children are seamstresses in a garment factory and the others are attending the local public school. This family lives in Lvea Sa Kraom village in Kandal province. She is a vegetable seller in her local village who earns some money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. In order to improve her business, Mrs. Khai K. is seeking a loan to buy more vegetables to resell. Her husband is a vice villager and he is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more vegetabless to resell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 24 years old and married with three children. She sells milk to earn a living, while her husband is a driver. She has five years' experience in the business. She also does farming to earn extra income. 

Susan joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that she could access financial resources easily. She has requested a loan of Kes 70,000 to expand her business. Susan hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Merelyn

texts.en:
Merelyn O., 38 years old, is from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. Merelyn is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Merelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling of bags in the local community. Merelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials for the business. Merelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw items to expand product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Merelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw items to expand product line in retail store

loans.name: Milton Rene

texts.es: El Señor Rene vive en la casa de su Mama quien le ayuda en la crianza de sus animales, ya que el es soltero su mama le dijo que empiece un negocio y ahorre dinero para que pueda comprarse una casita ya que algún día te casaras cuenta el,  no sabia que hacer a que dedicarse y  empezó a trabajar como ayudante de un cerrajero pero no ganaba lo suficiente es por ese motivo que empezó a comprarse una vaquita y le fue bien cuando la vendió luego aumentando a eso compro dos ahora que subió no pudo comprar con lo que tenia es por ese motivo que se animo a sacar el  crédito y así poder aumentar para comprarse una vaquita, viendo sus necesidades nosotros le dimos un crédito kiva y esta muy feliz por eso y muy agradecido por la oportunidad.
texts.en:
René lives in his mother’s house. She helps him raise his animals because he’s single. He told us that his mother told him to start his business and save money so that he can afford a small house because someday he will marry. He didn’t know what to do. He started working as an assistant to a locksmith but he didn’t make much money that way so he decided to buy a little cow. When he sold her he did well. So next he increased his purchase to two cows. Now that prices have risen, however, he is unable to afford to buy more so he ventured to request a loan to be able to buy another little cow. Seeing his need, we granted him a Kiva loan and he is very happy and grateful for the opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia, es una carismática, mujer de 59 años, que está casada con Felipe de 69 años, ambos tiene dos hijos mayores, quienes trabajan de manera independiente y viven en la ciudad de Lima, por lo que está pareja viven solos en su casa propia. Desde hace 37 años, cultiva café, plátano, tangerina y achiote, en terrenos que posee, en donde su esposo, la ayuda en el trabajo, pero cuando tiene que requerir de mayor esfuerzo y tiempo, contrata operarios. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es vivir en el campo, disfruta del campo, la tranquilidad que le brinda y sentir la naturaleza. Por otro lado el tener que trasladar su cosecha a la ciudad le resulta difícil por la distancia, pero asegura que vale la pena, porque las utilidades que consigue, son bastante considerables y le permiten cubrir sus primeras necesidades. Ahora que el kilo de café lo están cotizando a S/. 8.00 soles el kilo, desea incrementar su producción de de este producto que es muy requerido en los mercados y en los centros de acopio. Es el sexto crédito con MFP y esta segura que pagará puntualmente, sus cuotas como hasta ahora, además esta feliz de trabajar con las personas de su grupo comunal a quienes aprecia. Con el crédito comprará,  varios sacos de abono orgánico, el cual esparcirá sobre sus cultivos de café y plátano.
texts.en:
Felicia is a charismatic 59 year old woman. She is married to Felipe, who is 69. They have two grown children who work independently and live in the city of Lima, so the couple lives alone in their own home. For 37 years, she has grown coffee, plantains, tangerines and annato on the land that she owns. Her husband helps her with the work, but when it requires more effort and time, she hires laborers. What she likes the most is living in the country, enjoying the country and the tranquility it brings, and feeling nature. On the other hand, having to transport her harvest to the city is difficult for her because of the distance, but she assures us that it is worth it because the earnings she makes are considerable and they allow her to cover her basic neccessities. Now that coffee is at S/. 8.00 soles a kilo, she want to increase her production of that product that is very much in demand in the makets and stockpiling centers. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is sure that she will make her payments on time as she has so far. She is also happy to work with the people in her community group, whom she appreciates. With the loan, she will buy various bags of organic fertilizer, which she will spread on her coffee and plantain plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer to improve the production of plantains and coffee.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila A. is from the city of Zamora, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old. Leonila is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Leonila operates a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes from operating "habal-habal" motor transport services. Leonila has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Leonila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Leonila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
Don Franklin es  padre de familia de dos hijos, casado. Tiene dos trabajos hoy en día. Taxista y una barbería que puso en su casa y la tiene ubicada en una parte de la sala.
Esto lo logra a través de las ganancias del taxi. Y nace la idea para lograr ganar dinero ya que abeces las corridas están malas, y con su barbería logra equilibrar sus gastos.
Lleva siete ciclos en Afodenic en donde ha logrado dar mantenimiento a su vehículo, hacer pequeñas mejoras a su vivienda. Y con este préstamo lograra comprar equipos para seguir dando un mejor servicio en su barbería.
Comprara: una silla de barbería para adulto, una silla para niño, maquinas pequeña para pulir, cepillo, gelatina, guillet. Talco, colonia y otros. Logrando a si dar un giro diferente en atención. Tiene planes a largo plazo para hacer independiente el negocio una construcción. Es por eso desea captar clientes y ganar mejor.
texts.en:
Franklin is married and has two children. He has two jobs. He’s a taxi driver and a barber. His barber shop is set up in part of his living room. Profits from the taxi made the shop possible. He got the idea for the shop because sometimes fares in the taxi aren’t all that good and the barber shop allows him to even out his expenses. He has been in seven Afodenic cycles which have allowed him to service his car and make small home improvements. This loan will be used to buy equipment and supplies to provide better service in his barber shop. He will buy the following: a barber chair for adults, a child’s barber chair, trimmers, a brush, gel, Gillette blades, talcum powder, cologne and others thereby modifying the attention he can provide. His long range plan is to build a structure to make the barber shop independent from the house. This is why he wants to get more customers and earn more.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy supplies for his barber shop like: a barber chair for adults, a child’s barber chair, small hair trimmers, brush, gel, Gillette blades, talcum powder, cologne and others.

loans.name: Hilda María

texts.es:
La Señora Hilda U. es socia del banco comunal Señoras de Taguan, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre, que  pertenece al cantón Sigsig, su gente se dedica a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 40 años, es viuda hace 7 años  y tiene  6 hijos de 21, 18, 15, 13, 10 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos, su segunda hija trabaja y es quien le ayuda económicamente, su tercer  y cuarto hijos estudian en el colegio de la localidad y su último hijo en la escuela. Con su trabajo ha lograda construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Hilda  trabaja en el bar de un colegio hace 5 años, labora desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. de lunes a viernes, también se dedica a la cría de cerdos.
 
Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para el bar como son gaseosas, aguas, confitería etc.
 
Su meta es tener más chanchos para la cría.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda U. is a member of the Señoras de Taguan (Ladies of Taguan) communal bank. She lives in Taguan, Sigsig canton. Its residents make panama hats, raise farm animals and farm. She is 40 years old, widowed for seven years and has six children who are 21, 18, 15, 13, 10 and 6 years of age. Her oldest daughter is married and lives in her house sharing expenses. Her second daughter works and helps her economically. Her third and fourth sons are in the local secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her work has made it possible for her to build her own house. Hilda has worked in the high school’s snack shop for five years. She works from 7am until 2pm from Monday through Friday. She also raises pigs. This is the third loan she’s gotten in the communal bank and she will use it to buy merchandise for the snack bar like soft drinks, water, sweets, etc. Her goal is to have more pigs to raise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candy, soft drinks, water, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela C. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old. Miguela is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Miguela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Miguela is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Adelaide Rosa

texts.pt:
Adelaide Rosa H. nasceu na província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada e mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 03 a 15 anos de idade os 3 mais velhos vão a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras pelos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua irmã enviando bens e dinheiro.

Saiu da cidade de Maputo para cidade da Matola quando com a sua família a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negocio próprio de venda de roupa de cama e carteiras, que adquire na Republica da Africa do sul e faz esta actividade ha mais de 10 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado conta com ajuda dos filhos, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria. (Bim). 

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma conversa com uma cliente da instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 20.400.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mercadoria (panos, lencois, cortinas, roupa de cama, carteiras e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para construir uma banca fixa e deixar de ser vendedora ambulante.
texts.en:
Adelaide Rosa H. was born in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is married and the mother of 4 children between the ages of 3 and 15.  The 3 oldest go to school.  She finished 7th grade and didn't continue because of her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her sister by sending her goods and money.

She left the city of Maputo for the city of Matola when her family when they were searching for better living conditions.  She has her own business selling bedding and wallets which she acquires in South Africa.  She has done this for more than 10 years.  She doesn't have any employees, but 2 of her children help her.  She makes a monthly income of 4,000 meticais per month, which she puts towards her living expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account (Bim).

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a conversation with a customer of the organization.  This is her second loan in the amount of 20,400 meticais, which she will use to purcahse merchandise (towels, bedding, curtains, wallets, etc.) to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

She is confident that she will make her payments ahead of time so she can ask for another loan so she can build a fixed stand and stop working as a traveling street vendor.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (towels, bedding, curtains, wallets, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of cement and sand

loans.name: Karo

texts.en: Karo G. lives with his wife and 3 children. The family’s main income comes from cattle farming. The whole family is engaged in it to meet the large family’s most necessary needs. Karo’s children have musical talent and wish to attend a musical school. The only way to make the children’s dreams come true is to expand the business.  Karo is planning to purchase 3 cows.

loans.use: To purchase 3 cows

loans.name: Gonchigsuren

texts.en:
Gonchigsuren C. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Selenge province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent and fence. Her older children all are grown up and live on their own and her youngest daughter, age 7, attends a local primary school. Her husband is retired and currently works as a guard in the Golomt Bank after working in the police department. 

Gonchigsuren operates a second hand consumer goods trading business out of a rented stall at the local market in her town. She has been engaged in this business since 2008 and has gained significant experience. She sells a variety of consumer goods that can satisfy her customers's needs. Her earnings have enabled him to buy car for her husband. 

Gonchigsuren is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to imports new clothing items from Erlian, a border city of China, in order to increase her product line for her used consumer goods trading business.

loans.use: To import new clothing items for resale

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is 24 years old and currently single, but he cares for one orphan.  Jerome owns a secretarial service and works with his parents and other family members in Kimironko, a suburb of Kigali.  He has worked here for 2 years.

Jerome has requested a loan for a photocopier and more computers for his small, clean and well-organised office.  He plans to use any profits to provide food for his family.

loans.use: To buy equipment for a secretarial service

loans.name: Asmar

texts.en: Asmar B. is a 52 year-old-woman who has her own cattle-breeding business. Asmar lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan in the town of Imishli. Asmar is married and has one son and two daughters, aged 23 and 21. Asmar gets a monthly pension in the amount of 85 AZN. This income is not sufficient for her big family, consisting of 5 members. In 2004, Asmar decided to start her cattle-breeding business and since then her income has considerably increased. She also breeds other types of livestock. Asmar is very grateful, because with this first loan in the amount of 1000 AZN that she received from Aqroinvest and Kiva, she was able to buy two more cows. Now she has five cows and her family's monthly income from this business is 250 AZN. Asmar is a very industrious woman. Her goal is to increase the number of cows to eight.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn A. lives in the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 21 years old, single and makes a living by running a shop that sells ready-to-wear and ukay-ukay (or used) clothing. She has been in this business for more than three years and earns about 10,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Lalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 8,000 PHP, to buy more used clothing to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to continue expanding it. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional used (ukay-ukay) clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas y venta de pan, la socia vende las golosinas en una carreta en forma ambulatoria y también el pan lo vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de golosinas y venta de pan. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chupetes, caramelos, chicle y pan al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 39, is a member of the “EL MOLINITO II” (The Little Mill II) communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily chores with the sale of sweets and bread.  She sells her wares from a cart in an ambulatory fashion; she also sells the bread this way.  She works from 6am until 7pm and wants to expand and improve the business of sweets and bread sales.  She is asking for a loan to buy frozen fruit treats, candy, chewing gum and bread at wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy frozen fruit treats, candy, chewing gum and bread at wholesale.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew, 51, is married with 8 children between 10 and 28 years. Four of the children are currently attending school. He has been farming for the last twelve years and sells his milk to a local cooling plant and tea to the local market. 

He has requested a loan of 50,000Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. His primary challenge has been lack of enough animal feed.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es: El Sr José  Dolores R.   labora como supervisor de limpieza es soltero, es el # once del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece la oportunidad que  le han dado esta institución con  este  desembolso para realizar  compra de  materiales de construcción como  cemento, bloque, hierro y útiles escolares, y mano de obra  de su vivienda ya que lo necita ampliacion de un cuarto para darle una mejor condicion de su familia.
texts.en: Mr. José Dolores R. works as a janitorial supervisor. He is single and this is the eleventh loan that CEPRODEL has offered to him. He is grateful for the opportunities this has given him, and he will use this loan to buy construction materials like cement, cinder blocks, and iron bars, as well as to pay for labor and school supplies. He would like to expand a room in his house in order to offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and pay for labor

loans.name: Angel Segundo

texts.es:
Angel Segundo R. A. tiene 30 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

ANGEL  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener ingresos estables.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Angel Segundo R. A. is 30 years old, married, and he lives with his wife and with the unmarried children in the community of Guaranda of the Bolivar province. He has 4 children. 

The members of the group named Enmanuel live in the district of San Juan, belonging to the community of Guaranda. This group is made up of 17 members and they are dedicated to short-cycle agriculture including the cultivation of corn, wheat, and potatoes in large quantities, and they also raise livestock such as pigs and poultry. 

Angel is an agriculturist who plants corn and he raises pigs and poultry. He purchases feed for his livestock from the Silva commerce center every weekend. He sells the livestock at the fairs on Thursdays in the city of Guaranda. 

He requests a loan to plant corn, wheat, and potatoes and to purchase more livestock and their feed. With the support of this loan he will be able to meet his financial needs and he will be able to face challenges such as plagues and blights and the changing weather. His dream is to have a steady income. 

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: to plant corn, wheat, potatoes and to acquire livestock

loans.name: David

texts.en: David B. O. O. is a member of Favour Self-Help group in Faulu Kenya where he operates a retail shop.  He has run his shop for three years. Being a member of the Self-Help group, he is able to save money and access loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other's loans.  He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy maize flour, sugar, tea leaves, and soda.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, sugar, tea leaves, and soda

loans.name: Rwengoma Twkirize Group

texts.en: Elizabeth is a forty-seven year-old single mother of four children, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after her children.  Her greatest desire is to educate them up to university.  After separating from her husband, she decided to venture into goat-selling, and she also set up a retail shop.   She has been in business for four years. Elizabeth has challenges of limited capital to meet the demands of her customers and her dream is to own a ranch.  Elizabeth intends to use the loan to buy goats, rice, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats, rice, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie A. is 55 years old and married with three adult children. She is from the village of Inroad, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a business providing service-based services. Her main source of income comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. 

Rosemarie joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Rosemarie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
From a marriage turned sour, Edna P., 44, now shifts her focus to her children and business. Edna finished only high school but is striving hard to make her business work, as well as her relationship with her family. Edna is already separated from her husband and has children who attend school or are working. The family lives in Carmona, Cavite.

Edna has a sari-sari (variety) store. Aside from making sure her products are in line with the demands of her customers, she also takes good care of an apartment which she rents out. Selling electronic load for mobile phones is also a part of her business. She earns around Php10,600 monthly.

To help increase her business, she has applied for a loan of Php20,000 to purchase more grocery items including sacks of rice, cases of soft drinks, charcoal, a cell phone load, and a stock of SIM cards. Edna says the loan will help a lot in making ends meet. 

One struggle Edna has is the high cost of the products she sells. But given the loan, she believes that she will have increased sales and profits. Edna hopes her sari-sari store will grow into a mini grocery. To have her own home and make sure that her children are happy are her goals. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: La señora Marlene oriunda de la Colonia  San Carlos a unos 15 kilómetros de la  localidad de San Jose, tiene casa propia que con mucho trabajo consiguió comprarse, su actividad es la venta de zapatos ella vende en la feria barrio lindo y mercado de la Zona,  convive con el Sr.  Luis el cual es motosierrista tienen 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Marlene comprara vidrios para las ventanas de su casita ya que por esta época de invierno el frio  esta fuerte, la Sra. es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, su deseo es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y personas de bien,  agradecida con la institución por el apoyo económico que le brinda para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marlene is from the small village of San Carlos, some 15km from the town of San José.  She owns her own home which she managed to buy with a lot of hard work.

Marlene's business is selling shoes.  She sells her products in Barrio Lindo street market and in the regional market.  She lives with her partner Luis, who is a chainsaw operator, and has three school-age children.  Marlene will use her loan money to buy panes of glass for the windows in her small home because in the winter it is bitterly cold.  Marlene is a very hard-working and responsible person whose wish is to see her children become professionals and upstanding citizens.  She is grateful to the institution for the financial support that they have offered her and which will help her to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy panes of glass for the windows in her home

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth  is 23 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Elizabeth has a business selling snacks. She earns about Php 1000 each month doing this type of work. Elizabeth has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, age 32, owns and operates a food shop where she makes and sells taho. She has had this business for four years. She and her husband have two children.

She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy the raw ingredients for making taho. 

Nancy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients for making taho

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 27 years old, married to Gilbert, and has two children. She has been running her business for the past six years. 

She has been loaned 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) by KADET Ltd. This is her second loan from KADET, she intends to use the loan to purchase knitting supplies like materials, different colors of threads, laces, designs, etc. 

She plans to use the anticipated profit to open a shop as she is currently a hawker. She would like to be in a central place where all her clients and customers can locate her easily and she can also have more stock. In the future, she hopes to open up a larger tablecloth shop.

loans.use: to purchase knitting supplies like materials, different colors of threads, laces, designs, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge  de 44 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena, con su cónyuge y sus hijos en las edades de 10 a 18 años, allí mismo en la terraza de su casa se dedica a la venta de fritos y comidas rápidas en general, negocio que inició  con muchos sueños y donde es apoyado por su cónyuge, pues estàn de acuerdo en generar ingreso para generar ingresos a su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia. Su actividad la realiza  diariamente pero el mayor volumen de sus ventas las realiza los fines de semana, en su mayoría los productos se venden de contado, aunque una pequeña porción de estos lo hace a crédito.  Su sueño es tener una casa propia y expandir su negocio para sentirse cada día mas prósperos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materias primas para la preparacion de alimentos y una carpa para proteger a su negocio y a su clientela  del candente sol y la lluvia al que ahora estàn expuestos porque su ubicaciòn al Norte del Caribe Colombiano, de sol playa brisa y mar asì lo exigen.
texts.en:
Jorge is 44 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with his wife and children aged 10 to 18.  On the terrace outside his house, he sells fried food and fast food.  He started this business with a lot of dreams and is supported by his wife.  They are in agreement as to their need to make income for the household and to get their family ahead in life.

Jorge carries out his business every day but he makes most sales on weekends.  He sells most of his products for cash though he does sell a small portion on credit.  His dream is to own his own home and to expand his business so that he can continue feeling more prosperous.  This Kiva loan is Jorge's first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy raw materials for preparing his food, and an awning to protect his business and his customers from the burning sun and the rain that they are now exposed to owing to their location on the North Caribbean coast of Colombia complete with sun, beach, breeze and sea.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making food, and to buy an awning

loans.name: Marcela Del Pilar

texts.es:
Marcela de 26 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres y hermano,  cuenta con servicios sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito La Matanza que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Marcela se dedica a la venta de cerveza, actividad que realiza desde hace algunos años, su negocio lo tiene en su domicilio, su clientela se incrementa mayormente los fines de semana donde realizan fiestas, se ha incrementado sus ingresos últimamente para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer Marcela a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de cerveza y también empezar a vender gaseosas y agua mineral, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y obtener mayores comodidades en su casa para sus padres.
texts.en:
Marcela is 26 years old, single, and lives in the house of her parents and her brother which has only  electrical services. It is located in the rural zone of La Matanza district, Piura department. Residents of this district are involved in agriculture, cattle raising, and artisan crafts.

Marcela sells beer, as she has done for some years. Her business is located in her home, and her customer base increases significantly on weekends when parties are held. She has increased her income recently and improved her quality of life.

Having the opportunity to grow, Marcela is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 new sols to buy a large quantity of beer and also, to begin selling soft drinks and mineral water. This should increase her earnings and the number of customers as well, helping her pay off the loan and obtain greater comfort in her home for her parents.

loans.use: buy more beer and expand her business with soft drinks and mineral water.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie is 53 years old and is married to a housekeeper. He has four children who are currently in school and hope to become professionals some day. Eddie is a farmer working in the Philippines, whose main crops are rice and corn. He also manages a hog-raising business. Eddie works hard and provides moral and financial support so that his children can finish their education through university and get married after graduation. 

Eddie is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional piglets to raise. His business goal is to improve his income from all of his businesses. Eddie will always support his children so that their goals become realities.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Nidya Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En una de las ciudades mas hermosas de Nicaragua llamada Ciudad de Granada , encontramos a Doña Nidya , de oficio costurera, madre de tres hijos, ella tiene 56 años de edad, esta casada lleva 20 años en este oficio de elaborar trajes para niños ya sean para bautizos , comuniones, también hace vestidos de boda y trajes para ejecutivos. Cuando ella inicio a cocer fue a los 20 años de edad, empezó a elaborar vestidos de niñas , luego con el paso de tiempo logro comprar 2 maquinas de cocer  con un préstamo que hizo, también compro materia prima para trabajar y  comenzar a elaborar ropa para niños que de hecho es en la línea que esta trabajando actualmente , hace diseños para vestuario de niños de buena calidad lo cual le ha permitido expandirse en el mercado de Granada, Masaya, Managua, Matagalpa, León, Chinandega ciudades en las cuales comercializa su producto. En este negocio le ayuda, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación.  
Solicito el crédito para comprar materia prima como tela, hilos, agujas, botones, alfileres de costura, ya que desea aumentar el volumen de producción y necesita suficiente materia prima para trabajar. Esta pensando llevar su producto fuera del país y abrir mercado en Panamá y Guatemala que es donde quiere dar a conocer sus diseños.
texts.en:
We find Nidya in one of the most beautiful cities in Nicaragua, the city of Granada.  She is a seamstress, and she has three children.  She is 56 years old and married.  For 20 years she has been in this business of making children’s outfits for baptisms and communions, wedding clothes, and suits for executives.

She was 20 years old when she started sewing, and she started by making outfits for children.  Then, as time passed, she managed to buy two sewing machines with a loan that she got.  She also bought supplies for work and to start making children’s clothing.  Indeed, this is the line of work she is in now. 

She designs good quality children’s clothing, which has allowed her to expand in the markets in Granada, Masaya, Managua, Matagalpa, León, and Chinandega.  These are the cities where she sells her product.  In this business it helps that her seamstress shop is in her house.

She requested the loan to buy supplies like fabric, thread, needles, buttons, and pins.  She wants to increase the volume of production, and she needs to have enough supplies in order to work.

She is thinking of taking her product outside of the country and opening markets in Panama and Guatemala.  She wants her designs to be known in these countries.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric, thread, needles, buttons, and pins.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
La señora Honorata de 43 años de edad vive con su esposo y con su único hijo que tiene 15 años, la señora tiene su propio negocio en su casa que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, fideo, leche, aceite), bebidas (gaseosas) y golosinas. 
Con el fin de expandir su negocio, la Sra. Honorata ha solicitado un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de más mercadería (abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas) para abastecer mejor su negocio.  Su gran objetivo es que su negocio crezca y tengan mejores ingresos para así tener una mejor calidad de vida. El Sueño de la Señora Honorata es construir la segunda planta de su casa (segundo piso), está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que le servirá para lograr sus objetivos trazados.
texts.en: Mrs. Honorata is 43 years old and lives with her husband and their only child, a son, who is 15 years old.  She has her own business in her home selling groceries (rice, noodles, milk, oil) and beverages (soft drinks) and sweets.  With a goal of expanding her business, Honorata has asked for a loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise (groceries, beverages, and sweets) to better stock her business.  Her main goal is to grow her business and to have better earnings to have a better quality of life.  Her dream is to build a second floor on her home.  She is very thankful for the loan as it will help her meet her goals.

loans.use: buy more merchandise (groceries, beverages, and sweets) to better stock her business

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Julius provides motorcycle or habal-habal services.  He has been providing these services for 6 years.  He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline and maintenance of his motorcycle.
Julius is a new member of HSPFI and hopes to improve his business in future.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada y vive con su hija D. diez años.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, es propietaria D. una tienda desD. hace ocho años. Su mamá se dedicaba a la panificación y al comercio y fue ella quien le enseño la actividad del comercio. A pesar D. que la señora Maria tiene un titulo universitario D. maestra, ella se dedica a atender su tienda, porque conoce bien el negocio.

Ella debe viajar cada ocho días a la ciudad, en busca D. los productos que venD. en su tienda, el viaje dura unos treinta minutos en autobús.

La señora Maria solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para surtir su tienda y D. esta manera satisfacer las necesidades D. los clientes y los productos que ellos demandan, ya que actualmente hay productos que los clientes buscan y ella no los tiene disponibles. 

Por lo que ella necesita el préstamo, para tener disponible lo que los clientes buscan, D. esta manera podrá obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan ayudar a su hija proporcionándole la educación, ya que ella desea que su hija sea una profesional como ella y así podrá también darle mejores condiciones D. vida a su familia.

Lo que más desea la señora Maria, es el tener bien surtida la tienda y realizarle a su casa mejoras como el  reparar el techo D. su casa, por que la duralita(material del que esta hecho el techo) esta podrido.
texts.en:
María, 48, is married and lives with her 10-year-old daughter.  She is a very hardworking woman.  She has owned a store for the last 8 years.  Her mother was a baker and a merchant and she was the one who taught her about commerce.  Despite María’s having a university degree as a Teacher, she tends to her store because she knows the business well.  She must travel to the city each week searching for the products she sells in her store.  The trip takes about 30 minutes by bus.

María is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to stock her store with the products her customers want and meet customer demand; at present, there are products the customers are asking for and she does not have them in stock.

She needs the loan, therefore, to have what her customers want on hand so that she can earn better income to proviD. her daughter with an education since she wants her daughter to become a professional like her and also be able to proviD. her family with better living conditions.

What María wants the most is to have the store well stocked and to do some home repairs, like repairing the roof because the duralite (material the roof is maD. of) is deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Makhburat

texts.ru: Махбурат замужем. Её муж парикмахер. На воспитание имеют двоих детей. Для содержания семьи она начала занимается торговлей детской одежды. И вот на протяжении 15 лет помогает мужу в содержании семьи данным видом бизнесом. К предстоящей холодной погоде ей нужно обновить товар. Для этого она хочет получить займ и пополнить ассортимент продаваемых одежд.
texts.en: Makhburat is married. Her husband is a barber. They are raising two children. She started to sell children's clothing to support the family. During the past fifteen years she helps her husband in supporting the family by doing this business. She needs to renew her inventory for the upcoming cold weather. Makhburat wants to get a loan to renew the variety of the clothing she sells.

loans.use: to buy clothing with the purpose of renewing the inventory.

loans.name: Unisa

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Unisa.  He is married, and has two children aged 11 and two years. He has two additional dependents, who live with him. 

In 1997, Unisa established his provisions shop.  It sells items such as mayonnaise, sardines, milk powder, butter, milk, choco show, soap and cigarettes. He began his business because he wanted help to abandon his shepherd job as he was a cattle raiser in the bush. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. 

Unisa requires a new loan in order to buy items to sell.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Unisa plans to establish a larger business, to travel to the holy land and to give his children a quality education.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mayonnaise, sardines, milk powder, butter, milk, choco show, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Epifanía Group

texts.es:
Keylin es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Epifanía, con apenas 18 años de edad, es una joven muy emprendedora, que tiene muchas  ganas de superarse, es estudiante y está por terminar la secundaria , vive con sus padres y hermanos,  siempre ha buscado la manera de ayudar a su familia, por ello realiza actividades comerciales, vende ropa y bisutería a sus compañeras del colegio y a vecinas de la comunidad, con la intención de ayudarse con los estudios y no ser una carga más para sus padres, que no cuentan con los recursos económicos necesarios para brindarle los estudios a ella y al resto de sus hermanos. 
Este es el primer crédito que solicita, gracias a la invitación y al buen ejemplo de su madre, que también pertenece a este grupo decidió integrarse. El crédito va ser de gran ayuda para ella ya que le permitirá invertir en la compra de mercadería, aprender desde ahora a administrar y hacer crecer su negocio, pero principalmente le dará la oportunidad de obtener un ingreso propio para poder seguir estudiando, ya que su mayor sueño es llegar a ser una profesional, capaz de ayudar a su familia y colaborar también a pagar los estudios de sus hermanos. 
En esta operación de crédito con Keylin están; Kenia, Flor y Xinia, que van a invertir en actividades comerciales y de avicultura.
texts.en:
Keylin is one of the members of "Banco Mujer Epifanía." At barely 18 she is a very enterprising young woman who has a lot of desire to get ahead. She is a student and is about to finish her secondary studies. She lives with her parents and siblings and has always looked for a way to help her family. So she engages in business activities, selling clothes and costume jewelry to her classmates at school and to the neighbors in the area. She intends to help herself with her studies and not be one more burden to her parents, who do not have the necessary economic resources to provide an education to her and the rest of her siblings. 

This is the first loan she has sought, thanks to the invitation and good example of her mother, who also belongs to this group she decided to join. The loan will be a great help to her since it will allow her to invest in the purchase of merchandise, and start learning how to run and grow her business. But primarily it will give her the opportunity to obtain her own income in order to stay in school, since her biggest dream is to become a professional, capable of helping her family and contributing also to the costs of her siblings' educations. 

In this loan operation, along with Keylin are: Kenia, Flor and Xinia, who are going to invest in business activities and poultry farming.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and costume jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a farmer in Kitale producing maize, milk, beans, and other vegetables for the local market. He is single and has been in farming for 20 years. He currently employs one farmhand.

Francis has requested for a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for a venture into the transport business. He says the transport business will help him improve his income and, later, expand his farming business.

Francis says farming has become competitive and requires more capital to produce sufficient quantities to be able to make a profit.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Katui

texts.en:
Katui is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She has been running a beauty salon for the last two years in order to make a living. She also does farming to supplement her income. Katui employs one person to assist her in managing the business. She has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. 
Katui is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy hair braids, weaves, hair chemicals and a hairdryer. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hair braids, weaves, hair chemicals and a hairdryer.

loans.name: Murtaz

texts.en:
Murtaz is from the village of Simoneti, West Georgia. He is 56 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife – Madona, his fifteen-year-old daughter, thirteen-year-old twin boys and his parents. 

Murtaz works as tinsmith in the village. He makes ovens and different products, which are sold locally. In addition to his main job, Murtaz is actively involved in family farming activities. The family has a milk cow. They produce cheese and sell it locally. Also Murtaz works in the family's 300 sq meter  greenhouse, where greens are grown. The greens are sold locally as well, to greengrocery retailers. The family's total average monthly income is 800 Laris, which includes the monthly pensions of Murtaz's parents.

Murtaz requested credit to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, as the old one is torn and can’t maintain the required temperature. With the new cover, Murtaz will be able to grow high quality greens in the greenhouse and sell them for a good price. This will positively impact on the income of the family. Murtaz will use the additional income to finance the daily expenses of his big family.

loans.use: to purchase a polyethylene cover for his greenhouse.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business in the Philippines of buying and selling dressed chickens. She has been in this business for 7 years now.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dressed chickens to sell. In the future, Rose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more boxes of dressed chickens to sell.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 46-year-old woman, married but with no children. She has been a travelling beauty expert for five years. On the request of her female customers, she goes to their houses to do their makeup or treat their hair and skin.  

Amal wants to purchase a new beauty kit to enhance her abilities at work. It would include hair oils and brushes, a hair dryer, skin creams, makeup colors...etc. In order to purchase the beauty kit, she needs to take a loan from FATEN of $2,000 to add to the sum she has already. 

This loan will enable Amal to enhance the quality of her work and increase her customers and income, allowing her to have better living conditions. The photo of Amal was taken in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase a beauty kit.

loans.name: Nthamba

texts.en:
Nthamba is 46 years old and married to Makau. She has been practicing  mixed farming whereby she keeps livestock as well as keeping poultry for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000.

She is requesting her first loan, in the amount of KES 5000. She will use the funds to purchase chickens and poultry feeds. With the anticipated profits she will save some money and also contribute to the needy in society.

Her hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Mahfooz

texts.en:
Mahfooz is a 24-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He describes himself as intelligent and an honest man.  His educational background is a diploma.

He operates a rehabilitation and training center that is primarily educational but also commercial. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs four staff members. His customers are students who have graduated from secondary school. He works diligently to teach his students computer skills and English.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. So he applied for a youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy computers for his business.

In the future, he would like to expand his business to open an institute of health.

loans.use: to buy computers for his training center.

loans.name: Luma

texts.en:
Luma is a 24 year old single woman from Baqa'a Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to pay for cosmetics products to sell to her friends and neighbors in the same of area. In the future she wants to open a shop also she hopes to continue her education and to buy a car.  
Since Luma is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.
Luma prefers not to display her photo on the internet, thus the above photo is of her mother.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Augustine Oremus Emilienne's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de cinq personnes qui sont des cohabitant. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier d’ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Hounsi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Hounsi est âgée de 26 ans et vit au Bénin. Hounsi est veuve et mère de huit enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et trois sont à sa charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Hounsi. Pour cette raison, Hounsi vend des boules d'akassa (pâte de maïs fermenté) accompagné de poisson frits, de la bouillie de maïs, du pain et des beignets. Hounsi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Hounsi ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, sollicite un premier crédit auprès d’ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du pain, du sucre et du poissons.

loans.name: Florentine

texts.en:
Florentine aged 39 years. She is married with 5 children aged between 3 and 15 years. 3 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 7 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare and to pay school fees of her children to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, is aged 43, married to an Engineer and unfortunately they doesn't have any child. Agnes owns and manages a car wash business in another municipality near in her resident location. She's been in this business for almost 1 year and earns a net income of PHP 1,200 daily. Due to insufficient capital she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to improve her car wash services. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To improve her car wash services.

loans.name: Edith Elizabeth

texts.en:
Edith lives in Monclova Coahuila. She has 4 children. They are her inspiration to work hard every day and continue with her business. She began her business two years ago with very little merchandise, but each day her clientele increases. Her business needs economic support, $200.00 USD to buy merchandise in order to have a greater variety of products. This will generate more customers who will prefer to go to her grocery store. Edith needs your support because she recently gave birth to her youngest daughter and the family\\\'s expenses have increased. Her husband works for a private company but his salary is not enough to cover all the household expenses. She is grateful for your kindness. Support them!

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Edith vive en Monclova Coahuila tiene 4 hijos en su familia y ellos son la inspiración de trabajar muy fuerte todos los días y seguir adelante con su negocio. Lo comenzó hace 2 años con muy poca mercancía, sin embargo día con día sus productos han aumentado y también sus clientes. Su negocio necesita de un apoyo económico de $200 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita tener una mayor variedad de productos, esto generara una mayor cantidad de clientes y la preferencia por ir a su tienda de abarrotes.

Edith requiere de tu apoyo, debido a que actualmente su hija mas pequeña es una recién nacida y los gastos familiares son mayores. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en una empresa privada por lo que su sueldo no es suficiente para cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar. Ella agradece tu cariño. ¡Apoyalos!

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane Muthoni Irungu intends to pay school fees for her grandchild

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin S., a 34-year old mother of 3 children who are in school, lives with her husband in Cambodia. S. sells fresh vegetables at a busy market and typically makes around US$6 per day in revenue, while her husband can make a moderate salary from operating a motor-taxi business. S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more vegetables in order to respond to the large demand.  One day, she hopes to own another stand in a market to make additional income from this business.

loans.use: To purchase extra vegetables for sale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 25 years old. She is married with one child. She is a member of Muthaiga United women group. Joyce joined the group so as to benefit from the women group revolving fund. She has attended the initial trainings that WEEC carries out on Group formation, group dynamics and the importance of the Savings and Credit scheme. The monthly group activities have enabled her to save USD 3 per month. She believes that her cosmetic business will benefit from the revolving fund and she will be in a position to generate more income in future. Joyce has applied for a loan of USD 150 to add to her business stock. She will make her monthly repayments at group level.

loans.use: Joyce wants to add more stock to her beauty shop

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda is 57 years old and married to Julián Caballero, who works in construction and contributes to the household income. They have 2 grown independent, employed children. They have an adopted 15 year old son whom they have raised since he was 7 months old. Hermelinda is a hard-working woman who owns a store and dining room where she offers meals to 30 employees of a factory near her home. Her passion for work began with the purchase of milking cows, from which she sold the milk and cheese she made herself. Upon seeing the necessity of a store in her neighborhood, she sold the cows and with that capital she began a well-stocked store and butcher shop where she could serve a greater number of customers. After 5 years of hard work and effort to always treat customers well and give them the best variety of products and prices, she was victim of 3 assults and robberies in her business. This caused a great loss to her business and forced her to close the doors of her business. Hermelinda says that this bad experience only held her back for a few months, and in that same year construction began of a large paper factory across from her home. Herme, as her friends call her, did not let this opportunity pass by. She approached those in charge of the work and offered lunch service for the workers, who accepted since day one. This business has been going for 7 years and little by little she restocked once again with the dream of having her store again, as it was before. Her loan is designated to buying merchandise for her store, such as sugar, tea, rice, meat, flour, noodles, oil, vegetables, and more.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Hermelinda tiene 57 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Julián Caballero que es de profesión constructor y aporta a con los ingresos de la casa. Tienen 2 hijos mayores, profesionales e independientes. Tienen un hijo adoptivo de 15 años que fue criado por el matrimonio desde la inocente edad de 7 meses. La Sra. Hermelinda es una mujer muy trabajadora posee una despensa y a la vez un comedor en donde brinda el arte de cocinar a las de 30 empleados de una fábrica cercana a su domicilio. Su pasión por el trabajo se inicio con la compra de vacas lecheras, de las cuales comercializaba la leche pura y el queso elaborado por ella misma; Al ver la necesidad de una despensa en su barrio, vendió las vacas y con ese capital dio apertura a una despensa bien surtida y que también cuenta con una carnicería en donde podía satisfacer a una gran clientela. Luego de 5 años de mucho trabajo y esfuerzo por mantener siempre bien atendida a sus clientes y darles la mayor variedad de productos y precios fue víctima en 3 oportunidad de asaltos y robos en su microempresa, esto causo una gran pérdida material a su negocio y la obligo a cerrar las puertas de su negocio. La Sra. Hermelinda comenta que esta mala experiencia solo la detuvo por unos meses, ya que en ese mismo año se inicio las obras para la creación de una gran fábrica de papel en frente a su domicilio, esta oportunidad no la dejo pasar Herme, como la llaman sus amigos, se acerco a los encargados de la obra y ofreció los servicios de almuerzo a los obreros quienes la aceptaron desde el primer día. Esta actividad tiene una antigüedad de 7 años y luego poco a poco fue equipando de nuevo su despensa con la que sueña volver a tener como antes. Su crédito está destinado a surtir de mercaderías su despensa, tales como azúcar, yerba, arroz, carne, harina, fideos, aceites, verduras y otros.

loans.use: Purhase of merchandise such as sugar, tea, rice, meat, flour, noodles, oil, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Ajose

texts.en: Ajose A. is 50 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Ajose in Lagos. She has been with LAPO as a client for the past 3 years. She comes from a rural area in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 1970. She sells all types of baby items and needs the loan of $400 to buy these items for sale.

loans.use: To buy more baby items for sale

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Ms. Blanca belongs to the Communal Bank “Luchando Por Nosotras” (Fighting for Us), and lives in Jr.Union Mz. 182 Lt. 1, in the Yarina Çocha district of the Ucayali department. She is 42 years old and mother of two girls, who are her pride. Her husband is an independent worker, but his income is not enough to cover the household expenses. With the first loan of U$ 100, received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a small food sales business. She presently has a restaurant located at her home. She gets up very early every day to prepare the delicious meals she sells to her many clients. With the recent loan of approximately U$ 435 received from Manuela Ramos and to be repaid in six months, she will buy 12 table cloths, 12 plates, 12 glasses, 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, a gas tank, oil, vegetables, etc. Blanca is very proud of her accomplishments, as she started with very little and is now expanding her business, which makes her very happy and grateful to Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal Luchando por Nosotras, vive en el Jr.Union Mz. 182 Lt. 1, del distrito Yarina Çocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años de edad y es madre 2 hijas que son su orgullo. Su esposo realiza trabajos independientes, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Blanca, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$100.00) decide invertir en un pequeño negocio de venta de comida. En la actualidad cuenta con un restaurante ubicado en su propia casa, donde todos los días se levanta muy temprano a preparar sus comidas para venderlas a sus clientes, que son muchos ya que la sazón de Blanca es muy exquisita. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1.300, (US$ 435.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 12 manteles, 12 platos, 12 vasos, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 1 balón de gas, aceite, menestras, etc. Blanca está muy orgullosa por todo lo que está logrando, porque empezó con poco y ahora ya esta ampliando su negocio y eso la hace muy feliz y agradece mucho a Manuela Ramos por los logros obtenidos.

loans.use: Purchase of consumables and combustible.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Oranges and mandarins are the products that Mrs. Flor de Maria Velázquez has been enthusiastically selling in the wholesale market in Managua for 20 years. Before selling these products she was a housewife. Recognizing the family's difficulties covering the household expenses she decided to invest the little capital she had in the purchase of oranges and mandarins in order to later market them.

We cannot overlook the usefulness of investing in the infrastructure of her business since she currently has neither walls not roof in her sales stall. She uses small pieces of wood to hold up the piece of plastic that protects her from the sun and rain.

Very wisely, Mrs. V. has used loans from Ceprodel to stock her business with an increased volume of fruit. Her greatest desire is to build her own market stall in order to offer better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Naranjas y mandarinas son los productos que muy esforzadamente vende la señora Flor de Maria V. en el mercado Mayoreo en Managua desde hace 20 años. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad su labor era desempeñarse como ama de casa, pero al contemplar que difícilmente cubría los gastos de su hogar decide invertir su poco capital en la compra de naranjas y mandarinas para luego comercializarlas.

No podemos pasar por alto que le es de mucha utilidad invertir en la infraestructura de su negocio ya que actualmente no posee techo ni paredes, sino que utiliza algunos trozos de madera que sostienen plásticos para cubrirla del sol y de igual manera de la lluvia.

Muy sabiamente, la señora V. ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel para surtir su negocio con mayores volúmenes de productos, su mayor anhelo es construir su propio tramo para brindar un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of oranges and mandarins

loans.name: Seyidaga

texts.en: Seyidaga was born in 1983, is single and lives in the town of Khachmaz. He has owned his business for three years. Mr. A. is requesting a loan of $725 to purchase additional food products for his grocery store..

loans.use: To purchase inventory for a grocery store

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en: Reyhan is a mother of 4 children. She was born in 1964. Five years ago, she started this business. She lives in the town of Khachmaz. Now, she needs a loan of $850 to buy clothes. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Chicas De La Raza 2 Group

texts.es:
The group Chicas de la Raza 2 (Girls of Race) is made up of the following members: Elizabeth Margarita, Margarita Concepcion who sell clothing for men, women and children and Mrs. Maria Gabriela who learned as a young child how to makes sweets and traditional cakes from her grandmother in the region of San Cristobal de Las Casa, which she sells to established businesses in the center of town. She is 38 years old, the mother of four and with this loan she will invest in purchasing more flour, eggs and all other items necessary to continue fabricating her bakery items.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

EL GRUPO CHICAS DE LA RAZA 2 LO FORMAN: ELIZABTH MARGARITA, MARGARITA CONCEPCION QUE SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE ROPA PARA TODA LA FAMILIA Y DOÑA MARIA GABRIELA DESDE MUY PEQUEÑA APRENDIO DE SU ABUELA HACER DULCES Y PASTELES TRADICIONALES DE LA REGION DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS, ENTREGA A LOS LOCALES COMERCIALES ESTABLECIDOS EN EL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD. ELLA TIENE 38 AÑOS, CUATRO HIJOS, CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE HARINA, HUEVOS Y TODO LO NECESARIO PARA CONTINUAR CON LA PRODUCCION.

loans.use: To purchase flour and eggs to make cakes.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap K., 33, and her husband, Mr. Tunh Chun, 38, were married in 1992 and have one daughter who weaves silk at home. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sopheap has been a weaver since she was sixteen years old. It is a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is a weaver as well. He learned his skill from his wife and started weaving in 1992. The couple sells their finished products to a middle man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. Sopheap is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk material for weaving and to build one restroom for family use.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to build one restroom.

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en: Mrs. Chhim N. is a poultry farmer in Khnong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a widow with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the three others are attending school. Mrs. Chhim N.’s business is now improved; thus, she wants to start another pig breeding business. So Mrs. Chhim N. asked for a loan to buy pigs to raise, and the rest of money she would use to buy pig food. Previously, Mrs. Chhim N. obtained a loan from AMK to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise, and the rest of money would be used to buy pig food.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
Fozilom Uktam is 28 years old, married, and has two children. Since 2007, he has been selling and repairing bicycles. He currently has a trading post in the local market, and sells various parts of different bicycles. When Fozilom began his business, he had little capital and had to request a loan in order to begin his business. Thanks to his first loan, he established a strong client base and sales have been steady since.

Fozilom would like to expand his business even further by increasing his inventory, and widening his customer base. In order to do so, he is requesting for a loan of $600 in order to purchase additional spare parts, and he would use the profits to further enrich his business.

loans.use: Purchasing of the spare parts for bicycles for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Hon

texts.en: Mr. Hon O. is 24 years old, and he is a firewood seller and pig breeder in Tang Tbeng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  His wife, Mrs. Mao Sum, is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetables.  On her plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have enough animals to plow her rice field.
