Thus, her husband decided to ask for a loan which they will use, along with his savings, to buy an additional cow to help plow.  Mr. Hon O. has two children who are both too young to work or study.  Previously, Mr. Hon O. obtained a loan from AMK (Kiva’s Field Partner) to start breeding pigs, and he paid it back in full.

loans.use: To help purchase an additional cow to plow

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: La señora Olga Marina M., es soltera, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de cinco hijos, dos ya trabajan, sus otros hijos dos de ellos cursan el segundo año de secunadrai y su ultimo niño tien nueve años y cursa el tercer grado de primaria, su compañero de vida y padre de sus hijos se desemepña como chofer en la alcaldia municipal de leon, su proposito en la vida es poder salir adelante con su familia, su  sueño es poder mejorar sus condicIones de vivienda, y mejorar su negocio siendo este una puleria donde a diario ofrece productos de uso y consumo diario para el hogar, teniendo mas de 17 años de tener este negocio con el cual ha sacado adelante poco a poco a sus hijos, dadndo inicio su negocio como una necesidad de aportar al nucleo familiar dado que su familia es muy numerosa, en la actualidad es un negocio que esta bine surtido tiene bastanet clientela en el sector ya que ofrece gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga Marina M. is 48 years old, single, and mother of five children. Two of her children work, two are in high school and her youngest son is nine years old and is in 3rd grade. Her husband is employed as a chauffeur in the Leon municipality. Her purpose in life is to move forward with her family and dream is to be able to improve the conditions of her home and improve her business. She has a store where she offers useful products and daily necessities. She has run her general store for 17 years with which she has been able to provide little by little for her children. Olga started her business as a necessity for supporting her very large nuclear family. In reality her business is well-established and she has several clients in the area since she offers a large variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr:
Dame A. Elise est née en 1979 à Aného dans la préfecture des lacs au Togo. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est revendeuse du haricot et de mais dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle achète ces céréales dans les villages reculés de Lomé et les conditionne dans les tonneaux et dans les bidons afin de les protéger contre l’effet des charançons. 
Compte tenu de l’évolution croissante de son activité et de la demande de plus en plus forte de ses clients, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 142 bols du haricot et 4 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsie A. was born in 1979 in Aneho in the Prefecture of Lacs in Togo. She is married and the mother of one child. She is a seller of beans and corn in the Agoe district. She buys her cereals in the villages outside of Lome and stores them in barrels and drums to pretect them from the effects of grain weevils.

Bearing in mind that her business is expanding and the ever increasing demand from her clients, she is requesting this loan to purchase 142 basins of beans and 4 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and beans

loans.name: Sinatambo's Group

texts.en:
Sinajambo N. D. cooks and sells soup and bread in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She is able to earn a profit of approximately $40 each month. She has previously taken out one loan through BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more charcoal and flour to use as she prepares the foods that she sells.

Sinajambo is 47 years old, married, and has four children, aged 13, 11, 10, and 4. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mwashamba, who also has a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and flour to use for the foods she cooks and sells.

loans.name: Yecica

texts.es: Yecica tiene 37 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos menores y vive en la casa de sus padres. Años atrás se dedicaba a sus quehaceres del hogar, pero ahora, hace un año está trabajando en el cafetín de la escuela de su barrio, por ello que a diario prepara el menú tanto para los docentes y alumnos de la escuela, esta actividad a ella le agrada mucho porque le genera ganancias a su economía, más que otras actividades, además que a ella le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, solo que a veces  le es dificultoso  cuando le falta ayuda para atender a sus clientes infantes,  en horas del recreo es donde más trabaja, muchas veces los niños se llevan sin pagar las golosinas.  Este es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, en todo este tiempo ha sido puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero va a comprar una refrigeradora para que pueda realizar chupetes de hielo y vender a los niños.
texts.en:
Yecica, 37, lives with her common-law husband and two children in her parents' house. She used to be a homemaker, but a year ago she started working in the school cafeteria. She prepares the daily menu for the teachers and students. Yecica enjoys this activity because of the good profits it generates, and because she likes to be in contact with people. What she finds most difficult is that she does not have an assistant, especially during recess, when sometimes the students take candy without paying. This is Yecica's fifth loan through Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. She has always made her payments on time. Yecica will use the loan to purchase a freezer to make ice popsicles and sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a freezer to keep ice popsicles

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Yao T. est âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il réside à Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de Lomé la capitale togolaise. Il fait depuis 6 ans des pépinières de palmiers, de cocotiers, des tecks et des orangers. Il souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son activité en achetant des entrants. Avec les gains qui seront issus de son activité, Yao pourra mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yao T., 45, is married and the father of 4 children. He lives in Lavie, a village located about 135 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. For 6 years now, he has been raising seedlings: palm, coconut, teak, and orange trees. With this loan he is hoping to increase the capacity of his business by buying amendments for his soil. With the additional profit that he will make from his business, Yao will be better able to support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing fertilizer, etc. for his tree farm

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio, who lives with his eight children in Ahuachapan, El Salvador has worked as a wood cutter for over 20 years. In his words, Julio works hard to "move the family forward"--hard work which includes not only his day job as a cutter, but also the cultivation of beans and corn.

With this home improvement loan, Julio is hoping to improve the quality of the walls in the room where his four youngest school-aged children sleep. Currently the walls are made from wooden slats and Julio would like to better insulate the room. Though this home improvement is necessary for the health of the family and in his opinion should come first, Julio hopes to apply for further loans in the future that would allow him to buy a chain saw for his wood-cutting work.

loans.use: insulating the walls of children's room

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 45 year old Asha N. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children, between the ages of 12 and 16. Asha has been running a grocery business. She works at the business for 13-16 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Asha currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase grocery items. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and variety of the stock. Asha thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход мужчина 31 года , женат имеет четверых детей.Жена торгует на базаре Костакоза фруктами.Сам Фарход жарит и продаёт на рынке мясным шашлыком.Кроме этого он занимается откормом и продажей скота.У него сейчас 9 баранов.Для закупа корма и скота он решил получить кредит.Ему по уходу за скотом помогает его жена.
texts.en:
Farhod is 31 years old, married, and has four children. His wife sells fruit at the Kostakoz market. Farhod himself grills and sells meat shish-kebab at the market. In addition, he feeds and sells livestock. He currently has nine sheep. He decided to request a loan to use for purchasing feed. His wife helps care for the animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and sale

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria A. tiene 45 años de edad, ella reside en la colonia morazan desde hace 10 años y esta casada con el Sr. Jose Nuñez, con el cual han tenido 3 hijos delos cuales uno esta en el colegio. su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, el tiene un negocio de venta de agua no purificada (agua para servicios y lavar ropa) el la vende en varias comunidades en donde no tienen agua potable. 
la Sra. A. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, ella tiene 11 años de realizar esta actividad, y ha logrado sacar adelente a sus hijos, ella necesita el credito para mejorar su vivienda y asi poder tener mejores condiciones de vida.
su deseo es poder arreglar bien toda su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria A. is 45 years of age. She has resided in Colonia Morazan for the last 10 years and is married to Mr. Jose Nuñez. Together they have had 3 children, of whom one is in high school. Her husband helps her with the expenses of the home as he has a business selling unpurified water (for services and to wash clothing). He sells water in different communities that do not have potable water. Mrs. A. has worked for 11 years making and selling tortillas. She has been able to help her children get ahead, and she needs the loan to improve her home to better their living conditions. Her desire is to be able to fix up her whole house.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy vive en la Avenida “ Periferica” D.  la zona Villa Cooperativa. en la ciudad D. El Alto.
 
Por circunstancias familiares Ella se separó D. su esposo hace varios años atrás  quedándose junto a sus hijos D. 21, 18, 15 y 12 años D. edad,
quienes colaboran en el negocio D. su madre.
 
Posee un puesto D. venta D. comida ubicado en las afueras D. su domicilio. 

El crédito lo destinará  para compra D. insumos para aumentar sus ventas  y así sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Nancy lives on Periferica Avenue in the neighbourhood of Villa Cooperative in El Alto. Because of the family's circumstances, she and her husband separated a number of years ago. Today, Nancy lives with her children who are 12, 15, 18, and 21 years old and who help her with her business. Nancy sells meals from a stall that is a little ways from her home. This loan will be used to buy ingredients for her meals so that she can increase her sales and thus, her income. This is her first loan from Impro but their evaluation has deemed her eligible to receive it.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima N. est un jeune célibataire, photographe de profession.  Il est aussi enseignant dans son métier de photographe et de la langue l'arabe dans les écoles.  En plus, il fait des reportages dans les cérémonies. Il est à son premier prêt avec lequel il veut acheter des appareils photo pour renforcer son activité. Les bénéfices lui permettront de bien rembourser son prêt et de mieux se soutenir.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima N. is a young unmarried man and a photographer by profession. He is also a teacher of this profession and of the Arabic language in schools. In addition, he does reporting on special events. He is on his first loan, with which he wants to buy photographic equipment in order to enhance his business. The profits will enable him to repay his loan and to do better in supporting himself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy photographic equipment

loans.name: Leela Group

texts.en: Leela is the leader of the four-member Leela group. Each member wants to take out a loan for their own business. Leela wants a loan for her tailoring business, M. Naseer wants a loan for his business of selling fruits and vegetables, Gul S. wants a loan for the business of quilt-making, and M. S. wants a loan for his general store. They are all very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For developing their businesses.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde niña realiza las actividades de la agricultura, donde su esposo y sus hijos trabajan a su lado. A Modesta le gusta mucho estar en el campo y respirar el aire puro, además, a pesar de los problemas climáticos que ocurran, siempre sus cultivos les deja ganancias suficientes para sostener las necesidades de la familia. Modesta está muy acostumbrada a realizar estas tareas, por lo que siempre planea su futuro en torno a esta actividad, donde generalmente produce papa. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, su trabajo en su banco comunal ha sido muy satisfactorio, por lo que ha decidido continuar trabajando de manera solidaria con su grupo. El dinero que está requiriendo será invertido en la compra de semillas mejoradas de papa y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Modesta is 48 and lives with her husband and children in their own home. Since she was a girl, she has practiced agriculture. Now her husband and children work at her side. She likes to be in the fields a lot and breathe the fresh air. In spite of the problems with weather that might occur, her crops always earn enough profits for them to sustain their family. Modesta is very accustomed to doing this work, and she always has planned her future according to it. She generally produces potatoes. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. Her work with her communal bank has been very satisfying, so she has decided to continue working in a supportive manner with her group. The money that she needs will be invested in the purchase of improved potato seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Manuela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Paz II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 38 años y es madre de 02 hijas, todas ellas ya independientes, pero que la apoyan en el negocio.

Tiene años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicio de llamadas telefónicas local, nacional e internacional , su negocio se encuentra ubicada en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, comprando un celular y un teléfono, todo esto para empezar. Así, siguió superándose y hoy en la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, donde brinda el servicio, a los moradores de la comunidad. 

 Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00,  comprara mas celulares y teléfonos fijos, para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente, parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando tarjetas virtuales y físicas.

Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio.
Manuela dice: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Manuela is a member of the Community Bank "La Paz II" in the district of Tarapoto - San Martin Province, San Martín state. She is 38 years old and a single mother of 2 daughters, all of which are already independent and help in the business.

She has been in the telephone service business for several years, offering local, national and international phone calls. The business is located in a well established building that allows her to take care of her customers. She started with a loan from Manuela Ramos, buying a mobile and a regular phone, and then she kept growing and currently provides the service to residents of her community.

She is asking for a loan of $525 to buy more mobile phones, regular phones and phone cards to provide a better service to her customers. She is an independent woman who manages and makes decisions in her business. Manuela says “To be a member of a group of women has helped her to learn more about her rights and to work as a group to be respected.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Somu Yie Group

texts.en:
Monica is twenty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to a girl.
She is a trader. She trades in cereals: rice. Monica is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Somu Yie’ which literally means hold it firmly. They work very hard to support their spouses to provide for their respective families. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and or farmers. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from Kumasi, and sometimes from nearby communities, and sell at the market square in their community. Some of the members trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. It is their desire to develop their businesses to be able to improve upon their standard of living. The members have been in business for some years and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. 

In this group, the members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan. They are requesting the loan to procure more goods to be able to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy inventory.

loans.name: Kuña Kuera Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Graciela T. quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La señora Graciela T. se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en general, invirtió el dinero en la compra prendas en general de esa manera ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. 

La señora Nancy del Carmen A.  se dedica a la venta de bebidas, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías al por mayor y venderlos obteniendo así mayor ingreso, y variedad para su clientela. 

La señora Patrocinia A. se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestibles y así ofrecer mayor calidad, variedad a sus clientes. 

La señora Maria Sachelaridi se dedica a la venta de ropa, invirtió el dinero en la compra de prendas en general, logrando ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. 

La señora Francisca A. se dedica a la venta de bijuoterie, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías, logrando ofrecer variedad y buenos precios a sus clientes. 

La señora Norma Britos se dedica a la venta de frutas, invirtió el dinero en la compra de  esas mercaderías al por mayor ofreciendo buena calidad y variedad de frutas a su clientela. 

La señora Gilda Britos se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería,  invirtió el dinero en la compra de ese producto al por mayor ofreciendo calidad y buen precios a sus clientes. 

La señora Mónica Ramírez se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestibles, logrando ofrecer calidad y variedad a su clientela

La señora Silvia Ramona posee una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías en general (azúcar, yerba, lácteos, etc.) pudiendo ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y  aumentar su ingreso. 

La señora Mirtha M. se dedica a la venta de leche,  invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo, logrando dar un servicio a sus clientes. 

La señora Birina M. posee una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías en general (panificados, lácteos, yerba, azúcar, harina, huevo) ofrecer gran variedad de productos a su clientela. 

La señora Isidora M. se dedica a la venta de bebidas y Helados, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías en general logrando buena variedad de sus productos para sus clientes. 

La señora Antonia G. posee una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías (bebidas, panificados, lácteos, harina, aceite) ofreciendo  calidad y variedad a su clientela. 

La señora Denise se dedica a la venta de lencería, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esas prendas en general, ofreciendo buena variedad de prendas a sus clientes. 

La señora Mirna C. se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, invirtió el  dinero en la compra de prendas en general logrando obtener mayor variedad que ofrecer a su clientela. 

La señora Rosa F. se dedica a la venta de verduras, invirtió el dinero en la compra verduras logrando ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. 

La señora Hilaria D. posee una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías en general (lácteos, panificados, bebidas, etc.) logrando ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The contact that started the present committee was Ms. Graciela T. who invited and organized her friends to form part of the program of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs.

Ms. Graciela Toleda sells clothes, investing her money buying an array of clothing so that she can offer the best variety to her customers.

Ms. Nancy del Carmen A. sells drinks, investing the money in buying these goods at wholesale, offering a variety to her customers and allowing her to increase her profits.

Ms. Patrocinia A. sells food, investing the money in buying ingredients that she uses to make her food so she can offer the best quality and variety to her customers.

Ms. Maria Sachelaridi sells clothing. She will invest the money to buy various clothes so she can offer the best variety to her customers.

Ms. Francisca A. sells jewelry and trinkets, she will invest the money into buying these to offer the best variety and price to her customers.

Ms. Norma Britos sells fruit. She will use this money to buy wholesale to offer the best quality and variety of fruit to her customers.

Ms. Gilda Britos sells small wares. She will invest the money to buy at wholesale to offer the best quality and good prices to her customers.

Ms. Mónica Ramírez sells food. She will invest the money in ingredients to produce her food, offering quality and variety to her customers.

Ms. Silvia Ramona has a small store. She will use the money to buy general goods (like sugar, tea, milk, etc.). This will allow her to offer her customers a greater variety and increase her income.

Ms. Mirtha M. sells milk. She will invest the money in buying supplies for her job so she can continue to offer this service to her clients.

Ms. Birina M. has a small store. She will invest the money in buying general good for the store (baked goods, milk, tea, sugar, eggs, flour, etc.) so she can offer a great variety of products to her customers.

Ms. Isidora Morena sells drinks and ice cream. She will use the money to buy more of these products in order to acquire a good variety for her customers.

Ms. Antonia G. has a small store. She will use the money to buy general goods (drinks, baked goods, milk, flour, oil), offering quality and variety to her customers.

Ms. Denise sells lingerie. She will use the money to buy more products to offer a greater variety to her customers.

Ms. Mirna Cardoza sells various clothing. She will invest the money in buying a variety of clothes to offer a greater array to her customers.

Ms. Rosa F. sells vegetables. She will invest the money buying more vegetables to offer a greater variety to her customers.

Ms. Hilaria D. has a small store. She will use the money buying general merchandise (milk, baked goods, drinks, etc.) to offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing, food like eggs, bread, vegetables, etc., and  general goods to sell like sodas, fruit, milk, canned goods, tea, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Kike

texts.en: Kike is 40 years old and married with four children. She is a committed LAPO client. She is a seamstress and also sells tailoring materials ( items added to clothes in other to beautify it i.e. ribbons, linings, buttons, e.t.c.) she has been in business for eight years. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is 25 years old, married and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in a single room apartment. She is diligent and committed to her work of retailing assorted soaps and detergent, which she obtains from Kumasi, a nearby city.

She conducts the majority of her business through market centers and selling door-to-door. She has become very popular in her community because of the nature of her business. However, due to the lack of adequate funds, she is unable to purchase enough volume of supplies to turn a profit. She hopes to save more for her children's education and is sure that she can repay your loans on time because she has five years of retailing experienced.

loans.use: To buy assorted soaps and detergents.

loans.name: Las Esteritas Group

texts.es:
La señora Natividad C., natural D.  Huancayo, tiene 65 años, casada con 3 hijos vive en la zona baja D. Huaycan, distrito D. Ate, departamento Lima.
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace 1año y medio, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía comunal “Las Esteritas” integrada por 11 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: producción, comercio y servicio.
Natividad se dedica al alquiler D. cuartos desD. hace 10 años, empezó a trabajar en este negocio a raíz que su esposo falleció, no tuvo mejor idea que alquilar los cuartos D. su casa para así no  descuidar D. sus hijos y  contar así con un ingreso más para su hogar. Hasta el momento ha logrado construir su casa y mejorar la educación D. sus hijos.
Con su reciente préstamo lo invertirá en acondicionar los cuartos para alquiler y en el futuro le gustaría abrir una bodega.
texts.en:
Mrs Natividad C., 65, married with 3 children, comes from Huancayo and lives in the lower area of Huaycan, in the district of Ate, department of Lima. She has worked with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for one and a half years. She currently occupies the role of president of the communal bank "Las Esteritas", maD. up of 11 partners who carry out diverse activities such as production, traD. and services.

Natividad has worked renting rooms for 10 years. She started work in this business after her husband passed away as she didn't have a better idea than renting rooms in her house to increase her income for the home and avoid neglecting her children. So far, she has been able to build her house and improve the education of her children. With the current loan, she will invest in fitting-out the rooms for rental and in the future, she would like to open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in fitting-out rooms for rental.

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en:
N. Gorretti is thirty-two years old, is married with two children schooling, and has two dependents schooling, too.

Gorretti has operated a drug store selling medicines for over six years. She is using the loan to purchase various medicines to sell to her customers.

Gorretti is self-reliant and hardworking, and looking forward to stocking enough medicines to at least meet her customers’ demands. Her future hope is to construct rental houses for generating monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase various medicines for her pharmacy

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 21 years old.  He wants a loan to add stock to his general store. He hopes to attract more customers, especially those from outside his neighborhood.  In addition to his retail shop, Peter has a side business selling broiler chickens.

This will be Peter's first loan from KADET. He was introduced to KADET through an existing client.

Peter's hopes and dream are to improve his living standards and to be able to purchase his own motorcycle to transport goods to clients at market.  Peter can be described as a hardworking man who believes in his ability to succeed.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more stock for a small general store.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, 38, manages a variety store which is situated in her house. Though she is busy managing her business, she is very proud because her family has a harmonious relationship. She is happily married to Bernardo and they are blessed with two loving children. Jun-Jun, 18, is a college student and Jay Mark, 15, is a fourth-year high school student.

Wanting to support the education of her children, Juliana wants to make her variety store more productive; thus, she is requesting a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders for the expansion of her business. If the loan will be granted, she will purchase more merchandise such as soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Roselo

texts.en: Roselo is a 31-year-old hardworking father. He has been married to Jocelyn since 2001. They have two young children and the oldest is eight years old. His source of income is rice farming. He spends enough time on his farm to ensure its good condition. His family is his inspiration in life and he wants to provide the best for them. He also wants his children to have a proper education. A member of CEVI, he applied for a loan of PHP 11, 000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs he needs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Yanjinlham

texts.en:
N. Yanjinlham lives with her husband and son in the Bayanzurkh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is retired and her son, age 28, drives a taxi. Yanjinlham operates a groceries and dairy trading business in the city with the help of her daughter-in-law. She also sells firewood from her home to supplement her income. Yanjinlham started her business in 2002 and has built a stable operation over the years. She is a very hardworking businesswoman and is focused on the future. Her business has provided her family with financial stablilty and has enabled her to improve her quality of life. Yanjinlham has many plans for the future and says, "With continued success, I hope to buy a house for my son." She is requesting a 1,190,000 tugrug loan to purchase more dairy products to sell in her business. Yanjinlham and her husband, Shagdarsuren, are shown in the photo. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha L. is a villager in Preal village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Now she wants to expand her breeding pigs business; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy four more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Chhay Huon, is a teacher in the local teacher. This couple has two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is just 2 years old. Her husband and a child are presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy four more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: 14 De Agosto (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal 14 de Agosto esta formado por un grupo de Sras, que siempre buscan en la vida una oportunidad para su superación y desean que sus familia siempre tengan un poco de lo que no pudieron tener, viven en la comunidad de Zhidmad a unos 50 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, Zhidmad es una comunidad que cuenta con paisajes hermosos y la vegetación en su estado natural, en su mayor parte su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, los mas jóvenes han migrado a la ciudad en busca de una oportunidad de trabajo.

La Sra. Zoila J., es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto,  vive en sector de Guayan perteneciente a la comunidad de Zhidmad, tiene 43 años de edad, se encuentra actualmente casada, su esposo es albañil, actividad que le permite aportar económicamente al hogar y salir en adelante junto con su familia, la casa en la que habitan es propia y es el fruto y esfuerzo de años de sacrifico.

Zoila se dedica a la cría de pollos, vacas, y también a la agricultura, son tareas que su mamá le enseño desde que era niña, se lleva bien con todas sus compañeras y amigas por que se conocen desde que eran niñas, este es su 8 ciclo en la fundación y los prestamos le han servido para superarse un poco y fue la Sra. Maria B. quien la incentivo para integrarse a su bankito, nos comenta que los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en su negocio, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR, le entrega va a invertir en la compra de abono para su potrero, su gran sueño es poder terminar su casa.

La Sra. Nancy B.  vive en la comunidad de Cashapata en la parroquia de Zhidad tiene 27 años, se encuentra casada, su esposo trabaja talando madera aunque por el momento no trabaja mucho ya que tuvo un accidente en el cual casi se fractura la columna, y su brazo tuvo que ser operado y puesto platina, Nancy se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos pero también cría animalitos como chanchos, vacas, gallinas, pero la mayoría de estos son para su consumo ya que esta escaso el pasto por la sequía que existe en la región, este es su 8 ciclo en la fundación y se siente tranquila ya que los prestamos le están beneficiando en su hogar, y fue su mamá la que la incentivo para integrarse a su bankito, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR, le entrega va a invertir en comida para sus animalitos como es hierva, alimento para sus chanchos, etc., su gran sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a tener en sus estudios una carrera exitosa.
texts.en:
The August 14th Communal Bank is formed by a group of ladies who always look for opportunities to improve in life and desire for their families to have more than what little they already have. They live in the community of Zhidmad, which is 50 minutes away from the city of Cuenca. Zhidmad is known for its beautiful scenery and the natural state of its vegetation. Most of its residents and involved in agriculture and raising livestock. The majority of the young people have migrated to the city in search of job opportunities.

Sra. Zoila J. is a member of the August 14th Communal Bank. She lives in the district of Guayan which is where the community of Zhidmad is located. Zoila is married. Her husband works as a mason, which allows him to support the family financially so that they can move forward. She and her husband own their home, which resulted after many years of effort and sacrifice.

Zoila raises chicken and cows and is also involved in farming. Her mother taught her how to perform these tasks when she was a young girl. She gets along well with her friends and Communal Bank associates because they have known each other since childhood. This is her eighth loan cycle and each one has helped her improve a little bit at a time. Sra. Maria B. was the person who convinced her to join the Communal Bank. Zoila tells us that her business has greatly benefited from the loans. She will use her current loan from Fundación ESPOIR to buy compost for her pasture. Her greatest dream is to finish construction of her house.

Sra. Nancy B. lives in the community of Cashapata in Zhidad Parrish. She is 27 years old and married. Her husband chops wood for a living since he does not work due to an accident he suffered in which he nearly fractured his spine. His arm required surgery and metal plates. Nancy spends her time performing household chores, but she also raises pigs, cows, and chickens. Most of these animals are for personal consumption since there is little grass as a result of the drought in the region. She is participating in her eighth loan cycle with the Foundation. Nancy feels at peace because the loans have helped her household. Her mother was the person responsible for convincing her to join the Communal Bank. With her loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will purchase food for her animals, such as grasses, and feed for her pigs. Her greatest dream is for her children to have an education so that they can pursue successful careers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal feed

loans.name: Jenny-Ann

texts.en:
Jenny-ann E. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 28 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children.

Jenny-ann owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jenny-ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to repair her fishing boat.

Jenny-ann is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for repairing her fishing nets. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC, and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.  (The fishing activity of Jenny-ann is fish fence commonly known as "bunsod".  It is made of bamboo posts attached with nets.  The cage appears in the photo is the end point of the wide fence where the fish, crabs,and squids can be trapped.) 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair her fishing nets

loans.name: Feliciano Antonio

texts.es:
Feliciano Antonio Pérez Velásquez, Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua.
 El tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido once   crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc,  perlines, y mano de obra para el techo de su casa de habitación  por lo que anteriormente el techo de su casa se encontraba en mal estado y en invierno el agua se pasaba.
Feliciano dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel su vivienda ha venido mejorando ahora es mas segura y mi familia vive en mejores condiciones que antes.
texts.en:
Feliciano Antonio works as a hygienist in the "Iván Montenegro" marketplace in Managua. He is married and has two school-aged children. He has been working with CEPRODEL for the past eight years. Up to now he has had eleven loans which he has used to make improvements to his home. He requested this loan in order to buy building materials, such as zinc metal sheeting, and pay for labor to install a new roof, as the old one was in bad shape and leaked. Feliciano appreciates the loans he has received through CEPRODEL. He has been able to improve his home and his family is now more secure and lives under better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the roof in his home

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 47 years old and married with eight children between the ages of five and twenty, seven of whom are attending school. He is a dairy farmer near Litein in Western Kenya and has been farming for twelve years. He sells his milk through the Kenya Cooperative Creameries and also earns income from small-scale farming of coffee and tea. He says that the main challenges to his business are diseases that affect his livestock and lack of sufficient feed.

He requested this first loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 40,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the added dairy cow will increase his family's income and that, in the future, he would like to produce over fifty liters of milk a day and construct a modern dairy unit that can keep up to five cows.

He thanks Juhudi Kilimo for this loan and says that he will request further funding from Juhudi after he completes this loan.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Modesto Noel

texts.es: Modesto Noel tiene 62 años, por lo que su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de sastrería. Hace más de 40 años que se dedica a este negocio este financiamiento no ha sido su primera experiencia, pues siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos por lo que sus inicios se dan como una necesidad de buscar una fuente necesaria para su hogar. Por lo que tiene muchos clientes que le ha realizado diferentes encargos y quiere entregarlos. Es por eso el motivo que solicita este financiamiento que es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, tijeras y zipper. Su deseo es mejorar su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Modesto Noel, 62, has made a living as a tailor for more than 40 years. This isn´t his first loan. He has long worried about improving his income, right from the beginning when he started the business because he needed a source of income to pay household expenses. He has several customers who have placed orders and he needs a loan to fill them. He will use the loan to buy material, thread, buttons, scissors and zippers. His greatest hope is to improve the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sèdé Yvette

texts.fr: Née en 1955, G. Sèdé Yvette vit depuis près de 55 ans au quartier Missessin  à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Sèdé Yvette est mariée à KAKPO Martin et est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Sèdé Yvette vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les charges de la famille. Sèdé Yvette a très peu fréquenté. Il y a près de deux ans, afin d’apporter une aide financière à sa famille, Sèdé Yvette vend divers produits (dentifrices, lait, conserves, pâtes alimentaires, savons, biscuits, couscous, bougies, etc.) à la devanture de sa maison. De façon secondaire, Sèdé Yvette vend du charbon de bois, ce qui lui permet d’avoir une autre source de revenu. Sèdé Yvette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu trois crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Sèdé Yvette sollicite un quatrième prêt afin d’augmenter le volume de son activité et de mieux répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1955, Sèdé Yvette G. has been living for the past 55 years in the Missessin borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Martin KAKPO and is the mother of one child who has had schooling. She herself has not attended school very much. Sèdé Yvette helps her husband deal with family expenses. To bring financial support to her family over the past two years, Sèdé Yvette has been selling various products from the front of her home (toothpaste, milk, canned goods, pasta, soap, cookies, couscous, candles, etc.). As a secondary activity she sells charcoal, which provides her with an additional source of income. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. She is a regular client of ALIDé, having already been granted three previous loans, all reimbursed in full. She is now requesting a fourth loan to increase her activity and respond to a strong customer demand.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products (sugar, pasta, couscous, milk, cookies, soap, canned goods)

loans.name: Urania Del Carmen

texts.es: Urania es una señora de 49 años, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación junto a su esposo e hijos, su negocio es una pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos desde hace un año, pues anteriormente tenía un taxi, el cual vendió ya que no estaba dando los resultados, mas bien tenían que invertir en el. Con este préstamo desea invertir mas en la pulpería en productos de leche en pote para bebe, granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, pollo, carnes y otras variedades de alimentación para ofrecer a sus clientes y competir con la demanda. Con su crédito anterior logro hacer un cuarto en su casa el cual se ha beneficiado a través de estos financiamientos.
texts.en:
Urania is 49 years old and lives with her husband in a neighborhood called Villa Reconciliacion. Urania has been running a small store for about a year, where she sells a variety of products. Prior to that, she drove a taxi, but she sold the taxi because it wasn't generating good results. It was better for her to invest in her store. This loan will be used to purchase milk, basic grains, sweets, sodas, chicken, meat and other grocery staples for her customers. She has benefited already from these loans, as her previous credit helped her to set up her store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items for her small store, such as basic grains, milk, sodas, chicken, meat, etc.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie B. is a 34-year-old woman from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. Marjorie is married and has 1 school-age child. To earn a living, Marjorie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. More specifically, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells a variety of products to her local community members. Marjorie has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Marjorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to engage in business activities and, in turn, to improve her standard of living. Marjorie has recently successfully repaid a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. That prior loan was used to purchase additional inventory and to increase her working capital. Marjorie is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 16,000 PHP ($375), which will be used to further expand the business. Notably, this loan would be the fifth loan taken out by Marjorie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and it reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To further expand her business

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction equipment

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Elaine G. is from the village of Barangay Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 26 years old. Elaine is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Elaine raises pigs for breeding. Elaine has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month in these activities.

In 2009, Elaine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elaine is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Elaine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family. 
                                                                                                                                                      
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her field and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta M. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old. Julieta is married and has 7 adult children. She owns & operates a seafood business where she buys and sells different types of ocean-caught fish. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Julieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Pedro lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Virginia Velázquez quienes hace ocho años inicio con la venta de gaseosas y jugos actualmente comercializa cosméticos. Ella es madre y padre de joven de 19 años el cual está en su último año de secundaria.
  
Los otros integrantes de grupo son Jeni C. Valberde y Norlan C. ambos se dedican al comercio de pollo crudo. Ellos con el préstamo invertirán en su negocio para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The San Pedro group is made up of three hard working, dedicated, enterprising people. One of them is Virginia Velázquez. Eight years ago she started selling soft drinks and juices and now sells cosmetics. She is both mother and father to a 19-year-old son who is in his last year of middle school. The other group members are Jeni C. Valberde and Norlan C. both of whom are raw chicken merchants. They will use the loan to invest in their business to continue forward.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cosmetics.

loans.name: Marizol Albina

texts.es:
Marizol pertenece al Banco Comunal Bonanza hace 2 años y lo que mas le agrada es la facilidad del préstamo.
Marizol vive en la casa de sus suegros, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años, Marisol vende quesos que compra de los intermediarios, sus productos los vende de casa en casa y tiendas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Marizol solicita un préstamo de 900 soles en la compra de quesos.
Marizol sueña con mejorar su negocio y comprar un terreno para la construcción de su negocio.
texts.en:
Marizol has belonged to the community bank Bonanza for the past two years. What pleases her most is the facility of obtaining a loan. Marizol lives in her in-laws' house with her husband and two children, aged 2 and 6. Marizol sells cheese she buys from middle-men from her home and direct to stores. She works every day. Marizol is asking for a loan of 900 soles for the purchase of chesse. She dreams of improving her business and buying a piece of land where she can build her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese

loans.name: Oyunbolor

texts.en:
Oyunbolor M. is 22 years old and lives with her mother and younger sister in Govi-Altay province, western Mongolia.  She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. She currently operates a small food retailing business in her town while her mother sews traditional costumes at her home. 

Oyunbolor started her food retailing in 2009 to earn a living for her family. After building a stable operation, Oyunbolor used some of her earnings to expand her business which enabled her to create a bigger customer base in the town. She attributes her success to her ability to deliver quality products to the consumer. 

Oyunbolor hopes to continue to grow her business in the future and is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies and products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and products

loans.name: María Agusta De La Fé

texts.es:
En las afueras de  Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa con un clima agradable y con una rica variedad de platos típicos. Encontramos el Banco Comunal  Los  Ángeles que se reúnen cada quince días.

La señora María esta en en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios, dice que le gusta porque siempre recibe los créditos a tiempo y sin ningún problema. Esta muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir porque le han ayudado en momentos difíciles. Mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 30 años, de la cual procreo 3 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, pero que aun viven en su casa.

Se dedica al comercio de ropa de todo tipo, además vende sobrecamas ya que según nos cuenta se venden mucho y deja buenas ganancias. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, pero también vende en su casa. Trabaja  tres o cuatro días a la semana unas cinco horas por día. La mercadería la compra una vez al mes en Guayaquil por que allá salen mas baratas.

Este nuevo credito lo va a utilizar para comprar sabanas y ropa de mujer ya que tiene muchos pedidos.

Su deseo es comprar un carro para ir a comprar y vender su mercadería mucho mas rápido.
texts.en:
In Portoviejo’s outskirts, a beautiful city with a pleasant climate and a rich variety of typical regional dishes, we find the Los Ángeles (Angels) communal bank which meets every two weeks. María has been a member of this communal bank since its inception. She says she enjoys it because she always gets the loans on time and problem-free. She is very grateful to Fundación Espoir because it has helped her in difficult times. She has been in a common law union for 30 years and has three children all of whom are adults but still live at home. She is a clothing merchant but also sells bedspreads because, as she tells us, they sell well and produce good profits. She sells door-to-door but also from home. She works three or four days a week about five hours a day. She buys the merchandise once a month in Guayaquil because it is less expensive there. This new loan will be used to buy bed sheets and women’s clothing because she has a lot of pending orders to fill. Her wish is to buy a car so that she can go buy and sell her merchandise much more quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's clothing and bed sheets.

loans.name: Rigoberta

texts.es:
Rigoberta pertenece al Banco Comunal Proyección.
Rigoberta es casada, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella, Rigoberta tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende carne, Rigoberta viaja a las ferias a comprar los animales. Además Rigoberta tiene un recreo en su casa llamado El Tambo en donde vende comida típica, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos.
Rigoberta solicita un crédito de 1000 soles para la compra de ganado.
Los sueños de Rigoberta son que sus dos hijas sean profesionales y tener mas capital.
texts.en:
Rigoberta belongs to the Proyección communal bank. Rigoberta is married and has 5 children, 2 of whom live with her. She has a stall in the 12 de Abril (April 12th) market where she sells meat. She travels to other markets to purchase the animals. In addition, Rigoberta has a patio in her house called El Tambo where she sells traditional food on Saturdays and Sundays. Rigoberta is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN ($375 USD) to purchase livestock. Rigoberta hopes that her two daughters can become professionals, and she hopes to have more capital.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of livestock.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia L. is from the village of Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 42 years old. Delia is married and has 4 school-aged children. She owns & operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Delia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Delia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishes to sell

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 40 years old and married with two children. Immaculee is well known for her business selling beverages and some pastries in her small shop. She has been in this business for about three years. The business hours are from 7 am to 9 pm every day.

Immaculee needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Immaculee will expand her business by purchasing more drinks, including beer, to satisfy the demand of her customers. Hopefully, she will earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. She will keep doing her best to build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: For more drinks including beer to satisfy the demand of her customers

loans.name: Kinyugunyu Turibamwe Group-Ibanda

texts.en: B. John is 49 years old and a father of seven. His longevity in his farming and agro-produce sales businesses stretches to a period of 30 years. It is been a chequered experience throughout these years of operation, but he is quick to add that his perseverance and strong-hearted attitude have been winners for him. His business is located at Kinyigunyu. 80,000 is what he says accrues to his business weekly. John says it is his parents who inspired him to begin this business. With this loan he says he is going to buy more land to expand his farming activities. He belongs to Kinyugunyu Turibamwe Group- Ibanda.

loans.use: The purchase of more land to expand his farming business

loans.name: Adelaida Olimpia

texts.es:
Adelaida Olimpia C. H. tiene 69 anos. Es viuda  vive con un sobrino, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 8 hijos todos mayores de edad.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.

Adelaida se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz trigo y papas además a los quehaceres domésticos, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo.  

Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es trabajar hasta que dios le permita.

Le gusta ir de visita a donde sus hijos por que ellos viven en la ciudad ademas le guata festejar las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Adelaida Olimpia C. H. is 69 years old. She is widowed and lives with a nephew in the canton of San Miguel, located in the Bolívar province. She has eight children who are all adults.

The members of the Unidos Somos Más solidarity group work in agriculture and the group is located 45 minutes from San Miguel in Ríos a la Costa. The group consists of approximately ten members, all of whom live in the same area and the majority work growing corn, wheat and potatoes.

Adelaida works in agriculture growing corn, wheat and potatoes, in addition to doing the household chores. She makes her purchases in the San Pablo parish and makes her sales at the San Pablo market.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The loan support will help her financially to meet her needs. Her dream is to work until God allows her.

She likes to go visit her children because they live in the city, and she also likes to participate in the area celebrations.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Kyabyakwaga Tukole Group

texts.en: Edisa T. is the leader of Kyabyakwaga Tukole group in Kyenjojo. She is 42 years old, married, and has five children. Edisa has a retail shop in Kyabyakwaga Trading Center.  Her business has existed for over five years. Edisa has always used loans from Pearl Microfinance and they have benefited her a lot both in business and for her family. She needs a loan to help her with restocking her retail shop with more goods for resale. It is a business she started on her own and she hopes to see it expand.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop with general merchandise

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Thirty-five year old Grace P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has a 7 year old child. Grace is a farmer. She cultivates her land to plant and harvests rice crops for sale. She also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells pork meat to their town's market. Grace does her best to help improve her family's living conditions.

Grace needs farm inputs and pig feed. She applied for a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI to buy the supplies that she needs. Grace is hopeful that this loan will help her farm and piggery immensely.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and pig feed.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria Cristina; ella tiene 49 años. Tiene 3 hijos y ella es casada;  La socia se dedica  a la administración de su propio restaurante, ella tiene un restaurante y prepara diferentes menús y extras a la carta en este local ella acondicionó un pequeño espacio en el cual exhibe adornos, vasos con decoraciones, flores, trabajos manuales y todo con motivos de matrimonios y fiestas de quinceaños, también hay para bautizos y otros eventos, la socia destina este espacio para promocionar la venta y alquiler de arreglo y armado de fiestas y eventos diversos. La socia  requiere el préstamo para la compra de adornos para la nueva famosa hora loca que existe en todas las fiestas desde las infantiles hasta los matrimonios, esta hora trae unos cotillones con trajes incluidos para bailar sin parar durante una hora. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar nuevos adornos y productos para amenizar la hora loca en todo evento.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina is a member of the “QORICHUSPA” community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Maria Cristina is 49 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her business is running her own restaurant.  Maria Cristina has a restaurant where she makes different set meals and a la carte meals.  She adapted a small space in her premises where she displays decorations, decorated vases, flowers and handicrafts for weddings, 15th birthday celebrations and also for baptisms and other events.  This space is used to promote the sale and rental of decorations and supplies for parties and other events.  She requires this loan to buy decorations for the new famous 'crazy hour' which takes place in all parties, from children's parties to wedding parties.  This hour sees an elaborate dance, with costumes included, where all the guests dance for an hour without stopping.  She is requesting this loan to buy new decorations and products for livening up 'crazy hour' in all these events.

Maria Cristina is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy new decorations and products to liven up 'crazy hour' at different events

loans.name: Mbithi

texts.en: Mbithi is 40 years old, married and a member of Faulu Kenya under the Bombolulu group.  He runs a "matatu" (van) transport business in the Kibera slums.  He has been engaged in this business for five years.  Currently, he has employed two people.  He hopes that someday he will open his own transport company.  He sees himself being a successful businessman in the next five years.  He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy paint and repair his van.

loans.use: To buy paint and repair his van

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Erika; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, ella es propietaria de 4 carros que hacen servicio de taxi y ella administra este negocio, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere ahorrar, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de servicio de taxi. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para los carros.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to El Molinito II Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Erika; she is 25 years old and is single. She combines her daily activities with a transportation business. She is the proprietor of four cars that provide taxi service, and she runs the business. Through this business, she wants to save money. The member wants to grow and improve the taxi service. The member is requesting this loan to purchase parts for the cars.

The member is happy to get the loan and promises to maker her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase car parts

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel C. is from the village of Samay, Gingoog City. He is 27 years old. Joel is single. To make a living, Joel owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks & other delicacies like homemade pizzas & hot cakes in the local community. Joel has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Joel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joel is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale such as flour and eggs. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Joel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale such as flour and eggs

loans.name: Dana

texts.es: Dana tiene 27 años, vive con sus padres en casa de unos familiares. Durante mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a la agricultura, pero desde hace un año que optó por la carrera de chef, puesto que ha considerado que el estar en esta profesión se le abre muchas oportunidades, ahora vende comida, negocio que le esta dando mucha satisfacción, Por otro lado cultiva papa, maíz y cebolla, productos que son cosechados alrededor de 6 meses. Le agrada cocinar porque considera que es su vocación,  además de que le genera buenas ganancias, es por ello que para el futuro desea tener su propio restaurante de comida tapioca de su zona con todos los estándares de calidad para todos los turistas que frecuentan su ciudad. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos y agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará algunos implementos que necesita para su venta de comida  como  sartenes, ollas, espátulas y cubiertos, así mismo también invertirá en la agricultura comprando sacos de abono.
texts.en: Dana is 27 years old and she lives with her parents in a house belonging to a member of their family. She has been dedicated to agriculture for a long time, but last year she opted to start a career as a cook. She believes that the profession will open up many opportunities. Today she sells prepared foods, a business that has brought her a great deal of satisfaction. She also cultivates potatoes, corn, and onions. They are the products that are harvested in about 6 months. She loves to cook and she sees it as her vocation and it also generates a good source of income. For this reason she hopes to have her own restaurant in the future, selling traditional foods from the region while holding only the highest standards in quality to provide for the tourists that visit the city. It is her second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to know she has this source of financial support.  She has demonstrated to be responsible with her payments and she is thankful to all those individuals who will contribute towards her loan.  It will be very useful in the development of her business. The loan that she requests will be used to purchase some kitchen implements that she needs to prepare foods, including  pans, pots, spatulas, and cutlery. She will also invest in her agriculture business by purchasing sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: To prepare ingredients.

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es: Dolores Del Carmen, cuenta con 55 años, posee una pulpería en su casa de habitación. Que está ubicado en el barrio de Guadalupe en Chinandega, en el vende golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas, jugos, sodas. Vive en compañía de su esposo y un hijo, su esposo se dedica a brindar el servicio de sastre, por lo que sus clientes le solicitan diferentes productos de prendas de vestir Dolores recibe el apoyo de su familia para con su negocio. Dolores está Solicitando un crédito para surtir de productos demandados y ofrecer una mayor variedad de golosinas y bebidas.
texts.en: Dolores Del Carmen is 55 year old, and she has a general store in her home.  This store is located in the Guadalupe neighborhood in Chinandega, and there she sells candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, juice and soda.  She lives with her husband and her son.  Her husband provides tailoring services; his customers request different types of garments from him.  Dolores receives support from her family for her business.  Dolores is requesting a loan to stock her store with products that are in demand, so that she can offer a greater variety of candies and drinks for sale.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, juice and soda for her store.

loans.name: Tetepec Group

texts.es:
“Tetepec” que en lengua mixteca significa: “En el cerro de Piedras”, se compone de “tepetl”- cerro y “c”- en, un lugar muy hermoso de vegetación muy variante, este es un grupo solidario integrado por 9 personas, la mayoría de las personas de esta población se dedican a la ganadería.
Isidora López Hernández es la representante de este grupo una mujer muy trabajadora de 34 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Fidel Pérez López  quien se dedica a la ganadería, tiene 4 hijos de las respectivas edades: 14, 8, 5 y 1 de los cuales dos estudian.
Isidora se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras como son: jitomates, cebollas, chile, plátano, manzana, papa, mandarina, ajo, huevo, entre otros; es por ello que solicitó el préstamo para comprar más verduras y obtener mas ganancias, ya que últimamente las ventas están muy bajas y no le alcanza para surtir y hay ocasiones en que el dinero solo le alcanza para comer, ella tiene 10 años vendiendo estos productos en su casa.
Otra de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Zoila Hernández de 54 años de edad quien esta casada con el señor Juan López que se dedica al campo, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 están casados y 1 falleció, tiene 4 niños pequeños bajo su manutención desde hace un año cuando falleció su hija la mama de los pequeños, ella trabaja mucho para poder darles alimento a estos pequeños, ella tiene que salir a vender varios tipos de artículos para el hogar y ropa de manera ambulante en diferentes poblaciones. Zoila trabaja muy duro para mantener a sus nietos a pesar de su edad es una mujer muy fuerte que trabaja desde hace mas de 30 años, anteriormente se dedicaba a otras actividades, ella solicito el préstamo para comprar mas productos como son: bandejas, platos, vasos, cucharas, jabonera y cubetas y así tener un poco mas surtido y obtener un poco mas de ganancia ya que con el dinero que le da su esposo no le alcanza, como el se dedica a la cosecha pues solo obtienen dinero cuando ya existen frutos para vender y ahí ocasiones que solo da la cosecha  para que ellos puedan comer.
La señora Zoila esta muy agradecida con las personas que proporcionan ayuda a gente humilde como ellos, que les prestan dinero para seguir con su negocio.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Isidora López Hernández: De 34 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de verduras para la venta.
María X Pérez: De 30 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de pan para la venta.
Zoila Hernández X: De 54 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de plásticos y ropa para la venta.
Dorotea Martínez Nicolás: De 47 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de merceria para la venta.
Luisa Martínez Nicolás: De 49 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de pan y tamales para la venta.
Sara López Nicolás: De 32 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de tamales.
Patricia Lourdes Sánchez Díaz: De 32 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de joyas para la venta.
Lucina Flora López Pérez: De 41 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de insumos para la venta de antojitos.
Julio Nicolás Nicolás: De 72 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de ganado para la venta.
texts.en:
“Tetepec” means “At the Hill of Rocks” in Mixteca.  It’s composed of “tepetl”- “hill” and “c” – at.  It is a very beautiful place with very varied flora.  This communal bank has 9 members; most of this area’s residents raise livestock.

Isidora López Hernández is the group representative.  She is a hard working, 34 year old woman, married to Fidel Pérez López who raises cattle.  She has four children who are 14, 8, 5 and 1 respectively; two of them go to school.

Isidora sells fruit and vegetables like: tomatoes, onions, chilies, bananas, apples, potatoes, mandarins, garlic, and eggs, among others.  This is why she requested a loan: to buy more vegetables and thus higher profits because lately sales have been very low and she does not earn enough to restock and sometimes there’s just money enough to eat.  She’s been selling these products at home for ten years.

Another group member is Mrs. Zoila Hernández , 54.  She is married to Mr. Juan López who is a farmer.  She has 5 children four of whom are married and one who passed away.  She has four little children dependent on  her since her daughter, their mother, died a year ago.  She works very hard to provide food for them.
