She has to go out to sell all kinds of articles for the home and clothing door-to-door in different towns.  Zoila works very hard to support her grandchildren.  Despite her age, she’s a strong woman who has worked for over 30 years.  She used to be in other activities.  She asked for the loan to buy more products like: trays, plates, glasses, spoons, soap dishes and buckets to have a bit more stock and earn a bit more profit because the money her husband earns is insufficient.  Since he’s a farmer he only earns money when he harvests and sells his fruit and sometimes the harvest is just barely enough for them to feed themselves.  Zoila is very grateful to the people who provide help to humble people like them; that lend them money so that they can continue working.

The members of this group are:

Isidora López Hernández, 34, who is a vegetable merchant.

María X Pérez, 30, who will buy ingredients to bake bread to sell.

Zoila Hernández X, 54, who will buy plastic items and clothes to sell.

Dorotea Martínez Nicolás, 47, who will buy merchandise to sell.

Luisa Martínez Nicolás, 49, who will buy ingredients to make bread and tamales to sell.

Sara López Nicolás, 32, who will buy ingredients to make tamales to sell.

Patricia Lourdes Sánchez Díaz, 32, who will buy Jewelry to sell.

Lucina Flora López Pérez, 41, who will buy ingredients to make fast food snacks to sell.

Julio Nicolás Nicolás, 72, who will buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John has applied for this loan to buy hair-cutting machines for a salon that he has run for the last three years. He is 34 years old, married, has three children and lives in a two-room house in the town of Kyenjojo. He works hard because he dreams of building his own house someday and making enough money to provide all of his children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy hair-cutting machines for his salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old Lebanese single woman living with one parent and one sibling. Despite her young age, she has been working for several years as a hairdresser. Her business is based at her house and she also serves customers at their domiciles.  In parallel, she has worked in a beauty salon since 2007. Her work is very important because she helps her family in paying the high cost of living. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies. In the future, she is planning to open a formal beauty salon in order to expand her business level.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ankadignongonye Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Ankadignongonye, sont toutes des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massoukou, sous préfecture de Fana; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers, de charbon de bois et de sel.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Ankadignongonye sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente MASSARAN compte acheter une diversité d’articles divers de boutique (sucre, lait en poudre, thé, cigarettes etc) avec les grossistes de la ville de Marka-Coungo. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au village de Massoukou, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce d’articles divers.
texts.en:
The women of the group Ankadignongonye are all married, and they average 33 years of age and four children each all living in traditional extended families in the village of Massoukou, sub-prefecture of Fana; Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in a variety of goods, charcoal, and salt. 

The group members are on their second solidarity loan. MASSARAN, a client, plans on using her loan to buy various store goods (sugar, powdered milk, tea, cigarettes, etc.) from wholesalers in the city of Marka-Coungo. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales each day in the village of Massoukou to a customer base of women and men. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to help cover the costs of societal ceremonies. The rest of the profits will be reinvested in her trade of various goods.

loans.use: to buy various store goods

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 53 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells both food and daily use products such as shampoo, soaps and detergents to the people in her community. Each month, Gregoria earns about 5,000 PHP from her business.

Gregoria is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional retail items such as canned goods, soft drinks and instant noodles to sell. In the future, Gregoria hopes to start a hog-raising business to generate more earnings and save funds for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her shop.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Daisy has a retail shop that sells rugs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials for making rugs. Daisy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Daisy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making rugs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 48 ans, mariez et mère de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 22 et 24 ans. Pour palier aux difficultés de sa famille et supporter les etudes de ses enfants , elle se lance dans la fabrique des beignets , son activité se déroule chez elle a domicile, ses ventes sont de 10.000 a 25.000 fr par jour.

A l'octroi de son prêt elle va renforcer son commerce en achetant deux sacs de farines, 1 sac de sucre de 50 kg de sucre, 2 bidons de 25 l d'huile, du sel , de la levure chimique 1 sac de 50kg de riz et 25 kg de lait.

A l'avenir , elle veut ouvrir une pâtisserie pour fabriquer différents gâteaux comme les brioches et cakes faire la livraison en gros et ouvrir d'autres coins de livraison comme dans les écoles, les marches et trouver des jeunes desoeuvres qui vont travailler avec elle.
texts.en:
This client is 48 years old, married, and has two children between the ages of 22 and 24. To overcome her family's difficulties and support her children's education, she started making and selling beignets. She runs her business at home, and her sales vary between 10,000 and 25,000 Fr per day.

After being granted her loan, she is going to strengthen her business by buying two bags of flour, one 50kg bag of sugar, two 25L cans of oil, salt, baking powder, one 50kg bag of rice, and 25kg of milk.

In the future, she wants to open a pastry shop to make various types of cakes such as brioches and fruitcakes, to deliver in bulk and open other outlets in places like schools and markets, and finally to find young people who are currently unemployed and willing to work for her.

loans.use: To buy 50kg bags of flour, 50kg of sugar, 25L cans of oil, baking powder, and a packet of vanilla sugar.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. Sylvia lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.  

Sylvia has a business selling fruit and vegetables.  She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 6 days each week.  Sylvia sells her products at the wholesale market. Sylvia has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of passion fruit. Her goal for her business is to start buying passion fruit directly from farmers.

loans.use: to buy more bags of passion fruit.

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es:
Felix tiene 52 años de edad trabaja como tecnico en refrigeracion desde hace varios años, es casado con dos hijos a su cargo y estos se encuentran estudiando actualmente.
don Felix visita nuevamente las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un prstamo para continuar con el proceso de mejoras pregresivas en su casa de habitacion.
el va a comprar materiales de construccion para construir un cuarto de habitacion para sus hijos, todo esto para que su familia goce de mejores condiciones de una vivienda digna para ellos.
texts.en:
Felix, 52, has worked as a refrigeration technician for a number of years.  He is married and has 2 children in his care who are now in school.

Felix has returned to the offices of CEPRODEL to request a new loan so that he can continue the process of making progressive improvements to his house.

Felix is going to buy construction materials to build a room for his children, so that his family can enjoy better living conditions and a decent home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Virginchita

texts.en: Virginchita is 53, married, and has four children. She lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, and has a new business selling fruit such as apples and oranges. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy five boxes of oranges and five boxes of apples, and to pay to transport the boxes.  Virginchita has been a member of Kiva field partner PMPC for more than a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of oranges and apples, and to pay to transport the boxes

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, tiene la edad 60 de años, está casado y vive con su esposa y nieto. El pretende con el crédito comprar insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El lo que va comprar específicamente es el abono y productos para aplicar al cultivo y mejorar las cosechas de este año. El cuenta con el terreno establecido ya desde varios años atrás y con una plantación buena por lo cual quiere asistirla. El pretende con el crédito realizar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para salir adelante con el proyecto y darle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 60 years old and lives with his wife and grandchild. He intends to use this loan to buy supplies to improve his coffee fields. Specifically, he will buy manure and other products to apply to the crop and improve this years' harvests.

Gerardo can count on fields established various years ago and on a good stand of trees and he wants to improve them. He intends with this loan to obtain the largest earnings possible and to advance his plans and provide his family with a good quality of life. 

This is Gerardo's first loan through FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has approved his loan with all facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy supplies to improve his coffee trees.

loans.name: Raquil

texts.en:
Raquil is 31 years old and lives in Capucao, Ozamiz City, Philippines. She is married with 3 school-aged children. 

Raquil owns and operates a retail store at home. She sells mainly basics like laundry and bath soap, rice, rice bran, canned goods and spices. The business has existed for over two years and she earns approximately PHP 4,000 a month, including her husband's income. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to invest in expanding her inventory.

Raquil has been a member of GDMPC for one year. This will be her second loan from the cooperative. In the future, Raquil hopes to expand and sustain business operations, and lay aside enough money for her children's education so that they have a brighter future.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her inventory.

loans.name: Jellyzle

texts.en:
Jellyzle is 24 years old and a motorcycle operator. She is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. Because of their unprivileged living, she operates their motorcycle instead of staying at home. They are helping each other to improve their living. Even though it is difficult to be a motorcycle operator and a mother, she remains strong for the sake of her children. She is enduring difficulties in earning money yet she is very inspired because of them. 

Operating a motorcycle every day may leads to its deterioration, so it needs maintenance. So Jellyzle is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy new tires as well as perform maintenance. She hopes these repairs will keep the motorcycle strong in order to earn a higher income for the betterment of their living.

loans.use: to buy new tires and provide motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Maria, de oficio cocinera en un restaurante, con mas de seis años, laborando para el apoyo de su familia, tiene tres hijos, estudiantes, y su esposo trabaja como gestor de compras.
Junto han construido su casa de concreto, aunque ha sido un proceso lento, es por tal razon requiere al financiamiento para poder repellar paredes interna, y poner verjas en la parte del porche, para  seguir con la mejora de su vivienda.
El cual se esta haciendo posible, por medio de Afodenic, materiales a comprar: arena, cemento, hierro y materiales para verjas, soldadura, para comenzar la obra.
Sus planes es seguir trabajando, pues ha veces hay semana que le va muy bien, con las horas extras y la propina, lo que esta comenzando a comprar y vender productos Avon. Teniendo otros ingresos que ayude a poder pagar sus compromisos de pago.
texts.en:
Maria, by trade a restaurant cook for more than six years, works to support her family. She has three children who are students, and her husband works as a purchasing agent.

Together they have built their house of concrete, although it has been a slow process. For that reason, Maria needs the loan to pebbledash internal walls and put iron grating on the porch, in order to continue improving her house.

Through Afodenic, it will be possible for her to buy sand, cement, iron and materials for the grating, and solder in order to start the work.

Her plan is to continue working, since sometimes a week goes very well for her, with extra hours and tips. She is starting to buy and sell Avon products in order to have other sources of income that will help her be able to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to pebbledash internal walls, and to put iron grating on the porch.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou  habite dans une des localités du territoire  sénégalais. Elle est âgée  de 49 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et exerce depuis plus de 35 ans la vente de poissons.  C’est sous l’influence de sa maman qu’elle a opté pour cette activité depuis le bas âge.  Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2005. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 prévu pour l’achat de poissons, produit  qui devient de plus en plus cher sur le marché. Ce financement lui permettra de maintenir le niveau de son activité. C’est pour lui un moyen d’augmenter son fond de roulement afin de pouvoir  continuer a répondre a la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Aissatou lives in a town in Senegal. She is 49 years old. She has developed a business selling fish, which she has been doing for more than 35 years. Her choice to follow this line of business was influenced by her mother. She has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since August 2005, and is now requesting a loan of 150,000 francs in order to buy fish, a product which is becoming more and more expensive on the market. This loan will allow her to maintain her business volume and it is a means of increasing her working capital so that she can continue to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale

loans.name: Nonvigbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NONVIGBE est composé de trois membres qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Anne Marie, est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Anne Marie est mariée à un fonctionnaire nommé Donatien et est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés dont un reste à sa charge. Anne Marie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Anne Marie n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Anne Marie mène comme activité depuis sept ans environs, la vente de bouillie de maïs, accompagnée de beignets (faits à base de la farine de blé) dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Anne Marie achète des fruits qu'elle vend dans son quartier. Anne Marie s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Anne Marie et son groupe sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The NONVIGBE group consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group named Anne Marie is the one with her hand raised in the picture. To raise the level of their business and better meet the demand of their customers, this group is seeking for the second time the financial support of ALIDé.

Anne Marie is married to Donatien, a public servant. She is the mother of three children all attending (or having attended) school, and of whom one remains under her care. She lives together with her children and her husband.

Anne Marie has never been to school. To support herself and her children over the past seven years, her business activity has been to sell corn mush along with donuts (made ​​from wheat flour) in her neighborhood. As an additional activity, Anne Marie buys and sells fruit in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies in Benin.

In order to strengthen their business and better serve their customers, Anne Marie and her group are seeking a credit loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to increase the level of their business activity.

loans.use: Buy corn, wheat flour, vegetable oil and fruit.

loans.name: Gairatjon

texts.ru: Гайрат женат и ответственный отец троих детей.  Он матер этим своим мастерством он зарабатывает мало денег. Его дети выросли, ему необходимо их устроит их  в хороших садиках и школах. С этой цель он начал заниматься выращиванием пшеницы 5 лет назад. Этот бизнес приносит ему хорошие доходы, и он хочет расширить этот бизнес. Гайрат планирует получить хорошую прибыль и хочет провести хатнатуй сына. Гайрат хотел бы получить займ для расширения бизнеса и покупки семян пшеницы для посева.
texts.en: Gairat is married and is a responsible father of three children.  He earns little money from his craftsmanship work.  His children are growing up, and he needs to place them into good kindergartens and schools.  This is why he started to grow wheat five years ago.  This business brings him a good income, and he wants to expand this business. Gairat plans to make a good profit and wants to hold a hatnatuy (circumcision) ceremony for his son.  Gairat wants to obtain this loan to expand his business and buy wheat seeds for sowing.

loans.use: to expand his business and buy wheat seeds for sowing

loans.name: Carmen Margarita

texts.es:
Carmen de 37 años, empezó con la fabricación de puertas y ventas de fierro hace 20 años atrás y realiza sus ventas en los pueblos.

Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ningún problema hasta ahora. Desafortunadamente no está casada pero tiene 4 hijos de 21, 19, 18 y el menor de 3 años los 3 hijos mayores trabajan y ayudan a mantener el hogar el hijo menor estudia en una escuela fiscal. 

Con el préstamo desea compra hierro para terminar de construir su casa y poder vivir mas cómodos y asi ubicar afuera de su casa un taller de adecuamiento de casa con hierro.
texts.en:
Carmen, who is 37 years old, began with the manufacture of iron doors and windows about 20 years ago and now she sells in the villages.

Thanks to God she has not had any problems so far.

Unfortunately she is not married but she has 4 children who are 21, 19, 18 and the youngest is 3 years old. The three older children work and help to maintain the home and the youngest attends a state public school.

With this loan she wants to buy iron finish building her house in order to live more comfortably and to be able to situate her workshop conveniently at home.

loans.use: to buy iron.

loans.name: Kyenjojo Disabled Group

texts.en:
Robinah is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  She has been a farmer for 10 years and runs her business efficiently. She also sells food on a daily basis in the Kyenjojo food market in the West of Uganda. The costs of running her business over the years have not been as high as she in most cases sells what she harvests from her farms.

Along the way, Robinahhas encountered hardships, but it has been her precept to make the best out of bad bargains. Robinah's monthly sales returns will only get better once she receives the loan she is requesting, which she will use to purchase better manure for her farms. Not only is she hoping for better yields but Robinah hopes to expand her business beyond the borders of Kyenjojo.

loans.use: to purchase better manure for her farms.

loans.name: Besta

texts.en:
Besta is a 30-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 4 to 18. For the past three years, she has run a business selling food items in South Sudan. 

Besta is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread and potatoes. She will use the income from her loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase bread and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 24 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 4.  In 2004, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and wants to use this new loan to buys seeds and fertilizers for her business.  In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Luz Stella

texts.es: La señora Luz Stella a sus 48 años se encuentra viuda y a su responsabilidad esta el sacar a su hijo adelante. Es por esto que desde hace mas de 20 años, se ha desempeñado como vendedora de mercancía, negocio que le ha permitido pagar los gastos de su hogar y brindarle las necesidades básicas a su hijo. Sus clientes son principalmente las personas de su sector, a quienes les ha ofrecido mercancía como productos para el hogar, ropa interior, prendas de vestir, entre otros. En busca de ofrecer en la temporada de fin de año prendas de vestir para sus clientes, requiere de la compra del surtido de mercancía para ofrecer gran variedad de sus productos y así garantizar buenos niveles de ventas. La señora Luz Stella sueña con que su negocio crezca, le pueda generar mayores ingresos y de esta forma poderle brindar todo lo que necesita su hijo, además quiere ahorrar para poderse comprar su propia casa y brindarle a su hijo una mayor estabilidad económica en su ausencia.
texts.en: Luz Stella is 48 years old. She is a widow and she is responsible for providing for her son. It is for this reason that she has been a retailer for more than 20 years, an activity she has engaged in to pay for her household expenses and to guarantee the basic necessities to her son. Her customers are mainly people form her own area, to whom she sells items such as home products, underwear and clothes, among others. Wanting to offer items of clothing to her customers during the year-end season, she needs to buy a stock of merchandise in order to offer a wider variety of products, thus granting herself a good selling rate. Luz Stella wishes for her activity to grow and to grant her a higher income, in order to allow her to give her son everything he needs. She also wants to save money to be able to buy a house of her own, in order to offer a better economic stability to her son in her absence.

loans.use: To buy items of clothing for the year-end season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Musarrat

texts.en: Musarrat  is a hard working lady. She initiated her business selling  milk as it was difficult to run household activities with the small income of her husband.  She is 38 years old married woman.  She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Musarrat ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. She also sells animals on seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Musarrat  has requested for 40000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra sells fast food such as hot dogs, hamburgers, fried chicken, french fries and sodas from a cart on a street corner near her house. She has 15 years of experience selling fast food but had to stop workng when her kids were young. She started up again six months ago, buying the cart for $100. Sandra would like to use a loan to buy chairs and tables to put around her cart, as well as more sodas to sell. With the extra earnings she hopes this will generate she wants to be able to expand and sell rice and beans as well. Sandra is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children. She works from 5am to 10pm Thursdays through Sundays, with help from her two daughters. Her husband also has a cart, from which he sells morocho, a type of rice pudding. They both support each other and together were able to build their home out of concrete instead of bamboo. They hope that their business grows so that they have an income and can continue sending their youngest daughters to school.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Sandra would like to use a loan to buy  chairs and tables to put around her cart, as well as more sodas to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Ceferina

texts.en: Hello, my name is Blanca and I am a merchant. I have a used clothing store in my home in the center of my community. I have been doing this work for several years, and it has allowed me to provide my children with an education and cover my household expenses. My children now have an intermediate school degree and also work at the store.

loans.use: Purchase of mixed clothing, children’s clothing, skirts, nightgowns and pants.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne W. is a graduate of a Swiss hotel management school in Mountreaux, and Daniel Mbugua is trained in accounting and has developed excellent skills in graphic design. The two have joined hands with friends locally and abroad to establish a tour & travel company, Zindua Africa Safaris, that will market numerous related services. They have established the business in Tigoni, Limuru with a small liaison office in downtown Nairobi. Their objective is to take advantage and benefits from the booming tourist sector of the economy.

Both Dan & Carolyne, being young people, are full of plans on how to grow their business working with partners all over Africa, the USA, Europe and Asia. They hope to franchise their concept and one day have Zindua Africa Safaris representatives all over the world.

The business is now 2 months old and they are constrained for capital to buy the items that they require. With the loan of $1200 they plan to hire an expert to help them launch their website, develop some advertising materials and buy a computer & printer. As a way of tackling the unemployment crisis prevailing in the country, PEMCI has been considering providing venture capital to support innovative business ideas, especially among the youth. Zindua Africa Safaris plans to recruit many Kenyan youth and others from all over the world in promoting their business idea. We see promise and we recommend support for this endeavour in anticipation of the great impact that it can have on the youth in this country and in the wider economy and its people.

loans.use: To buy communication equipment, set-up website, produce advertising materials and purchase a computer

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Florencia has dedicated herself to the sale of home products such as: pans, sheets, clothing, etc. She also sells candy to public buses' passengers. She began to work because the number members in her family grew and her husband's income alone was not enough to support them. With a small amount of cash given by her husband she started to buy and sell candies. She, then, invested the profit in the purchase of clothing and other goods and, after that, slowly her business started to grow. She works from Mondays through Saturdays, from 7:30am to 6:00pm.

Loan Investment

Mrs. Florencia wishes to receive this credit because she does not have enough money to purchase merchandise. She had a friend that would lend her money at a very high interest rate. Now, she wants to receive this credit so that she can move forward and satisfy her customer's demands, and, more importantly, be able to sell her products at a lower price so she can attract more customers.

Personal Information

Mrs. Florencia is 43 years old. She is married and has 5 young children. Her husband works with construction and uses his income to cover the family's expenses. Their home is made of brick and straw, the floor is made out of dirt. She wishes to expand her business with the credit and, with the profit, slowly build a well-constructed house. Above all, she would be able to provide a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La señora Florencia se dedica hace 3 años a la venta de artículos para el hogar, como ollas, sábanas, reposteros, ropa etc. También ella vende caramelos en los buses. Ella empezó a trabajar por que el número de su familia creció y no era suficiente el dinero que ganaba su esposo. Así que con un dinerito que le dio el esposo ella empezó a comprar caramelos y venderlos y con la utilidad que le generaba compró ropa y otros artículos y poco a poco ha ido creciendo. Ella trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7:30 a 18:00.

Uso del Préstamo

Doña Florencia desea su crédito por que no tiene capital suficiente para comprar mas mercadería, ya que tenía un amigo que le prestaba el dinero pero a un interés muy alto. Por lo cual su capital disminuyo. Ahora desea tener este crédito para crecer y satisfacer la demanda que tiene de sus clientes y sobre todo vender su mercadería a un mejor precio y de esta forma captar más clientes.

Información Personal

La señora Florencia tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos menores de edad. Su esposo es albañil y con lo que gana le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Su casa es mitad de cemento y mitad de caña, muy sencilla, el piso es de tierra. Ella desea hacer que su negocio crezca con los créditos y tener mayor utilidad que le permita poco a poco ir construyendo su casa. Además que poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: Necesita dinero para comprar mercaderia

loans.name: Ema

texts.es:
Mrs. Ema E. is 40 years old and has been happily married to 46 year old Mr. Arquides Monges for 22 years. The couple has three children that are 22, 20, and 12 years old. The oldest is finishing the police academy, the middle child has been working in Spain for five months, and the youngest is finishing 6th grade and still lives at home.

In 2000 Ema opened a store in her home, with the goal of helping and sustaining her family. She started with a small amount of cash from her husband, who has been working for 22 years for a flooring company in the city. Currently with a well established clientele, and thanks to good treatment and customer service, she has been able to continue selling many different products. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as oils, noodles, flour, vegetables, fruit, etc, to be able to give her clients more variety.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ema E. de 40 años de edad está felizmente casada hace 22 años con el Sr. Arquides Monges de 46 años de edad. El matrimonio tiene 3 hijos de 22, 20 y 12 años de edad respectivamente. El mayor de ellos se encuentra terminando su carrera en la escuela de policía, el del medio hace 5 meses que se encuentra trabajando en España y el menor de todos está cursando el 6º grado y vive con sus padres. Doña Ema desde el año 2000 abrió una despensa en su casa, con el objetivo de ayudar en el sustento familiar y en el cual se inicio con un pequeño aporte de capital que le facilito su marido, quien es empleado hace 22 años de una Parquetera (empresa que fabrica pisos de parquet o madera) situada en la ciudad. Actualmente ya cuenta con su clientela bien formada, gracias al buen trato que les otorga a sus clientes y por su variado stock de mercaderías. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: aceites, fideos, harinas, verduras, frutas, etc; para entregar a sus clientes una mayor variedad de Stock.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise: oils, noodles, flour, vegetables, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Ana Josefa

texts.en: Ana Josefa is a single mother  living in San Cristobal whose four children, two boys and two girls, range from eleven to twenty-three years old.  Ana Josefa sells new and used women’s clothing to support her family.  Most entrepreneurial clothing vendors in Ana’s area purchase clothing from outside of the community for resale locally.  Ana obtains some of her merchandise the same way, but also pays a nominal fee for the used clothing of her friends and family members and resells these items.  She also plans to use her loan to buy more new clothing at less expensive bulk rates to improve her profit margin.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing at bulk rates.

loans.name: Aka Suzanne

texts.en: Suzanne is a 51-year-old dynamic woman. She has sold various condiments and spices since 1995 when she lost her job as a typist in a governmental agency. She has 3 children: 2 daughters who are married and a son who is unemployed. Her husband is retired from the public transportation company. His revenue is not sufficient to cover the household expenses. Suzanne's revenue from her business is therefore an important resource for her family. She wants to develop her business by diversifying her products offered, especially cooked food. Suzanne is dynamic and honest.

loans.use: To purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Bùi Thị Hoàn, 30 years old, is a TYM member since 2003. Before joining TYM, her family income came solely from the rice field that they exploited. They did not earn much money because the expenses were high (fertilizer is expensive). Ms Hoàn discussed with her husband and they decided to take out a loan to open a farming supply store. This helped increase their income and at the same time saved them money on the fertilizer that they buy because they get a better price as a business customer. Ms Hoàn also raises livestock. Her family financial situation has improved significantly. Her revenue is about 125 USD a month. This time she is requesting a loan of 575 USD to buy more stock for her farm supply store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Hoàn, 30 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003. Trước khi vào Quỹ nghề nghiệp chủ yếu của gia đình chị là làm ruộng, chi phí chăm bón cũng lớn nên kinh tế gia đình rất khó khăn. Chị Hoàn đã bàn bạc với chồng và quyết định vay vốn mở cửa hàng buôn bán đạm lân. Việc mở cửa hàng không những tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình mà còn giúp chị giảm chi phí chăm bón ruộng của gia đình (do mua buôn nên giá phân bón rẻ hơn). Kết hợp vào đó, chị Hoàn còn chăn nuôi và làm nẹp thúng bán. Nhờ thế kinh tế gia đình phát triển rõ rệt. Thu nhập hiện tại của chị Hoàn là 125USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị định vay mức vốn 575USD để đầu tư mua thêm hàng phục vụ cho mùa vụ.

loans.use: Buy stock for her farm supply store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 33 years old, married, and in the business of selling baby things. She learned her trade over a period of 4 years. She is from Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 2000. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy additional baby supplies for sale.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale.

loans.name: Rahmonkul

texts.ru:
Rahmonkul Ottaevich O. is 41 years old, married and has 5 children (on the right in the photo). He has a high school diploma and currently is the sole bread winner for his family. His parents are retired and help him take care of the livestock. Rahmonkul has bin a client with "Microinvest" since beginning of 2007. He used his first loan to purchase a young bull, whom he sold after 6 months of feeding. He used his last loan to purchase a cow with a calf. Now Rahmonkul wants to take out another loan to buy two more bulls and feed for them.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Обидов Рахмонкул Отаевич – 41 лет, женат и имеет 5 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Единственный член семьи зарабатывающий на жизнь. Его родители пенсионеры и помогают за уходом за скотом.Рахмонкул - клиент «Микроинвеста» с начало 2007 года. На первый полученный кредит он купил бычка и продал после 6 месяцев откорма. На последний полученный кредит клиент купил корову и теленка. Он хочет получить кредит с КИВА и купит два быка и корм для них.( он справа на фото)

loans.use: Purchase of two bulls

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth and her beloved partner, Juan, make a happy couple. It has been eight years since their marriage, and during this time they have made a great sacrifice to build their home. They wanted to offer their three children a proper home and to maintain a small plot of land to raise and nourish their animals. These animals have made them appreciate nature, and beyond the raising of animals and the production of cheese they also purchase and sell calves. With these labors they are gaining their day to day subsistence and bettering their way of life. At the same time they are able to support their humble and aging parents and repay them for their own efforts to support their own children. Janeth and her husband's wish is to obtain a loan in order to invest in the purchase of fodder for their animals. They believe that with your kind heart they will realize their wish.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Janeth y su querido y ejemplar compañero, Juan, conforman una feliz pareja de esposos, hace sólo 8 años contrajeron matrimonio, en ese tiempo con sumo trabajo y dedicación lograron construir su casita para ofrecerles un hogar propio a sus 3 pequeños niños y comprar un terrenito para criar y alimentar a sus tiernos animalitos.La familia de esta laboriosa ha inculcado en ellos el amor y la valoración por la naturaleza, además de la crianza de animales y fabricación de quesos con la leche que extraen de sus generosas vaquitas, ahora se dedican a la compra y venta de becerritas, con estas labores están logrando día a día mejorar su calidad de vida y al mismo tiempo contribuir con sus humildes y ancianos padres en contribución al apoyo y bienestar que recibieron de ellos.El deseo de Janeth y su esposo es conseguir un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de forraje para sus vaquitas. Están seguros que con tu buen corazón contribuirá con su gran anhelo.

loans.use: To purchase fodder to nourish their cows

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo lives in a rental and his home is located on Iriarte Street in the northern section of the city of La Paz. His business is making food for events as he studied and is enrolled in hotel school. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase the necessary ingredients to make home made fruit jams (fruit, sugar, containers, etc.) which will result in additional revenue for him. Gonzalo is an old client of Kiva’s as he obtained his first loan in 2007. This loan has been paid in full. His prior history is good and he qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Gonzalo vive en anticretico, su domicilio esta en la calle Iriarte de la zona norte de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la elaboración de comida, para eventos particulares pues él estudió y es egresado de la escuela Hotelera. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de mermeladas caseras de fruta (frutas, azucar, containers,etc.), que será un ingreso adicional para su subsistencia. Gonzalo es cliente antiguo de Kiva, pues él ya obtuvo un primer préstamo el año 2007 y a la fecha dicho préstamo está pagado completamente. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to prepare and sell fruit jams

loans.name: Wiliamo José

texts.pt:
Wiliamo is 26 years old and is a native of Namaacha, a town on the border with Swaziland, where he lives today. Wiliamo is married and has a 6 year old daughter. He lives in his own home with his parents and his 6 younger brothers. His mother and his wife are both unemployed, and his brothers are in school. His daughter is not in school because the school she would be able to attend is very far from home.

Wiliamo went to school until the 10th grade and abandoned his studies to search for work so he could care for his family, principally for his brothers since he lost his father very early and his mother has been without work for a long time. Wiliamo works for the local radio station named Cascata 9.5FM from 5:50am to 2:00pm on Tuesdays and Thursdays and the rest of the days he works from 2:00pm until 5:00pm.

As a journalist for more than 6 years, Wiliamo is a permanent employee and receives a monthly salary of 1,500MTn. To help increase his monthly income Wiliamo also works for himself excavating stones that are used on walls or as house decorations...etc. Besides this Wiliamo is also President of the Association of BeeKeepers of the District of Namaacha.

Since his stone business wasn't very busy he decided to open a small store to sell drinks and basic staple products. Through his brother's influence who already had a store, Wiliamo opened his store in the region where he lives because according to him there is a lack of stores. The product that has the most sell through is corn flour that he sells for 25MTn per kilo. Wiliamo has a monthly income of approximately 2,000MTn and is able to save between 300MTn and 500MTn per month. This will be the second loan that Wiliamo has with Hluvuku, however it is the first with Kiva.

With the first loan he purchased materials to assist with the excavation of stone. With this loan of 10,000MTn he intends to restock his store with products thus increasing his sales and his income. Wiliamo dreams of improving his business and helping his community by reducing the distance to procure staple products.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Wiliamo tem 26 anos de idade e é natural de Namaacha, uma vila na fronteira com a Swazilandia onde vive ate hoje. Wiliamo é casado e pai de uma filha de 6 anos. Vive em sua própria casa com seus pais e seus 6 irmãos mais novos. A mãe e sua esposa estão desempregadas e os irmãos estudam exceto a sua filha porque pela idade a escola que poderia freqüentar se encontra muito distante da casa. Wiliamo estudo até 10ª classe, e abandonou os estudos para procurar emprego de forma a cuidar da família, principalmente dos irmãos uma vez que perdeu o pai muito sedo e a mãe ficou por muito tempo desempregada. Wiliamo trabalha na radio local de nome Cascata 9.5FM com horário das 5:50h as 14:00h nas terças e quartas feiras e o resto dos dias trabalha das 14:00h as 17:00h. Como jornalista faz mais de 6 anos, Wiliamo é funcionário permanente e recebe um salário mensal de MTn 1,500. Para ajudar a aumentar o seu rendimento mensal, Wiliamo também faz por conta própria a extração de pedra que se usa como langes nas paredes para decorações de casas etc. Alem disso, Wiliamo é também presidente da Associação de Apicultores do Distrito de Namaacha. Como o negocio de extração de pedras não era freqüente, Wiliamo decidiu abrir uma pequena loja para vender bebidas e produtos de necessidade básica. Por influencia de seu irmão que já tinha uma loja, Wiliamo abriu a sua loja na região em que mora, dado que segundo Wiliamo é uma zona com falta de lojas. O produto com mais saída é a farinha de milho, que vende por MTn 25 o kilo. Wiliamo tem um rendimento mensal de aproximadamente MTn 2,000 e consegue poupar entre MTn 300 e MTn 500 por mês. Este será o segundo empréstimo de Wiliamo com a Hluvuku, porem o primeiro com o Kiva. Com o primeiro empréstimo comprou materiais para auxiliar na extração de pedras. Com este empréstimo de MTn 10,000 pretende reforçar a mercadoria de sua loja, aumentando assim as vendas e seu rendimento. Wiliamo tem com sonho melhorar o seu negocio ajudando a sua comunidade reduzindo as distancias a procura de produtos da primeira necessidade.

loans.use: Purchase goods for his store

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
K. Inobat is 35 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her husband is a taxi-driver. Inobat and her husband have been working hard to ensure that their children have the best possible future. Inobat has been running her own business for ten years, and sells clothes. As her business progressed and she became more involved, Inobat would like to expand and open her own store. Currently, she sells shoes for women in a store located in the central market. She is extremely polite and friendly to her customers, and works hard to ensure they have a pleasant shopping experience. She would like to diversify the range of goods she sells, in order to satisfy her clients’ needs.

Inobat’s income contributes significantly to her family’s budget. However, as her children grow, the financial burden on the family is increasing as well. Inobat would like for her children to continue to learn and have an education, and is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her selling capacity and range.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new shoes for increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Tasleem M.abid Khan Group

texts.en:
Tasleem baji is the wife of M. A. K.. She lives in Multan, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years. Tasleem baji is the mother of four children, one son and three daughters. Her son is in the 6th standard grade. Her elder daughter is in the 7th standard grade. Her husband makes decoratively embroidered dresses. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years. Tasleem baji successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy embroidery material (thread, needles, and clothes) for her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sugran Mai baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy more fruit to resell. Shagufta baji wants a loan to buy oil for her power loom machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Sokhai

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhai C., 35, and her husband, Mr. Soeun Tel, 30, who live on an Island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2003 and have one son. 

Sokhai has been a silk weaver since she was 15, having learned the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh, while Soeun buys recyclable materials for resale. 

Sokhai is now requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Sherafet

texts.en: Sherafet Q. is a 55 year old woman who is married and has three children. She sells table furniture which is very popular and rents them for wedding parties. She started her business in 1991 when she saw that her salary was not large enough to cover her family's needs. Her husband is unemployed and he helps her with her shop while she is teaching lessons. She is a school teacher and we took the photo of her while she was checking home exercises at her workplace. She says it is very hard to work at both jobs but that she does not have any other choice. Every single day she tries her best to bring money home to feed her children.  Now, she wants to expand her business and for this purpose she is applying for the loan.  She is thankful for your generosity and help.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana tiene 37 años, es madre soltera de un niño llamado Cristian de 8 años de edad y vive en casa de unos familiares. Siempre le ha gustado el arte, es así que hace 16 años se dedica a la venta de artesanías y manualidades en corrospun (planchas de plástico) para mantener a su pequeño Cristian. Roxana no puede pedir un mejor trabajo, ya que es libre de crear los diseños que le parezcan de agrado al público, cuenta con una gran variedad de adornos que ofrecer y que la clientela compra frecuentemente. Roxana abre su establecimiento desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 o 9 de la noche, ya que trabaja atendiendo su negocio y al mismo tiempo elaborando más adornos. El motivo del esfuerzo de esta madre es sacar adelante a su hijo Cristian, quiere verlo grande y con muchas oportunidades para alcanzar sus sueños. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará materiales más novedosos para elaborar sus adornos y que su negocio sea el más concurrido por la clientela juliaqueña.
texts.en:
Roxana is 37 years old. She is a single mother of a boy named Cristian who is 8 years old, and she lives at home with relatives. She has always liked art, and for that reason, for the past 16 years she has sold her craftwork and handicrafts in corrospun (plastic sheets). She also does this to take care of her young child, Cristian. Roxana could not ask for a better job because she is free to create designs that seem to please the public, and she has a wide variety of ornaments to offer that customers buy frequently. Roxana keeps her business open from 8 AM until 8 or 9 at night, enabling her to work and take her customers’ business while developing more ornaments. The reason for this mother’s effort is to succeed for her son Cristian; she wants to see him grow up with plenty of opportunities to achieve his own dreams. With the money from the loan, she will buy newer materials to develop ornaments and so that her business can become the most popular among her Juliaqueña clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to prepare her crafts

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 48 años, es conviviente con su segundo compromiso, vive con su hija de 24 años que es soltera y le ayuda a sus labores. Desde muy niña ha estada en la actividad de la chacra, y después se dedicó a pastear su ganado. Hace 3  años decidió abrir una bodeguita, sus vecinos son los clientes que consumen sus productos, pero por falta de dinero no está muy surtida su tienda. Esta actividad de comprar y vender productos y estar en contar en contacto directo con la gente a ella le agrada mucho, por ello ha decidido hacer pastar sus carneros con pastores, y se dedica a su negocio, ya que también lo ve muy rentable y menos cansado que la agricultura y el pastar carneros, su dificultad es que no tiene suficiente mercadería para surtir su negocio. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP,  no ha tenido dificultad de pago. Con todo el dinero que solicita va a incrementar los productos de primera necesidad y de ese modo poder tener muy bien surtida su bodega.
texts.en:
Teofila is 48 years old and lives with her fiancé and her 24-year-old daughter who helps her with her business. Since she was very young she has worked on a farm and she later began to raise cattle. Three years ago she decided to open a small grocery store and her neighbors are her customers. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to fully stock her store. She really enjoys buying and selling products and being in direct contact with people, so she has decided to have others look after her cattle so that she can devote herself fully to the store. This is a good decision because the store is more profitable and less tiring than farming and cattle raising. But, the problem is that she does not have sufficient merchandise for her business. This is her second loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she has not had a problem in repaying the first. With this loan she will increase her supply of basic foodstuffs and in this way will keep her store well-stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise offered in her store

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May, 47, lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. May has been selling gold Brazilian jewelry sixteen years. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase gold from Syria.

May has been a micro-credit client for nine years now and has always repaid on time. The loans have made her life easier, especially since she didn’t have family support. May is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are friends, neighbors, and summer tourists. In the future, she plans to expand her business by becoming a wholesaler and also by selling gold to other retailers.

loans.use: to purchase gold from Syria for re-sale

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mr. Som M. lives in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Long Reth, is a chicken breeder. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to provide a better life for their family. Thus, Mr. Som M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy 600 ducks and duck food to start a duck-breeding business. He hopes to increase his income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

Mr. Som M. is 49 years old and the father of six children, one of whom is an immigrant working in Thailand. Two others are farmers helping their father on the plantation and the remaining three are attending the local school. His wife is presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy 600 ducks and duck food to start a duck breeding business.

loans.name: Khun Thea's Group

texts.en: Mr. Khun Thea T. is the group leader of five entrepreneurs in Lor village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is firewood seller and a 47-year-old father of four children, one of whom works with him in the firewood business, while the others are either attending the local school or too young to work or study.  His wife, Mrs. Eng Vanleng, is a Khmer noodle seller. Even though they work hard, Mr. Khun Thea T. and his wife do not have enough money to provide a good house for their family.  To this end, Mr. Khun Thea T. is requesting a loan to pool with his savings in order to make repairs to the family house.

loans.use: House repairs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-five-year-old married woman with two children. For the past four years, Mary has been trading in maize and ‘gari’. Gari is produced from cassava and it is one of the carbohydrate supplements. It can either be eaten raw with sugar and roasted groundnuts or with cooked beans and oil.

Mary obtains her supplies from the farming communities and retails them to her customers, mostly food vendors and other retailers. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk quantities of maize and gari to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay her children’s educational fees. Mary is a member of a community group called "To God be the Glory" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure ‘gari’ for re-sale

loans.name: Nelly Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nelly Nancy Sánchez A. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en el distrito de moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió su secundaria completa, de estado civil soltera.
Nelly Sánchez se dedica al negocio de la Artesanía, tenemos así la cuenta de peluches chocotejas y todo tipo de regalo.
A encontrado una buena inversión en el negocio especialmente en los productos a base de chocolate, producción que ella misma los prepara, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco Comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invito en la compra de ingredientes para iniciar con el negocio de las chocotejas, así mismo en marcianos y chupetines.
Con el crédito de 700 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para peluches y continuar con la venta de artesanía.
Nelly tiene como uno de sus sueños crecer como empresario tiene un local propio para su negocio e independizarse y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly Nancy Sánchez A. is 42 years old and lives in the Moche district of Trujillo province in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She completed secondary school and is single.

Nelly's business is selling crafts, including stuffed animals, artisanal chocolates, and all types of gifts. She has found her business to be a good investment, especially her homemade chocolate products. Her business is located in her home.

She is a member of the “Luis Alberto Sánchez II” Community Bank and invested her first loan (for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles) in ingredients to make chocolates and lollipops. She will use the money from this loan (for 700 nuevos soles, to be repaid in four months) to purchase materials to make stuffed animals and to continue her business selling crafts.

Nelly's dream is to grow as a businessperson, have her own shop, be financially independent, and be able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for stuffed animals and to continue selling crafts

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es: Teodocia cuenta con 47 años de edad, vive con su pareja y fruto de esta unión, tienen 5 hijos, los cuales son pequeños y aun viven en su casa. Hace 7 años viene trabajando en la venta de cerveza en un local alquilado, este negocio le ha resultado muy rentable, y sus ganancias le han permitido cubrir la educación de sus hijos. Por ello quiere incrementar su negocio, con la venta de con abarrotes y zapatos, porque ha hecho contacto con fabricantes de esta línea quienes le están proponiendo que se encargue de vender su producción, pero aún no tiene el capital necesario para emprender este negocio. Los fines de semana, es cuando Teodocia obtiene mayores ganancias, porque su local su establecimiento está ubicado frente a una loza deportiva, y en su mayoría, lo varones, luego de jugar futbol se acercan a refrescarse con algunas cervezas heladas. Por las tardes, también los fines de semana, Teodocia prepara comida y café caliente para captar mayores ingresos, esta actividad es una distracción para ella, y de paso va acumulando ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia. Teodocia es una persona muy jocosa, lo que demuestra en cada reunión de su banco comunal; siempre ha tratado de pagar puntualmente cuotas y este es el 8vo préstamo que trabaja con MFP, donde ha demostrado responsabilidad en las tareas encomendadas. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar con comestibles su negocio, con la finalidad de captar nueva clientela.
texts.en:
Teodocia is 47 years old, lives with her partner, and has 5 children who are still young and live in her house. She has been working selling beer in a rented locale for the past 7 years. This business has proven to be very profitable, and her earnings have allowed her the ability to finance her children’s educations. For this reason, she would like to expand her business to include the sale of groceries and shoes. She knows many manufacturers in this arena who are proposing that she carry their product lines to sell. However, she still doesn’t have the necessary capital to embark on this business. Teodocia earns the most on weekends because she is located in front of a sports venue. After playing their soccer matches, the men for the most part, frequent her location to enjoy a refreshing cold beer. In the afternoons and on weekends Teodocia also prepares food and hot coffee to augment her income. This activity is a distraction for her and, over time, she accumulates income for the well-being of her family. Teodocia is a very humorous person, which she demonstrates at each gathering of the members of her cooperative bank. She has always tried to make her loan payments on time, and this is the 8th loan she has had working with MFP. She has demonstrated her responsible nature with the tasks at hand. The funds she is requesting are to increase food products for her business, with the aim of attracting additional customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Clairol Magaly

texts.es: La neñora Clairol  Es originario  de la comunidad del Canton Chiyax es una persona muy reconocida en su comunidad actualmente es propietaria de un taxi rotativo en el departamento de Totonicapan y sus alrededores ella manifiesta que necesita un credito para solventar pagos de estudios ya que esta finalizando una etapa de estudios  en la universidad y por el momento no tiene esos recurso y se ve la necesidad  de este credito. que al trascurrir de los tiempos ella lo ve no como un gasto si no una inversion que le permite ser competitivo en el mercado con la preparacion academica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clairol is originally from the Canton Chiyax community. She is a very well known person in her community and she currently owns a taxi at the department of Totonicapan. She needs a loan in order to cover her college payments because she is trying to finish college and she currently doesn't have enough resources to cover these costs. She does not see this loan as an expense but as an investment on academic preparation that will allow her to be competitive in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education Expenses

loans.name: Lateafa Group

texts.en: Lateafa is the leader of the four-member Lateafa group, and they want take out a group loan. Lateafa wants a loan for her brother who sells curtains, M. Farhad wants a loan for his general store, Baras wants a loan for his shop where he sells slippers, and Raksar wants a loan for her embroidery business. They are all thankful for this loan process.

loans.use: For the progress of their businesses

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 40 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en la casa de unos familiares. Desde hace 2 años vende cosméticos por catálogo de las marcas más reconocidas del país, todos los días va de casa en casa de sus amistades, vecinos y otras personas que conoce para ofrecer sus productos, luego, por las tardes, hace un inventario de lo que vendió y de los pedidos que le hicieron. Días posteriores, visita nuevamente a sus clientes para cobrar, ya que generalmente vende al crédito, y aunque sea cansado realizar estas tareas, para ella es una gran satisfacción, ya que tiene sus propias metas, las cuales alcanza cada mes. Para un futuro cercano, Vilma desea establecerse en un puesto de ventas en una zona céntrica y comercial de su localidad. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy agradecida por la invitación que le hicieron para formar parte de su actual banco comunal, donde sus demás compañeros ya están en su 5to crédito. El dinero que viene solicitando comprará más cosméticos para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Vilma is 40 and lives with her 2 children in a family member's home. For two years, she has sold cosmetics by catalog. She sells one of the most well-known brands in the country. Every day she goes to the homes of her friends, neighbors, and other people that she knows to sell her products. Then, in the afternoons, she takes inventory of what she sold and the orders she took. Days later, she visits her customers again to collect the money, since she generally sells on credit. Although it is tiring to do this work, it gives her great satisfaction. She has her own goals, which she reaches every month. In the near future, Vilma hopes to establish a sales stand in a central commercial area in her community. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very grateful for the inviitation they gave her to become a part of her current communal bank where her fellow members are on their fifth loan. The credit she is requesting will go towards purchasing more cosmetics to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui O. lives with her three teenage daughters (ages ranging between 10 and 17) in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All her daughters are local high school students. Her husband works on construction in South Korea with a three-year contract. He went to South Korea to seek a better salary and better future for his family.

Nergui has a small retail business in home furniture. She has a small furniture shop in the town and she mostly brings her products from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been in the furniture retail business since 2005 and has gained some regularly-visiting customers in the town.

In the future, Nergui hopes to open a new furniture store in the town. She says that her ultimate goal is to see all three daughters graduate from university without financial strains. She requests a loan to purchase more furniture from Ulaanbaatar for her business.

loans.use: To buy home furniture from the capital city to sell

loans.name: Caminando Con Dignidad Group

texts.es:
“Caminando con dignidad” es un grupo de señoras  que asisten puntualmente a su reunión, liderizadas por su presidenta Rosmery M., ella cuenta que se agruparon por la necesidad de contar con un capital y poder generar sus propios recursos sin depender del esposo. Todas tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de calzados, cosméticos, carne, muebles, servicio de reparación y otros y  aseguran necesitar el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y de esta forma contar con productos variados que atraigan a los clientes.

A todas les gusta la capacitación sobre todo en temas de negocios, como la atención al cliente, ya que piensan que la buena forma de atender a los clientes les permite mantener a sus actuales clientes y conseguir otros.
texts.en:
Caminando con Dignidad (Walking with Dignity) is a group of women who punctually attend their meetings, led by their President, Rosmery M.. She relates that they came together so they could obtain capital and be able to generate their own resources without depending on their spouses. They all have different businesses, such as selling footwear, cosmetics, meat, furniture, repair services or other things. They definitely need this loan in order to buy merchandise so that they can have products which will attract customers. Most of all they all enjoy the training on business topics, such as attending to the customers since they think that providing good service allows them to keep their current customers and obtain others.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad R.'s main source of income comes from cultivating fruit trees and harvesting the fruit to sell. She is 59 years old, married and has eight adult children. They are from the village of Unidos. Trinidad has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Trinidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Trinidad is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be invested in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a fruit business

loans.name: Marlon Javier

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua el señor Marlon Javier G. se dedica a laborar por medio de la venta de productos varios en su propia pulpería que posee desde hace 2 años y que muy sabiamente ha venido desarrollando a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo.

Actualmente, el señor Marlon ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos a sus proveedores y por ello espera que su solicitud sea aprobada y así continuar con su negocio en su localidad logrando siempre la satisfacción de todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marlon Javier G. has a mini market in the Mercado Mayoreo in the city of Managua. He sells various products. He has worked in his store for two years. He has very wisely been developing his business through the years. Marlon currently has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy products from his providers. He hopes his request will be granted so that he can continue his business in his location, and, as always, satisfy all of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for his mini market

loans.name: Gladys Petronila

texts.es: Gladys Petrona B. Ramírez tiene 52 años. Su estado civil es casada, tiene 2 hijos. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación. Hace mas de  de 10 años que inicio este negocio por lo que su familia atravesaba una fuerte crisis económica pero con la buena administración que logro proporcionarle a su negocio siguió adelante con este negocio.  Por lo que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de más productos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, detergentes, jabón, productos de limpieza y golosinas. Su deseo es que todos sus esfuerzos tenga frutos y así el día de mañana sus hijos logren retribuir  todo lo que ella les ha ofrecido.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is a member of the Kichangani borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is 38 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 15, 12, and 11 years old.

Frida has owned a clothing business for 4 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Frida`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Frida hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Akyedi Pa Group

texts.en:
Dora is forty-five years old. She is married and has give birth to seven children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa, a commercial and farming town in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

Dora is a food vendor and the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Akyedi Pa’, meaning Perfect Gift. The group members are engaged either in farming or trading activities ns sell in their local market and nearby communities. They sometimes trek to nearby community markets, too. Some of the group members, however, also render services such as sewing, tailoring, hairdressing, etc. They want a loan to buy goods and materials in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock for her business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 26-year-old single gentleman. He was introduced to Kadet by an existing client. He is applying for his first loan from Kadet. With this loan, David is planning to increase his stock and sell goods, such as potatoes and peas, in bulk. He intend to reinvest his profits in his business.

His future hopes and dreams are to build a good house and eventually marry and support a family.

David was affected by the post-election violence that occurred in Kenya in 2007. He lost his first business, which was worth $7000 USD and was an internally displaced person for two months. But he has forgotten the past and decided to move on with life. He moved to Thika (his current hometown) and started a business all over again.

He describes himself as a very confident man; hardworking, positive and very decisive.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more stock and sell in bulk (potatoes, peas, etc)

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira has eight children with her husband Eduardo.  Three of her children attend college, two are in high school, and the other three are elementary school students.   It is not easy to satisfy their needs, especially when all of them are in school and taking their studies.  However, Elvira does not take this as a hindrance and complies with the duties and responsibilities of her family. She takes it as a challenge as to how best handle and improve her family's living conditions.
 
Elvira and her husband work hard to be able to continue sending their children in school. In addition, two of her children work to help support the family.  Elvira runs a small general store, and she and her husband also makes improvised stoves and sell them in their village.

She wants to continue her business while her children are taking their studies. She plans to use this loan of Php 15,000 as additional capital to help maintain her businesses. She has high hopes of achieving her dreams for the future of her children.

loans.use: Working capital for a general store and stove construction business.

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
En 2008, cette dame a commencé le commerce en détail des produits pharmaceutiques, elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa clientèle grandit tous les jours, elle veut par conséquent agrandir son stock et sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 13 boîtes de paracétamol, 10 plaquettes d'artequin, 10 boîtes d'efferlagan effervescent et divers autres produits pharmaceutiques.
Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est avocat.
texts.en:
In 2008, this lady started a retail business in pharmaceutical products. She sells from place to place, and she stocks up in Lomé. Her customer base is always growing. She therefore wants to expand her stock of products and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 13 containers of paracétamol (like Tylenol), 10 blister packs of artequin (anti-malarial), 10 containers of Efferalgan Effervescent (reduces pain and fever), and a variety of other pharmaceutical products. She is married to a gentleman who is a lawyer.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 45 years old, married with 6 children. Her husband is a policeman. She sells local gin at retail prices to her customers. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.  Her greatest joy in her business is when her customers come to purchase her local gin. She hopes for the loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more local gin to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Mela

texts.en: Mela C. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Mela owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Mela is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
