Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Marlene del Socorro O. M., tiene 38 años de edad es comerciante y se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de abarrotes ropa y zapatos, ella vive en una zona muy humilde es donde la inseguridad ciudadana asecha dia a dia, ella es una mujer trabajador que con su trabajo a conseguido el sustento de todos los dias es por este esmero que solicitó un prestamo con la intencion de invertir en su pequeño negocio y aprovechr la temporada para ofertar a un buen precio y recuperar lo invertido de  forma rapida, esto le traeria beneficios que le asegurarian a corto plazo una mejor estabilidad económica para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Marlene del Socorro O. M. is 38 years old and works in retail trade. For 6 years she has sold groceries, clothing and shoes. She lives in a low-income neighborhood where crime lurks daily. She is a hardworking woman who, with her work, has managed to make a living each day. She is requesting a loan to invest in her small business, taking advantage of the season to offer good prices and thus recoup her investment quickly. This would bring her benefits that would ensure a better short run economic stability for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries, shoes and clothing

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: M. Abel is a businessman. He is thirty-eight years old and married with five children in school. He owns a bakery and has been in this business for over eight years. He plans to use his loan to expand his business through purchasing new materials such as baking sets and ingredients, paying his workers, etc. His future plan is to establish bases in different districts to reach a wider market.

loans.use: To purchase new materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth vende especerías, productos que embolsa en pequeñas cantidades, sus ventas los realiza a las diferentes tiendas. Además Elizabeth junto a su esposo tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte publico a la selva ayacuchana.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de canela, hongos, laurel.
Los sueños de Elizabeth son vender sus productos por mayor y comprar otro carro.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank, which means Harvest in Quechua. Elizabeth is 23, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Elizabeth sells spices. She bags these products in small amounts. She makes her sales in different stores. Also, Elizabeth and her husband have a car. It is used for public transportation to the Ayacuchana jungle. Elizabeth needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy cinnamon, mushrooms, and bay leaves. Elizabeth’s dreams are to sell her products wholesale and to buy another car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cinnamon, mushrooms, and bay leaves

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel Y. sells stationery at Elmina. She is a single mother of four children with a senior high school education. Rachel has been selling stationery for some time now. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and the family's utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more stationery and other office supplies for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more stationery and other office supplies.

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de Panamericana, está en crecimiento, recibe cada semana asociaciones nuevas, como la asociación comunal de “Gaviotas”.
Esta asociación está conformada por 9 personas, 8 mujeres y un varón.  El socio que aparece en la foto es el esposo de una de las socias, como ella dice su “bombón”. Don Freddy L. tuvo que salir porque su hijo estaba inquieto.  Los negocios que se refieren son: confección de aguayos (tejido multicolores, de 120 centímetros por 120 centímetros, que les sirve a las mujeres para llevar a sus niños a la espalda), elaboración de macramé en manta, venta de ropa, artesanía en chompa, venta de Polleras, confección de ropa, elaboración de comida y artesanía en Pintura en Tela.
De entre todos estos negocios, el de elaboración y venta de polleras y mantas, corresponde a la señora Lucía A., socia de 52 años de edad, actualmente mantiene a tres  hijos menores, dos hijas ya están casadas y no dependen de ella.
Ella comenta que muchos años atrás vendía celulares, pero como no conocía mucho sobre los aparatos, le engañaron mucho dinero y tuvo que reiniciar otro negocio de cero. La venta de polleras y mantas es un negocio que conoce muy bien y puede desenvolverse sin dificultad. La señora Lucía sabe dónde comprar las telas para elaborar las polleras y mantas y si necesita ayuda una de sus hijas lo hace. Su solicitud de crédito es por Bs.2000.-
Comenta que lo que más le gusta de asistir a las reuniones a Pro Mujer es compartir con sus compañeras, conversar, reír;  también le gusta el ahorro que hace en cada pago pues sabe que poco a poco logrará tener un capital de respaldo.
texts.en:
The “Panamericana” focal center is growing; it receives new associations weekly such as the “Gaviotas” (Seagulls) communal bank. This association is made up of 9 members: 8 women and one man. The member in the photo is the husband of one of the members, as she calls him, her “sweetie.” Mr. Freddy L. had to step out because his son was restless. The businesses they are involved in are: weaving “aguayos” (multicolored woven items that are 120 centimeters by 120 centimeters that women use to carry their children on their backs), macramé blankets, clothing sales, sweater making, skirt sales, clothes making, food preparation and painted fabric crafts. Among all these occupations, the one corresponding to Lucia A., 52, is the sale of skirts and blankets. She supports three minor children; two other daughters are married and don’t depend on her any longer. She states that many years ago she sold cell phones but, because she didn’t know much about the devices, she was swindled out of much money and needed to start over again from square one in a new business. The sale of skirts and blankets is something she knows very well and she is able to unfold in it easily. Lucia knows where to buy fabric to make skirts and blankets and, if she needs help, one of her daughters steps in. She is asking for 2000 bolivianos. She states that what she likes best about Pro Mujer meetings is sharing with her fellow members, to chat, to laugh; she also likes the savings she can make with each payment because she knows that she will gradually amass fall-back capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, lining, embroidery hoop, thread.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline O. is a 29 year old mother of four children who lives in Nyalenda Kisumu Kenya.  She is a business woman who has been selling fish since 2008, after she quit vending vegetables. 

With her business she supports her family.  Her husband doesn’t have a stable job.

She wants to increase her stock and expand her business so she can earn enough income to enable her to build and own rental houses and to educate her children.  She wishes to get a loan of Ksh. 20000.  That she says will help put her on a course to achieve her goals.

loans.use: Increase stock of supplies.

loans.name: Laura Lizbeth

texts.es: La señorita Laura Lizbeth D.
texts.en: Laura Lizbeth D.

loans.use: Change the roof

loans.name: Mariscal Caceres Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Mariscal Cáceres” se encuentra ubicada en la zona llamada Andrés Avelino Cáceres, en el distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima, está conformado por 14 socios, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 8 años. Sus miembros realizan diversas actividades de producción, comercio y servicio.
Eulogia quien a su vez asume el cargo de presidenta, tiene 45 años, es conviviente tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 17 años, se dedica a la venta de jugos como ambulante en un paradero de Ate, desde hace 10 años, además también realiza venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria Eulogia apoya en la educación de sus hijos, y casi todos sus ingresos lo destina en el pago de pensión de sus hijos. El gran sueño de Eulogia es tener su propio puesto de jugueria. El reciente préstamo lo utilizará en la compra de mercadería para su negocio.  
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y están comprometidos a cumplir con los pagos según el cronograma otorgado por prosperidad. (En la foto hijos de los socios).
texts.en:
The Mariscal Caceres village bank is located in the Andres Avelino Caceres zone in the Ate district of Lima, Peru, and is composed of 14 members who have worked with EDAPROSPO for the past 8 years. The group members work in various fields including production, sales and services. Eulogia, the current president, is 45 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has 2 children who are 19 and 17 years old. She sells juices near a bus stop in Ate and has done so for 10 years; she also sells beauty products from a catalogue. Through Eulogia's efforts, she has supported her children's education and almost all her money goes to pay those expenses for her children. Her dream is to have her own juice stand. This loan will be used to buy inventory for the group members' businesses. All the members are grateful for the support they are receiving and are committed to making their payments on the scheduled dates.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for their businesses

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married to a taxi driver. They have seven children and all their children go to school. Aisha doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a poultry farm in Kawempe Kiyini zone, Kawempe division, Kampala district.

She has been a poultry farmer for over 20 years. Aisha wants to use this loan to buy more chicks and chicken feed. She works from her home. Her customers are nearby shops and chicken roasters from Kawempe and Bwaise market. She rears both broilers and layers and her farm consists of 300 chickens. Aisha works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include poultry diseases and transportation of feed from Mengo Kisenyi to her home in Kawempe. Her goals and aspirations are to own 700 chickens and to educate her children up to university. 

Aisha decided to work with MCDT because they were charging low interest rates compared to other MFIs. She resides in and owns a four-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Aisha‘s monthly expenses includes paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok O., who lives in Ta Chou village in Kandal province, was born in 1964. She is a fisher seller at her local market and earns some money to support her family's costs of living. Now she can sell the fish at a high enough income that she would like to expand her business, but she does not have enough money to achieve this goal. So to improve her business, Mrs. Sok O. is asking for a loan to buy more fish to resell. She is widow and has three children, all attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of herbicides, grains, and seeds

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina B. lives in a small area of the city of Vehari, Pakistan, called Anwerabad. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family. Her husband has a scrap business and she supports him by selling clothes. She has a number of clients in her area and in neighboring villages where she sells her clothes to earn an income.

Zarina B.’s husband’s business is not doing well these days due to the shortage of scrap material. Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband who will invest the money in his business to buy more scrap material. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will stand on its feet again with the help of this investment.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase more scrap for his scrap business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en su casa que gracias a mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir. Ella se dedica en la venta de comida, en las afueras de su domicilio, en un inicio vendía juguetes entre otros artículos. Cecilia es una mujer muy carismática y siempre tiene muchas energías para trabajar, es por ello que tiene varios clientes los cuales que siempre la consideran. Actualmente prepara chocolate caliente, pues este postre tiene mucha demanda en la temporada en la que vive. En un futuro quiere un negocio más estable como una tienda y dejarle este negocio a su hija, ya que le gusta este tipo de actividad. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprarse mayor cantidad de ingredientes para preparar sus platillos así como chocolates.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 56 years old. She lives together with her daughter in her house which she was able to acquire thanks to a great deal of effort. She works in food sales outside of her home. In the beginning she used to sell toys and other items. Cecilia is a very charismatic woman and she always has a lot of energy to work. This is why she has many customers who always consider her. She currently prepares hot chocolate; this dessert is in high demand in the current season. In the future she wants a more stable business such as a store and to leave this business to her daughter, since she likes this type of work. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual in all of her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a greater quantity of ingredients to prepare her food, such as chocolates.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare her foods and hot drinks.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda D. is from Barangay Mantic, Tangub City. She is 33 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Merlinda owns and operates a business providing sikad-sikad (pedicab) transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair her vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is the wife of M. A. and resides in a city called Multan, famous in Pakistan for its sweetmeats and shrines. She owns a small house of two rooms there and has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years.  

Shamim has given birth to six children: four daughters and two sons. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and read in different grades: 9th, 4th and 2nd respectively. She is bringing them up with care and discipline and wants to provide them with a quality education so they make their future bright. To achieve this purpose she works hard at running a boutique business in her house. 

She uses a room of her house for her boutique where she displays embroidered and non-embroidered dresses and attracts customers. People who approach her mostly are her neighbors. She imports cloth from Faisalabad and Lahore, famous for their textiles, and then sews them well and makes embroidery on them to give them a new look to attract more customers. She earns approximately 10,000 PKRs from her business. Her income becomes double on special occasions. Eid, the Muslim holiday which comes after Ramadan, is near and she can improve her sales on this occasion. That’s why she has applied for a loan from Asasah for this purpose.

With the loan amount she will buy cloth, colored thread and beads in large quantity which will help her to make more dresses to display in her boutique. She is in her 2nd loan and has shown herself to be a very responsible loan user of Asasah.

loans.use: Purchase required items for boutique business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 38 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo José de 65 años, y de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 ya son mayores e independientes. La vida para esta emprendedora mujer no ha sido fácil, pues desde que se casó muy joven debió cuidar de sus hijos, ahora que están grandes y ya no tiene mucha responsabilidad quiere instalar un negocio para salir adelante. Siempre le ha ayudado a trabajar a su conyugue, y por eso ahora quiere mandar a restaurar su casa y acondicionar una librería, pues por la zona donde vive no hay un negocio de ese rubro. Dice que el trabajo de su esposo, que tiene su taller de renovación de calzados, siempre les ha permitido tener una vida cómoda y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos, por ello cree que con este nuevo negocio podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá empezar a concretar sus sueños. Juana  tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la instalación de agua y desagüe en su casa, ya que no cuenta con este servicio; además también quiere acondicionar un ambiente para empezar con el negocio de librería, por lo que espera continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Juana, 38, lives in her own house with her husband, José, 65, and their five children, three of whom are independent adults. Life for this enterprising woman has not been easy because since marrying very young she has had to care for her children. Now that they are grown and she doesn’t have a lot of responsibilities she wants to open a business to get ahead. She has always helped her spouse work but now she wants to refurbish her house and set up a bookstore because in the area where she lives there are no similar businesses. She says that her husband’s work (he has a shoe repair shop) has always provided a comfortable life and a good education for their children so she feels that this new business will provide the family with a better quality of life. This is her second loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who funded the loan that will make it possible to have her dream come true. Juana plans to use the requested funds to install running water and drainage in her house because it currently lacks then both. She also wants to equip a space in it to set up her bookstore with which she hopes to continue forward.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to install running water and drainage in her house as well as to equip a space to install her book store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana Y. is a 47-year-old, married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a tricycle passenger transport, Avon (Beauty Products) dealership and the buying and selling of Batad (shells). She lives in the village of Baod, Bantayan, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business ventures, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10000. Juana is now borrowing PHP 29500 so that she can have some repairs and maintenance done on her motorcycle/tricycle unit and have some left over to use as additional working capital for her other businesses.  

This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 26000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Juana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 


About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 
Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Maintenance of Motorcycle

loans.name: Parmusenke Ole

texts.en:
Parmusenke Ole K. is 62 years old. He and his wife, Ntajiri K., have seven children. Parmusenke has reared cattle for ten years and his goal is to buy young heifers during the dry season when they are not very costly, then keep them in his farm, which he has fenced purposely for grazing. After the rainy season when the bulls have fattened he sells them at a higher price and earns a profit.

He learned about Kadet Ltd from marketing awareness done by Kadet staff members in his area. This will be his second loan, with which he is planning to buy ten more young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit.

With the anticipated profit he intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

His dream for the future is to rear cattle on a larger scale.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend Kshs 70,000 to buy seven heifers of Ksh10,000 each for fattening to sell later.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Fatmata.  She is married, and has three children ages 6, 10, and 12 years.  In 1998, Fatmata established her food items business.  She began her business to maximize her income, educate her children and create a savings account.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to add stock to her business by traveling to the neighboring country, Guinea.  

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000.  In the future, Fatmata plans to help her husband construct a house, educate her children and establish a savings account.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of grandnut for her business

loans.name: Santos Graciano

texts.es:
Don Santos de 59 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel donde vive con su familia su esposa y dos hijos que ya no dependen  de él; este oficio fue inculcado por su padres desde joven, ya que también se dedicaron al cultivo de la tierra, don Santos trabaja solo, sin horario fijo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de los materiales agrícolas, y alimentación para el ganado, esta ayuda le dará la oportunidad de cultivar y dar un buen cuido a la siembra pues tendrá los materiales como abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para plagas, al igual con su ganado podrá tenerles alimentación para un buen tiempo.
Uno de sus propósitos es administrar bien el préstamo, desarrollar su buena siembra y que a través de su negocio pueda ayudar a otras personas.
texts.en:
Santos is 59 years old.  He is a farmer, and he raises cattle.  He lives in the El Transito department of San Miguel.  He lives with his wife and two children.  His children are no longer dependent upon him.

His parents taught him this profession when he was young because they also cultivated the land.  Santos works alone without a fixed schedule.

He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and feed for his livestock.  This help will give him the opportunity to cultivate and take good care of his crops.  He will have materials like organic and chemical fertilizers and treatments for pest infestations.  He will also be able to have feed for his livestock for a good time.

His goals are to manage the loan well, to develop good crops, and to be able to help other people through his business.

loans.use: To buy organic and chemical fertilizers for his crops and feed for his livestock

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es productor lechero, cuya producción es  comercializada a la PIL (Planta Industrializadora de productos lácteos). Vive en la casa de sus padres, en la comunidad Ticuyo, a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene tres vacas lecheras, cuya leche es enviada al módulo que existe en su comunidad para su venta a la planta industrilizadora de leche; de esta manera genera ingresos para su manutención.
El crédito que ahora solicita es para la compra de otra vaca lechera, para de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO y primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Fernando produces milk.  He sells his milk to the PIL (industrial milk processing plant.)  He lives in his parent's house in the community of Ticuyo, which is 3 hours from the city of La Paz.  He has 3 milk cows, whose milk is sent to the milk processing plant in his community.  In this way he generates income to support himself.  He now requests a loan to purchase another dairy cow, so that in this way he can increase his earnings.

This is his second loan with IMPRO, and his first loan funded through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase his production of milk.

loans.name: Kyehemba Turihamwe Group

texts.en:
Christopher N. is the leader of the Kyehemba Turihamwe group in Kyenjojo. He is 48 years old and married with seven children aged five to nineteen years old. Christopher has been selling produce in Kyakaitaba trading center for four years. He mainly sells maize, beans, peas and so on, and in addition to this he is also involved in rearing and selling goats.

Christopher needs a loan to buy produce like dry beans and Irish potatoes for resale with the hope that he will see greater profits. Christopher is hardworking, and his dream is to have a continually stable business to support his family.

loans.use: To buy produce like dry beans and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie O., 25, is from the village of Puntian, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is single. To make a living, Rosalie owns and operates a business providing motorcycle tire repair services to local community members. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase materials needed to expand her service offering. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide her services. This will be her third loan from HSPFI and she plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide services.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora, de 57 años, está casada con Francisco, de 61 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo vive con su hija Sonia, de 30 años de edad, y su nieta Alexia, de 4 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica Isidora, es la venta de comida para ello tiene un restaurante que abrió en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, donde trabaja con la ayuda de su hija. Hace 7 años que emprendió este negocio, y según menciona se siente realizada y con muchos proyectos para el futuro, pues su buena disposición en la venta de comida le asegura su éxito, todos los días de lunes a viernes, prepara comida criolla, mientras que los fines de semana ella cocina platos típicos de la región, pues son las fechas donde la mayoría de los pobladores salen a pasear con su familia. Pero como la comida que prepara es muy buena, Isidora también ofrece pensión, sirviendo; desayuno, almuerzo y cena a un buen precio. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, y como socia nueva de su banco comunal se siente orgullosa por los ahorros obtenidos hasta el momento, ya que en una de las charlas que recibe, le enseñaron ahorrar e invertir. De obtener el crédito, lo invertirá en la compra sacos de arroz, azúcar, fideos, papa y demás insumos para la preparación de sus exquisitos platos, con ello podrá abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isidora is 57 years old and is married to Francisco, who is 61 years old.  They have 5 children but only their daughter Sonia,30, and their granddaughter Alexia, 4, live with them. They live as a family in their own home located in the city of Merced (jungle in central Peru).  With the help of her daughter, Isidora runs a restaurant that is located in the city center. She started this business 7 years ago and it has been fulfilling for her along with the many projects she has planned for the future.  Her good disposition has ensured her restaurant success.  Every day, Monday through Friday, she prepares creole cuisine.  On the weekends she prepares traditional dishes from the region as this is when the majority of residents go walking with their families.  Since the food that she prepares is so good she offers board also, serving breakfast, lunch and dinner at an affordable price.  

This is her third loan with MFP.   As a new member of her communal bank she is proud of what she has saved to date since in one of their talks they taught her to save and invest.  She will use the loan to purchase sacks of rice, sugar, noodles, potatoes and other items for the preparation of her exquisite dishes that she will serve her customers.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, sugar, noodles, potatoes and other items for the preparation of her dishes

loans.name: Evana

texts.en: Evana is currently in a business of selling "kimbo", beer and "suko".  She is 35 years old, married to a farmer, and has 6 children, three of whom go to school.  She requested a loan to stock more kimbo, beer and suko to sell.  With extra profits, Evana hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more kimbo, beer and suko to sell.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
Mrs. Prom S. is a villager who lives in Chrouy Pisei village in Kandal province. She was born in 1955, and is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.
Mrs. Prom S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows different vegetables to sell to support her family. In her business, she faces a problem with insufficient funds to grow vegetables. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide, and to pay for farming laborers to cultivate her vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticide, and to pay for farm laborers

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia B. is from the village of Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del  Norte. She is 40 years old. Cynthia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Cynthia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector in the community she sell variety of product such as  shampoo,soap and etcetera that are needs to households. Cynthia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Cynthia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cynthia is requesting a loan of 2000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cynthia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of soap and shampoo

loans.name: David Miguel

texts.es:
DAVID MIGUEL F. G., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJA EN MANTENIMIENTO,  PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS Y ESTOS SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON DAVID ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA, BLOQUES PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR UN MURO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION Y BRINDARLE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA SU FAMILIA.
AGRADECE A CEPRODEL POR LOS PRESTAMOS OTORGADOS YA QUE ESTOS HANSIDO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA.
texts.en:
David Miguel F. G. is from Managua. He is employed as a janitor. He has three children and they are school aged. 

David approached the offices of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) to request a new loan to be used for home improvements. He will invest in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, sand, and construction blocks. He will build a wall in his house. These home improvements are done to provide his family with better living conditions. 

He is thankful to Ceprodel for the loans that have been granted. They have been a used to carry out home improvements

loans.use: Construction materials.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.es: Emelda D. es una mujer que vive en el Centro de Malambo, municipio ubicado en el área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla;  ella es una mujer muy inquieta en el tema de invertir para generar ingresos, es así como tiene dos negocios desde hace 30 años,  uno donde confecciona ropa femenina, masculina e infantil y una ebanistería que inició en compañía de su hermano,  quien trabajaba  en un taller y desde allí se le ocurrió la idea que  propuso a Emelda  : invirtir dinero  en este negocio y el respondería por  la mano de obra. Desde ese mismo momento se dedicaron a la ebanistería, la que gradualmente ha ido creciendo en clientes y en activos fijos;  En la actualidad él  opera el taller y Emelda se encarga de la comercialización;  sus principales productos son  alcobas, comedores,  puertas y ventanas.  Este es su tercer  financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con este capital de trabajo dirigido a su negocio, ha logrado aumentar el ingreso y con ello responder a  sus gastos familiares,  especialmente al mejoramiento de las condiciones de bienestar de su hija de 23 años, con la que sueña verla como un profesional de mucho éxito; así mismo está muy satisfecha porque con su negocio ha logrado darle trabajo a muchas personas que necesitan sostener su hogar. Con su  primer credikiva comprará materias primas e insumos para ambos negocios en un mayor volumen: madera, y pegantes para fabricar muebles encargados y  telas, correderas y accesorios para la confección, inversiones  que pronostican ser exitosas, pues con ellas responderá a pedidos de sus clientes  actuales y referídos.
texts.en:
Emelda D. is a woman who lives in the Centro de Malambo.  This municipality is located in the metropolitan area of the city of Barranquilla.  She is a woman who is very eager about investing in order to generate income.  That is why she has had two businesses for 30 years.  One business is making clothes for women, men, and children.  The other business is making cabinets with her brother, who worked in a shop.  This gave him the idea that he proposed to Emelda.  The idea was to invest money in this business, and he would be responsible for the labor.  From that very moment they devoted themselves to cabinet making.

The business has gradually grown.  They have more customers and fixed assets.  He currently runs the workshop, and Emelda takes charge of the marketing.  Their main products are for bedrooms, dining rooms, doors, and windows.

This is her third loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With this working capital for her business, she has managed to increase her income.  She has also been able to pay for the family expenses.  She has most especially been able to improve conditions for the well-being of her 23 year old daughter.  She dreams of seeing her daughter become a very successful professional.

She is very happy because her business has managed to give work to a lot of people who need it to support their households.

With her first Kiva loan she will buy raw materials and supplies for both businesses.  She will buy a greater amount of wood, glue to upholster ordered furniture, fabric, runners, and accessories for making her products.  She predicts that these investments will be successful.  She will use them to fill orders from her current customers and the customers who have been referred to her.

loans.use: to buy a supplies for both businesses.  She will buy more wood and glue to upholster ordered furniture, fabric, runners, and accessories for making her products.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina de 44 años, natural de la ciudad de Huanta; esta casada con Sergio de 47 años de edad y tienen 05 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa ubicado en el distrito de Santa Rosa. Ricardina, es una mujer muy laboriosa con su arduo trabajo trata de sobresalir ante las adversidades del destino. Ella es comerciante y tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en el mercado del distrito de Santa Rosa. La bodega de Ricardina es la primera en abrirse, apertura las puertas de su negocio desde las 06 de la mañana y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la certeza de que van a encontrar los productos indicados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y así estar al tanto de las cosas que suceden en su ámbito circular, lleva 08 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa ampliar su bodega es por ello que viene construyendo su propio lote de terreno. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, siente que el crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy adulada por ser participe y colaboradora por el resto de los socios. Con los 3, 000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará víveres para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ricardina is 44 years old and from the town of Huanta.  She is married to 47 year-old Sergio and has 5 children.  They live together in their own home, in Santa Rosa district.

Ricardina is a very industrious woman who works hard and tries do well even when faced with the adversities that fate places in her path.  Ricardina is a saleswoman who has a grocery store in Santa Rosa district market.  Her store is always the first to open.  She opens her doors at 6.00am, ready to receive her first customers.  Ricardina's customers know that her store offers a good variety of merchandise and they don't hesitate to buy from her since they can be certain that they will find the products they need.

What Ricardina most enjoys about her work is chatting to her customers and thereby being aware of what is happening in the community around her.  She has been in this business for 8 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay on her feet throughout the day.

Ricardina will use her loan to buy more food products for her business so that she can stock it with merchandise.  Over time, she plans to expand her store.  She has been building her own plot of land for this purpose.

This is Ricardina's eighth loan from MFP.  She feels that the loan will help her a lot in making progress in her work.  She is very well liked by the other members of her community bank owing to her participation and contributions.  Ricardina will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy food products to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her business

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah, 42, is married and has five children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.

Dinah has been in the bar and hotel business for eleven years, and it’s still booming. Her problem is drunk customers who break her glasses.

Dinah wants a loan to buy seats and more drinks to sell. Her vision is to move to a bigger bar, build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy seats and more drinks to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza C. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran Zambo. Del sur. She is 30 years old. Analiza is married and has school-aged children. Analiza has her own general store which sells daily use products such as sugar, milk, canned goods, shampoo, soap & toothpaste. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

Analiza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase dried fish, rice and corn grits for resale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Analiza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, rice and corn grits for resale

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush, who lives in the city of Vanadzor with her retired mother, received higher education in the field of economics. For many years, she  has been running a trading business selling imported clothes and crockery from Yerevan in her shop in Vanadzor.  Siranush’s niece helps her in the business, so some of the business income goes to Siranush's brother's family. 

Siranush is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 AMD from Kiva lenders to import an assortment of summer clothes for her business. This will be her 22nd loan from Nor Horizon and her second loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To import an assortment of summer clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fokognouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Fokognouman, sont toutes des femmes mariées ont en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massoukou, sous préfecture de Fana; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font exclusivement le commerce de charbon de bois.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Fokognouman sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.                                                                        
SALI, qui est la présidente du groupe compte acheter, 25 sacs charbon de bois avec les paysans producteurs du village et environs. Elle effectue sa vente quotidiennement au village de Massoukou, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité
texts.en:
The women of the Fokognouman group are all married with an average age of 36 years old and three children; they all live in extended traditional families in the village of Massoukou, in the sub-prefecture of Fana, which lies in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other through relatives, neighbors and friends. They trade exclusively in charcoal.

The women in this group are on their second solidarity loan.

Sali, who is the president of the group, is planning to buy 25 sacks of charcoal from the peasant producers in the village and surrounding areas. She carries out her sales every day in the village of Massoukou, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which will be used to make her loan repayments and contribute to social ceremonies; the balance will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 35 years, he has operated a clothes-selling business, selling in a shop and from door to door to his neighbours. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation from rural areas to his place of operation. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) he wants to purchase bundles of khangas (brightly colored patterned cloth, commonly worn as a wrap or scarf)  and baby clothes for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of khangas and baby clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Femme d’un transitaire et maman de 02 enfants, Ablavi est à son deuxième cycle. Elle vend depuis 2005 du charbon de bois et divers à HEDRZANAWOE après achat à l’intérieur du pays.
texts.en: The wife of a forwarding agent and mother of two children,  Ablavi is on her second loan. She has been selling charcoal and various items since 2005 in HEDRZANAWOE after buying the goods in the interior of the country.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fidélia

texts.fr: Couturière de profession, Fidélia est mariée et mère d’ 01 enfant. Elle a une passion rendre belle toute personne. Depuis 2002 elle a ouvert son atelier. Elle vend des pagnes.  Ce prêt qu’elle sollicite lui servira à acheter des marchandises pour coudre afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle a une ambition : devenir une couturière de renom.
texts.en: A dress designer by profession, Fidélia is married and has one child. Her passion is to make everyone look beautiful. In 2002, she opened her own workshop. She sells pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African clothing). This loan that she is seeking will serve to buy merchandise to sew in order to satisfy her customers. She has one ambition: to become a well-known designer.

loans.use: To buy and sew pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth)

loans.name: Neulidah

texts.en:
Neulidah is 22 years old and married to Walter, who supports his family by selling livestock. Her child is three years old. She practices farming and has been in business for four years. Right now, her monthly income from the business is 11,700 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is borrowing 20,000 KES which she plans to use to buy fertilizer. She plans to start a cosmetics business with the anticipated profit from her business.

This is Neulidah's second loan and she successfully repaid her previous loan. Her dreams and hopes are to start her own academy and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Víctor Martín

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Víctor  Martin es casado, tiene a su cargo una persona es luchadora, responsable, con buenos valores y principios  morales, que lucha para sacar adelante sus hijos para un futuro mejor. 

A esta oficina de ceprodel se presento  a solicitar crédito que será utilizado para  remodelación de su vivienda, en hacer muro,  para darle más seguridad  a su familia y agradece a ceprodel la oportunidad con este desembolso compra materiales de construcción tales como bloque, hierro, cemento, arena.
texts.en:
Señor Victor Martin is from Managua city and is married with one dependent.  He is a fighter, a responsible man with good values and moral principles who is fighting so that his children can get ahead and have a better future.

He came to this CEPRODEL office to request a loan that will be used to remodel his house: to build a wall that will provide more security for his family.  He is grateful to CEPRODEL for this opportunity to defray the cost of buying construction materials such as concrete blocks, iron, cement and sand

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fanny Patricia

texts.es:
Fanny es socia del  Banco Comunal  “Vallecito Vizcachani”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y  departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo.  Ella cuenta con educación superior.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace un ciclo, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/.  300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de productos de la Región como habas, chuño, cebada, quinua, etc.
Con éste nuevo crédito por la suma de S/.  300.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio y comprará cinco arrobas de quinua, chuño, habas. En el negocio trabaja junto con su suegra, su esposo trabaja en una orquesta y es músico.
La señora desea prosperar en el negocio, por ello está trabajando mucho.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, el ahorro y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Fanny’s a member of the “Vallecito Vizcachani” (Little Vizcachani Valley) communal bank located in Puno District, Puno Province and Department.  She’s 26 years old, has a spouse and a son.  She completed high school.

She’s worked with the Manuela R. Movement for one cycle.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her business selling regional products like lima beans, dehydrated potato, barley, quinoa, etc.

She will use this new, 300 new sol, loan to increase working capital buying five arrobas (1 arroba=25lbs. approx.) of quinoa, dehydrated potato and lima beans.  She works with her mother-in-law in this business; her husband is a musician and works in an orchestra.

She hopes to prosper in business and this is why she is working so much.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loan, the savings and her profits.

loans.use: to buy five arrobas of quinoa, dehydrated potatoes and lima beans.

loans.name: Saparbek

texts.ru: Сапарбек  60-летний вдовец, живущий в с .Токтоян (северо-восточная часть Кыргызстана). С 1992 года семья Сапарбека успешно занимается перепродажей сельхоз продукции и скота. Благодаря доходам от своего бизнеса, Сапарбек смог дать хорошее образование своим детям. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Сапарбека насчитывается три лошади, четыре коровы и 25 овец. Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Сапарбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для закупа 4 бычков для откорма. Планируемую прибыль Сапарбек намерен использовать для реконструкции сарая  в целях обеспечения хороших условий для содержания скота.
texts.en: Suparbek is a 60-year-old widower, living in the Toktoyan village (north-eastern part of Kyrgyzstan).  Saparbek's family has been successfully involved in reselling agricultural products and livestock since 1992.  Thanks to the income from his business, Saparbek was able to provide his children with a good education.  Today, he owns three horses, four cows and twenty-five sheep.  To further increase his livestock headcount, Saparbek went to the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to request a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy buy four calves for fattening up.  Saparbek plans to use the expected profits to reconstruct a barn in order to provide good conditions for livestock keeping.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Avelina has a food shop that sells candies, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy snacks, candies and beverages to sell. Avelina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Avelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, candies and beverages to sell

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es: El señor Patricio es un hombre muy trabajador y un padre responsable que esta dispuesto ofrecer a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida. Patricio es chofer de trasporte urbano desde hace 30 años ofreciendo su servicio en diferentes colonias de la ciudad, de acuerdo la ruta que le toque. Para Patricio es muy importante tener su camión en mejores condiciones ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para cubrir sus gatos. Por tal motivo solicita de un préstamo para comprar auto partes y pagar al mecánico, de esta manera el ofrecerá un mejor servicio y seguridad a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Patricio is a hard working man and a responsible father that is willing to give his children a better quality of life. 

Patricio has been a city bus driver for 30 years offering his service in various suburbs of the city, according to his assigned route. 

For Patricio it is very important that his bus is in excellent condition as it is his only source of income to pay his household expenses. The reason he is asking for this loan is to buy auto parts and to pay the mechanic as in this way he can offer better service and safety for his passengers.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of his bus

loans.name: Rayisomzita Group

texts.fr:
Mme Madina est la représentante du groupe RAYISOMZITA. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 17mois. Deux(02) de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle vend du sucre et du sel depuis 13ans. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes au marché. Ses clients sont celles qui vendent les jus, les galettes et la bouillie.

Elle veut s’acheter 06 sacs de sucre de 50kilogrammes, 03sacs de sel.

Mme avec ses économies aide son mari dans les dépenses familiales. Elle ambitionne son activité en ouvrant une boutique pour ses produits et être une grossiste plus tard.
texts.en:
Madina is the representative of the RAYISOMZITA group.  She is married and has three children.  Her eldest is 11 years old and her youngest is 17 months old.  Two of her children attend school.  She is responsible for one other person.

Madina has been selling sugar and salt for 13 years.  She stocks up at the wholesalers in the market.  Her customers are people who sell juice, cookies and baby cereal.

Madina would like to buy six 50kg sacks of sugar and three sacks of salt.

Madina will use her savings to help her husband with their family expenses.  She plans to open a store from which to sell her products and to later become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy six 50kg sacks of sugar and three sacks of salt

loans.name: Fawziah

texts.en:
Fawziah is 43 years old and a mother of eight sons and daughter. She is married to Izzat who has a car repair workshop where he changes wheels and sells special car oil.

After he retired from the military, he opened his workshop to be able to support his big family. Fawziah wants to help her husband to make more income in the workshop so she decided to apply for this loan and buy more high quality car oil that is required for the new model cars. Because Fawziah is a conservative person, she preferred that her husband Izzat appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more high quality car oil for her husband's auto repair shop

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 31 years old and married to Wanjiku. The couple has two children. For the past three years, James has operated a retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a field officer and this will be his first loan.  

James is requesting a loan to buy more goods such as sugar, salt, rice, and washing detergent to sell in his retail shop. In the future, he hopes to become a wholesaler, provide an education for his children, and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice, and washing detergent

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 31 years old and has been in farming for 4 years. He produces milk and maize for the local market. He is married with 3 children, aged between eight and twelve years.

Anthony has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this will boost his farming income and provide his family with milk for consumption and income to meet other family needs.

He laments the high capital costs of farming and animal feeds, especially for dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Muendi

texts.en: Muendi is single and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. She has been running a grocery business for the last seven years to support her family. She also runs a business washing cars to supplement her income. She has employed one person to assist her to manage the business. Muendi is requesting a loan of 9000 KES to buy tomatoes, fruits and vegetables for resale. In the next five years, she plans to establish a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Leonisia Isabel

texts.es:
Leonisia, vive con sus tres hijos de 18, 12, 8 años de edad y con su esposo, ella es artesana, elabora ollas, comales, sartenes de barro, también artículos de madera y tela, con pinturas decorativas.
Ella inicio hace tres años, por iniciativa propia, ellos se deciden a formar grupos de personas para fomentar la pintura, hoy en día tienen un taller, donde ofrecen recuadros, recuerdos adornos, llaveros. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como pintura, madera, loza, pinceles y una computadora para hacer bocetos de pintura. Este préstamo le ayudara a ir progresando como microempresaria, contando con las herramientas necesarias para el funcionamiento del taller.
Su aspiración es en un futuro tener clientes en el extranjero y exportar sus productos, así darse a conocer en otros mercados, además quiere educar a los jóvenes para que aprendan este oficio y puedan defenderse con un empleo digno.
texts.en:
Leonisia lives with her three children who are 18, 12 and 8 years of age and with her husband.  She’s a craftswoman.  She makes pots, griddles, and clay pans and also items made of wood and fabric with decorative paintings.

She started three years ago on her own initiative.  They decided to form groups of people to foster painting and today they have a workshop where they sell paintings, keepsakes, decorations and key chains.  She is currently asking for a loan to buy supplies like paint, wood, dinnerware, brushes and a computer to make patterns for paintings.  This loan will help her make progress as a micro businesswoman by having the necessary tools for the workshop’s function.

Her goal for the future is to have customers abroad and to export her products to become known in other markets.  She also wants to teach young people so that they can learn this occupation and be able to support themselves with proper employment.

loans.use: to buy paint, wood, dinnerware, brushes and a computer.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 37 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional stock of items to sell. She has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as spices, noodles, canned goods, and eggs. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Makau

texts.en: Makau is 39 years old and married with three children aged 9,13 and 16. She owns a grocery shop and has been in the business for six years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to manage her finances. She wants to open a shop and also be the main distributor of vegetables in the future. She has applied for KES 50,000 to buy tomatoes, potatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Ada Zila

texts.es: Ada Zila es una emprendedora que lucha por salir adelante día a día  junto con sus hijos, esta emprendedora ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000 en el cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseo de superación  en el negocio y en lo personal. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios que es la mejor herencia que le dejara. Actualmente Ada Zila está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de pantalones para damas, caballeros, niños, blusa, cosméticos entre otros productos que demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ada Zila is an entrepreneur who fights to get ahead every day with her children.  This entrepreneur has had a loan already with Fundación León 2000, in which she has shown herself to be a responsible person with a desire to improve herself in business and personally.  Her biggest dream is that her children will finish their studies, which is the best legacy she will leave them.

Currently Ada Zila is requesting a loan to invest in her business by buying pants for women, men, and children; blouses; cosmetics; and other products that her customers request.

loans.use: to buy pants for women, men, and children; blouses; cosmetics; and other products.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a business woman. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. To earn extra income, she sells second-hand clothes. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income, and she hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She has applied for 40,000 KES to buy a hair blow-dry machine and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow-dry machine and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Abdul.  He is married and has two children aged 6 and 2. In 2006, Abdul established his used clothing business. He began his business to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,177,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Abdul has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy 5 bales of ladies' used clothing to improve his stall. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 506,110.

 In the future, Abdul plans to move to a shop. He thinks the loan can increase his stock thus allow for more profit. When it rains, business is disturbed.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used clothing

loans.name: Rasmieh

texts.en: Rasmieh is a 52 year old married woman who has 8 family members from Bani Kenanah Irbid Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements, she wants to do maintenance of the home. In the future she wants to buy electronics and she hopes to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is a married woman, 63 years old, with 10 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Welma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

Welma has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Virginia Guisela

texts.es: Virginia tiene 24 años de edad, esta soltera y trabaja en una clínica particular ya que termino su carrera profesional de enfermería en la universidad y tiene en mente seguir estudiando y especializarse en emergencias y seguir trabajando arduamente ya que la profesión que escogió seguir le agrada. El préstamo lo utilizara para pagar el curso de titulación que necesita para poder titularse y seguir creciendo profesional y laboralmente. Ella se siente muy contenta y agradecida con el apoyo que está recibiendo por parte de los inversionistas de kiva y pide encarecidamente que esto continúe con muchos jóvenes que como ella lo necesitan para poder cumplir con sus objetivos.

loans.use: PAGAR EL CURSO DE TITULACION PROFESIONAL

loans.name: Asotolu

texts.en:
Asotolu is married with three children.

Her business is making donuts which she sells around her village and also at the local primary school. She also has a small canteen at the primary school where she sells snack food and small meals like fried rice, fish and chips and taro. Sometimes she sells fish and chips, taro and taro leaf with Samoan  oil in the village. She is now up to her fourth loan with SPBD which has helped her to develop her business activity. For her next loan she wants to buy more ingredients for her food, school fees and some vynil for her floor.

She is pictured sitting in her Samoan house with utensils used for her business such as containers and a frying pan. The house is typical open style in Samoa with typical decoration.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for donuts and also stock for her stall

loans.name: Catarino

texts.en:
Catarino is married and has 4 children who are currently studying. Catarino has a business selling hardware. His children help him even though they are studying, they help out with the family business. Catarino’s business is located in his house, and his sales have allowed him to help educate his children.

Catarino knows the business well and knows that there are times during the year when demand increases. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to stock up on inventory to supply his business. The amount that Catarino is asking for is $550, which he offers to pay back in 6 to 12 months. He is awaiting the requested support and trusts that the lenders will help him. Because of this, he and his family are very appreciative.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Catarino es un hombre casado que tiene 4 hijos, los cuales están actualmente estudiando. Catarino tiene un negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes, en el cual le ayudan sus hijos que a pesar de estar estudiando, colaboran con él en este negocio familiar. El negocio de Catarino esta ubicado en su casa, y con sus ventas ha logrado y mantiene aún ayudándole en la educación de sus hijos.

Catarino conoce bien el negocio y sabe en que épocas del año su demanda se incrementa por lo que actualmente esta solicitando un crédito para abastecerse de mercancía y a la vez surtir los productos de su negocio. El monto que Catarino solicita es de US $ 550 que ofrece pagar en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Espera el apoyo solicitado y confía en que los prestamistas lo van a ayudar por lo que él y su familia están muy agradecidos.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his hardware store

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
Patria D. is a single mother raising her three children: Evelina Rosario (26), Mabel (23), and Patricia (20). Her best-selling products are women’s shoes, but she also sells clothing, wallets and purses. Through word of mouth and a loyal client base, Patria runs the store out of her home but occasionally sells her merchandise on the street to reach new customers. She is requesting this loan to expand her inventory and give her customers a wider selection so that her sales will increase. Patria and her children live in the town of Sanchez on the western part of Samana.

NOTE: Patria is one of five microentrepreneurs in in Sanchez who have come together to form a solidarity group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying $150 each of this $750 loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their business and family.

loans.use: Purchase shoes, wallets and purses

loans.name: Oeu

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeu N. is 57 years old and is a vendor selling porridge and dessert in a busy market, where she usually makes on average about $5 each day. She is a mother of 5 children, two of whom work for a local private company and the rest are students. 
Currently, one of her children would like to conduct a motor-taxi, which would enable him to make additional profits for his family. Yet recently, he has faced a financial constraint. Therefore, Mrs. Oeu N. is humbly requesting for a loan to assist him.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle to operate a business as a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
Evelia is divorced, has two young children, and started her business when she separated from her husband, since she is responsible for their children and with what she gets in child support from her ex-husband she cannot cover the family's expenses because her ex-husband works as an employee in a business and does not make much money. She was invited by a friend more than 3 years ago to see the american products they could sell, and now she has many clients and many Avon products. She also sells women's shoes and is responsible for 25 more sellers, since her sales have been growing a lot and she wants to continue to grow.

Evelia is asking for a loan for US $ 375 to buy merchandise and to be able to fulfill her clients' orders. She offers to pay the loan in 6 months. She and her family are very thankful for the support you give her to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Evelia está separada de su esposo, tiene dos hijos menores y empezó con su negocio cuando se separo de su esposo ya que se quedo a cargo de sus hijos y con lo que recibe de pensión de su ex esposo no le alcanza para cubrir los gastos familiares, ya que su ex esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa y no gana mucho, así ella fue invitada por una amiga hace más de 3 años para ver los productos americanos que podía vender y ahora ya cuenta con muchos clientes y además de productos Avon también vende calzado para dama y tiene a su cargo 25 vendedoras más, ya que ella ha ido creciendo mucho con sus ventas y desea continuar con su crecimiento.

Evelia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para comprar mercadería y así poder tener el surtido que necesita y abastecer los pedidos de sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia están muy agradecidos por el apoyo que le das para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Avon products and women's shoes)

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, rice, vegetables and other goods

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en:
Jannet is 53, married with 7 children, and she cares for 6 orphaned relatives. As I have written in other stories, most people take care of orphans. In Jannet’s case these are her grandchildren. Several of her children have died.

Uganda was one of the hardest hit African nations when it came to the AIDS epidemic. In the late 1990’s it is believed that almost one in three person’s in the capitol city of Kampala had HIV/AIDS. To its credit, Uganda has done one of the best jobs of reducing the number to around 5.6% as of 2005. But the effect of the epidemic is that there is a whole generation “missing”. In Uganda, there are old people and young people, but noticeably fewer middle aged people. Half the population of Uganda is under the age of 15 and the birth rate is one of the highest in the world.

Jannet has a retail shop and four cows which are cross breeds. Cross breeds tend to be less prone to disease and give more milk. With her loan she plans to buy 4 pigs and to add cooking oil, sugar, maize flour, and sauce pans to her shop. Her dream is to one day buy a plot of land and build some rental houses.

loans.use: With her loan, Jannet plans to buy 4 pigs and to add cooking oil, maize flour, and saucepans to her retail store.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu has five children and all are in school. As a widow, Isatu has to provide an income for the family. She sells fire wood in the out-skirts of Makeni town in Sierra Leone. Isatu finds it difficult to run her business without interruption during the rainy season as it is not easy for vehicles to go to the villages due to bad roads. Sufficient capital to purchase a big lorry of wood is an obstacle.

At the moment, Isatu is requesting a loan of $525 to purchase a good stock and store it for the rainy season. This will expand her business and increase her income. Isatu is 40 years old.

loans.use: Purchase an entire cart load of firewood to store for the rainy season when wood is in higher demand

loans.name: Bagulete Ii A Group

texts.en:
Hadijah N. is a 37-year-old mother of three living in Kamuli, Uganda. She makes a living running a retail shop, earning $20,000 Ugandan shillings—or $12 U.S. dollars—a week. A loan could help her expand her store. Hadijah says she'd use the extra profits to help her family meet basic needs. One of their greatest expenses is paying for her children's school fees.

Hadijah has applied for a loan of $1,150 U.S. dollars along with four other women. In this type of group loan, the money is divided among each woman to invest in her own business. They guarantee each other's loans, so that if one woman can't repay it, the others will cover her share. Berna W. will use her portion to buy more piglets for her pig-rearing business, while Salma N. wants to purchase a fridge for her retail shop. Meanwhile, Rashid N. will start a new business and Jesca Kimbumba hopes to grow her retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock to expand a retail shop

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a single mother who is raising two teenage children. She has a fourteen year old and a seventeen year old. Margarita works hard to support her family with her small clothing sales business. She has been selling for three years and makes around $200 per month in profit. Her business is located at a busy outdoor market where she has a small covered space.

Margarita has requested a loan of $400 to purchase some additional clothing inventory and try to increase her profits. We are happy for this opportunity to assist Margarita as she seeks to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing inventory

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de Dios is a very responsible man, and when he was only 19 he had the great responsibility of becoming a father. Now he is 31 he has 3 kids who he adores, and they help him to carry on going as a farmer. Along with farming, Juan and his lovely wife Antonia work in agriculture, which is an activity they know a lot about and have a lot of experience in. Due to this fact they are very happy with the results of this business. Thinking about their good calves, Juan would like to buy some roughage to give them better nutrition, and therefore increase the productivity of their milk. This would give him income enough to cover their most urgent needs. With your contribution you will help Juan and his family’s projects.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juan de Dios es un hombre muy responsable, a la edad de 19 años asumió la gran responsabilidad de ser padre, actualmente a sus 31 años ya alberga a 3 inquietos niños quienes son su mayor adoración y el motor que lo impulsa a seguir adelante perseverando con su noble labor de ganadero.Adicionalmente a la producción de ganado don Juan y su querida esposa Antonia se dedican a la agricultura, actividades que con su amplio conocimiento y experiencia vienen desenvolviéndose eficientemente y se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos por los resultados que han ido obteniendo.Pensando en sus generosas becerritas don Juan tiene pensado comprar forraje para mejorar la alimentación de sus animalitos y por ende mejorará la producción y productividad de leche, ingresos con el que también cubrirán sus necesidades más urgentes. Con vuestra contribución permitirás concretar los proyectos de don Juan y su querida familia.

loans.use: To buy balanced foods to better nourish his cows/Compra de alimento balanceado y forraje para mejorar la nutrición de sus vaquitas.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es:
Bonifacio is a 55 years old man and lives with his family in the Community of Calamarca in the Province of Aroma. Bonifacio and his wife harvest tuber crops that they sell in the fairs at Villa Remedios, Vilaque since 30 years ago. At present his son has a cattle business in which he has three years of experience. Although there is competition, Bonifacio’s advantage is his excellent customer service and above all his extensive experience in the area allows him to work with responsibility, generally his sales stand is in the main plaza of Remedios.
