The present credit will be for the acquisition of cattle to help in the business of his son. Bonifacio does not have negative credit history in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Bonifacio tiene 55 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en la Comunidad de Calamarca en la Provincia de Aroma desde que nació. Se dedica a la comercialización de papa, chuño y tunta, que vende en las ferias de Villa remedios, Vilaque desde hace 30 años atrás junto a su esposa. Actualmente su hijo tiene un negocio de ganado vacuno donde cuenta con una experiencia de tres años. Si bien existe competencia en el mercado la ventaja de Bonifacio es su excelente trato a los clientes y sobre todo su amplia experiencia en el rubro lo que le permite trabajar con responsabilidad, generalmente su puesto de venta es en la plaza principal de Remedios. El presente crédito será para la adquisición de ganado vacuno para ayudar en el negocio de su hijo. Bonifacio no tiene antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Candido Herculano

texts.pt:
Candido is 55 years old and he is from the province of Inhambane. He was never married. Candido has 12 children: 6 girls and 6 boys. He lives with 5 of them with ages between 5 and 14 years old. The other and oldest ones are all employed and have their own families. Candido is also responsible for his parents who still live in Inhambane; he sends them MTn 600 every month. In 1974, Candido decided to go to Namaacha, a village from the province of Maputo which borders Swaziland, to look for work. He was hired as a permanent teacher there because he had completed high school plus a 2-year education training program. Candido has worked in the same school for 33 years as a teacher and also as a principal. He works from 6:45am until 12:10pm and then from 3:30pm until 6:30pm earning a monthly salary of MTn 8,015. The maximum he has been able to save from that is MTn 2,000 but this does not happen frequently. This is Candido's first loan request from Hluvuku and Kiva. Candido already lives in his own home but he is building a second one for his children and his second wife. After hearing about Hluvuku from friends, Candido decided to make the request in the amount of MTn 10,000 that will help in the construction. He wishes to purchase more material and speed up the work. The greatest dream Candido has is the completion of his children's education, preferably at the university level.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Candido tem 55 anos de idade e é natural da província de Inhambane. Solteiro porque nunca casou oficialmente, Candido tem 12 filhos, 6 meninas e 6 rapazes, mas vive somente com 5 deles, com idades entre 14 e 5 anos. Os mais velhos já são empregados e tem suas famílias. Alem disso, Candido tem sob sua responsabilidade os pais que ainda moram em Inhambane, enviando-lhes mensalmente MTn 600. Em 1974 Candido decide ir a Namaacha, uma vila na província de Maputo e na fronteira com a Swazilandia, a procura de emprego. Foi contratado como professor permanente por já ter concluído o ensino médio e a formação de professores de 2 anos. Candido trabalha na mesma escola como professor, e hoje em dia como diretor também, fazem 33 anos. Trabalha das 6:45h as 12:10h e das 15:30h as 18:30h e recebe um salário mensal de MTn 8,015. Candido consegue poupar no máximo MTn 2,000 por mês, mas não frequentemente. Este será o primeiro empréstimo de Candido com a Hluvuku e com Kiva. Candido já mora em sua própria casa, mas esta construindo uma segunda casa para seus filhos e segunda mulher. Apos ouvir sobre a Hluvuku com colegas de trabalho, Candido decidiu pedir este empréstimo de MTn 10,000 para ajudar na construção. Pretende comprar material de construção e acelerar a obra. Candido tem como grande sonho na vida a formação dos seus filhos, preferencialmente na universidade.

loans.use: Purchase construction material.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey C., 54, and her husband, Mr. Morn Tem, 45, were married in 1979 and have eleven children: seven sons and four daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. The family lives live along National Road number five about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. Srey and her husband have been farming and fishing since 1980. The fish they catch in the lake by their village is sold at Prek Phnao market about five kilometers from their home. They also grow rice on a farm a bit far from their home.

Mrs. Srey is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase one boat and fishing nets to expand their fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase one boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom H. is a villager in Chhouk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetable. On the plantation, Mrs. Mom H. has to hire an outside laborer with a cow to plow her rice field. Mrs. Mom H. decided to request a loan to purchase two cows so that she plow the rice field herself and save  money by doing so. Her husband, Mr. Son Sam, owns a kiln where he produces coal to resell. Mrs. Mom H. is 45 years old and the mother of five children. Two children  are employed in a garment factory, two are attending school and  help with the housework and the youngest child is too young to work or enroll in school. Mrs. Mom H. had previously obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cart to transport the fertilizer to support the field.

loans.use: To purchase two cows to plow the rice field.

loans.name: Jaida's Group

texts.en:
Jaida baji is the wife of M. H., and she lives in the city of Kasur in Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat and historic places. She has been living in this city for the last 40 years. She is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. Her oldest son is a daily wage laborer; the next oldest son is a painter; the next oldest son makes sports materials such as bats and balls; and her youngest son is in kindergarten. Meanwhile, all of her daughters assist her in making decorative, embroidered dresses, which she sells at the local market. Notably, she has been in this profession for the last 8 years. Jaida baji's husband works in a factory. She is applying for a loan to buy materials (e.g., beads, clothes, and sketch pads) to make more embroidered dresses in order to generate greater profits.

She is joined in her loan group by the following members: (1) Parveen baji and (2) Zubaida baji, both of whom request loans to buy groceries for their grocery shops; (3) Parveen baji, who, like Jaida baji, seeks a loan to buy materials such as beads and clothes for her decorative embroidery business; and (4) Allah Rakhi baji, who would like a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle).

This is a group loan. As such, the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Importantly, the group members mutually guarantee each other's loans; thus, if one member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional raw materials in order to make decorative, embroidered dresses

loans.name: Tante

texts.en:
Born in 1968, Tante V. is married to Tante Mathais and they have five children, three of whom are still bellow the age of fifteen. Due to the fact that she is unable to assist her husband to take care of the family and the need for capital to add to her business, she joined GHAPE in 2007. Also, she has been having a lot of marital problems which has made her sad a lot of the time, but she is appreciative of the fact that she is alive.

Tante's desire is to give her children love and education. She states that she feels better each time she provides something small to her children. Her inability to get investment capital which could generate income for her to meet her children's needs is what motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE. With her previous loan of $40, she succeeded in providing her community with food, chicken and manure.

Given a loan, she plans to buy a bag of groundnut, a bag of Irish potatoes, an umbrella, measuring buckets, a table, fowls and fowl feed. She knows this business will succeed because she is located at a good business site. She plans to use the profits generated to sponsor her children in school and to cater to the basic needs of her family. She plans to repay her loan in 12 months.

loans.use: Tante would like to purchase items to help her business so she can pay for her children's schooling.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca B. A. is a member of community bank, Renacer, which in Spanish means “rebirth.” Blanca is married with two children who are in school. With the help of her husband and sister-in-law, she runs a restaurant where she works daily preparing cebiche, a local dish consisting of raw seafood marinated in lime juice.

With her loan of 2000 soles, she will invest into her business by purchasing tables for her restaurant. She is saving to improve and make her restaurant larger.

loans.use: With her loan of 2000 soles, she will invest into her business by purchasing tables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Husanboy

texts.en:
Husanboy N. is a 42 year old man who breeds calves and sells dairy products to local people and dairy factories. He is married and has two children.

The difficult circumstances and hardships in his life made him recognize from a very young age the value of work. For about ten years he has been purchasing young cattle in the local market, and then fattening and selling them. Raising livestock is the main financial income source in his family. Thus Husanboy wakes up early every morning to feed his calves and cow with the goal of selling them at the best price in the local market when they grown enough.

Husanboy's main goal is to provide an education for his children. With this purpose in mind, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) to buy calves in order to expand his business. Let's support this hard-working man and hold our hands out to help him.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Agob

texts.en:
Agob is a 63-year-old man who lives in Beirut (the capital of Lebanon) with his wife. For the past 24 years, he has owned and operated a coffee shop.

Agob is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 via Al Majmoua in order to provide him with some cash. Agob has been a microcredit client for seven years now, and he proudly states that he has always repaid his loans on time. His prior loans enabled him to generate income and to thereby improve his financial situation. Agob feels that his business is special because of his happy face and his business skills. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

loans.use: To provide the entrepreneur with some extra cash

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Penh C., 67, is an elderly mother and operates a business from her home selling various kinds of grocery products. She is a widow and resides with two of her children in the Siem Reap province. On average, she makes US$4 a day and is aided by her child, who is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver, earning US$3 a day. Penh C. would like to take out a loan of US $800 to purchase another motorbike and trailer. The new bike will be rented to earn extra income to meet family expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a bike and trailer.

loans.name: Sobia Ejaz Hussain Group

texts.en:
Sobia baji is a 28-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Multan, Pakistan for the past 8 years. Multan city is famous for its shrines and handmade items. Sobia baji completed her education till 8th standard; she couldn’t study further due to her family’s meager financial resources. She married a man whose name is E. H. and he is a farmer and takes care of the land. He has been in this profession for the past 5 years.

Sobia baji has two kids: one daughter and one son. Both are in kindergarten. Sobia baji helps her husband in his farming. They both get up early and go to the field to sow seeds of different crops. Sobia baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy material (seeds, fertilizer) to expand their agriculture business.

Sobia baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Shamim baji and Mukhtar baji each want a loan to buy buffalo for their milk-selling businesses. Haseena baji and Irshad baji each want a loan to buy fertilizer for their agriculture businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for agriculture

loans.name: Ajaratu

texts.en: Ajaratu has a machine that she uses to grind vegetables and beans. She needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase one grinding machine. She is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase one grinding machine

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones unidos”, del barrio Misuyo, en el distrito D. Desaguadero, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 58 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años, su negocio es la venta D. golosinas y bebidas (galletas, gaseosas, frugos, etc.), su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (principalmente gaseosas al por mayor).  
Actualmente requiere un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir más mercaderías para su negocio (golosinas, bebidas, galletas, frutas D. diferentes variedades, etc.) para poder venderlo en las ferias D. Desaguadero, en la frontera; ella tiene el anhelo D. tener una tienda granD. donD. pueda colocar sus productos y continuar trabajando para bien D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank, “Corazones Unidos” in the Misuyo neighborhood of Desaguadero district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 58 years old, married, has two children and a fifth-graD. education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for eight years. Her business is the sale of sweets and drinks (cookies, soft drinks, fruit juices, etc.). Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to buy merchandise for her business (primarily wholesale soft drinks). Now she needs a new loan for 800 soles, which she is committed to repaying in four monthly payments. With this loan, she wishes to buy more merchandise for her business (sweets, drinks, cookies, different varieties of fruit, etc.) to be able to sell them in the markets of Desaguadero, on the border. She dreams of having a large store where she can sell her products and continue working for the benefit of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets, drinks and variety of fruits

loans.name: Dario

texts.es: Darío que cuenta con 63 años vive en su propia casa ubicada en la comunidad de "chimbote" junto a su esposa de 58 años respectivamente. La pareja tiene hijos que si bien son independientes los visitan cada fin de semana. Darío recibe una renta mensual por su jubilación de la empresa nacional de ferrocarriles. Junto a su esposa tienen una venta de abarrotes y otros desde hace varios años en su misma casa. No existe competencia para su negocio ya que en es la única tienda en la zona y sobre todo que esta sobre el camino que une a otras comunidades, por tal motivo tiene mucha salida en cuanto a los productos que oferta, ya que son mayormente de la canasta de primera necesidad. Darío tenia previsto comprar por lo menos unos dos artefactos para su negocio, pero solamente comprara un freezer de aproximadamente $us. 500,-  y el resto lo esta ocupando para poner a punto su camión que compro para explotarlo en la próxima zafra cañera. Este es el tercer préstamo del cliente y todos los anteriores los a cancelado puntualmente. El no tiene deuda en ninguna otra financiera.
texts.en:
Darío, 63, lives in his own house, which is located in the “Chimbote” community. He lives with his wife who is 58. They have independent children who visit them every week end. Darío receives a monthly income for his retirement from the national business of railroads. For many years he and his wife have been selling groceries in their home. There is no business competition because they are the only store in the zone. Also, they are on the road that joins other communities. There is a lot of demand for the products they offer, which are primarily basic needs items. Darío had been planning to buy at least two items for his business, but he will only buy a freezer for approximately $500 U.S. The rest he will spend to tune up his truck, which he bought to use in the next sugar cane harvest. This is his third loan, and he has paid the previous ones on time. He does not have any debt with any other finance companies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer and tune up truck

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luis es casado con la señora María del carmen y residentes de la ciudad de Allende, Coahuila. 
El es empleado del hospital general como chofer de ambulancia; su esposa trabaja en Diconsa como supervisora operativa. 
Son padres de 4 hijos en edad escolar. 
Como familia tiene el proyecto de una casa más cómoda, motivo por el cual tramitan este crédito, ya que requieren de la compra de varilla para la realización de un portal en el frente de su casa.
texts.en:
José Luis is married to Maria del Carmen, they live in the city of Allende, Coahuila. He works as an ambulance driver for the general hospital; his wife works in Diconsa as an operational supervisor. They are the parents of 4 school-age children. His plan is to build a more comfortable home for his family -- they are applying for this loan to purchase rods and build a front door for their house.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for a front door to their family home

loans.name: Haitmuhammad

texts.ru: Зияев Хаитмухаммад проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст 42 года, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Всю жизнь занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок земли засеевает  пшеницей, картофелем , сейчас наступило время посева подсолнечника.Поэтому он решил обратиться к нам за кредитом , планирует использовать деньги для закупки семян и удобрений. Если он сможет получить качяественный урожай , то получит хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Haitmuhammad Z. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 42 years old, is married and has five children. He has worked in agriculture for his entire live. He has a plot of land on which he plant wheat and potatoes. The season to plant sunflowers is now. This is why he decided to turn to us for credit; he plans to use the money to purchase seeds and fertilizer. If he is able to collect a good harvest, then he will earn good profits.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Roxana María

texts.es:
Roxana V. F. es una joven señora de 25 años de edad. Vive con su esposo y sus dos  hijos. 
La comunidad en la cual vive doña Roxana se llama El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago. 

Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Doña Roxana se dedica a la producción de leche y queso como una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contenta porque gracias a este proyecto ha podido salir adelante y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de los niños. 

El queso de la región donde vive José Eduardo es famoso en todo Costa Rica. Es un queso fresco que se le conoce tradicionalmente como “queso tipo Turrialba”. A los “ticos” (como se les conoce a los habitantes de Costa Rica) les gusta mucho consumir este producto; se le encontrará en las mesas acompañando cualquier tipo de comida.  Por esta razón, el mercado para dicho producto es realmente bueno.

Doña Roxana desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera más y así aumentar la producción de leche. Ella sabe que contar con una vaca más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser una microempresaria exitosa y  sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, la motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero y dedicación.

Doña Roxana es cliente de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una organización local socia de la micro financiera EDESA. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico
texts.en:
Roxana V. F. is a young lady, 25 years of age, who lives with her husband and two children. The community where they live is called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in Cartago Province. It's a small rural community of some 2,000 residents. The townspeople work at producing milk and growing coffee. The area has a varied terrain and much of the land is preserved as tropical rain forest. The community has very picturesque scenery which combines tropical forest with two beautiful lagoons, coffee plantations and dairy farms. El Sauce is located about 90 minutes by bus from the nearest commercial center, Turrialba. However, at various times of the year the road is impassable due to the flooding that afflicts the area. This is without a doubt one of the principal challenges for the community. When there was nothing to do, many people decided to leave to look for work in Turrialba or in the banana plantations located in the Atlantic zone of Costa Rica. Currently the prices for coffee and milk have improved and therefore the locals are looking to invest in projects in this area so as to avoid having to migrate. Doña Roxana works at producing milk and cheese as a way of generating income for her family. She say she is very satisfied because thanks to this project she has been able to get ahead and help her husband with the expenses for their household and the children. The cheese from the region where she lives, José Eduardo, is famous throughout Costa Rica. It is a "queso fresco" (fresh cheese) which is traditionally known as Turrialba-style. Ticos, as Costa Ricans are called, love to consume this product and it is found on the table as an accompaniment to all types of food. For this reason the market for this product is quite good. Doña Roxana would like to obtain a micro-credit loan of 500,000 Colons in order to buy another milk cow so as to increase milk production. She knows that having another cow is a great sacrifice and will require more work. However, the desire to be a successful small businesswoman and to get started improving her family's living conditions motivates her to exert herself with great care and dedication. Doña Roxana is a client of the Producers' Association of El Sauce, a member organization of EDESA Micro-Finance. This will be her first loan and she hopes to continue growing both personally and economically.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar una vaca lechera.

loans.name: Chou

texts.en:
Chou S., 32, selling vegetable in the city of Battambong Province and earns an income $6 per day. S. and her husband are blessed with a lovely child. Her husband works as a teacher at a public school and makes $2 per day.

S. wants a loan of $1000 to buy animal food and ducks to raise. She hopes to better their standard of living and help her child get a better education.

loans.use: Buying animal food and ducks.

loans.name: Jerusalen Group

texts.es: El grupo “Jerusalén”  esta representado por la señora Elia y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales van cursando su cuarto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en sus pagos. Dentro del grupo existe un parentesco entre la señora Yolanda y Evelin que son primas pero con ingresos totalmente independientes una D. la otra. En general las socias se dedican a diferentes tipos D. negocios como la venta D. comida, cosméticos por catalogo, abarrotes y a la costura D. prensas D. vestir.  . El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso que servirá para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación y una mayor calidad D. vida
texts.en:
The Jerusalén group has 13 members, and Elia represents the group. The group is in its fourth loan cycle. They demonstrate responsibility and honesty in their payments. A relationship within the group exists between Yolanda and Evelin. They are cousins, but their incomes are totally independent of each others. The members are involved in different types of businesses like selling food, selling cosmetics by catalog, selling groceries, and making clothes. The loan is for the acquisition of materials, supplies, and tools that will help generate greater income. This will give their children a better education and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a member of the Jipe moyo borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 27-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of one child. Her child is 10 years old.

Neema started her own business selling bicycles three years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 300,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Neema’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 350,000 TSH in order to buy more bicycles. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Neema hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bicycles

loans.name: Robert Johnny

texts.en: Robert Johnny A. is a commercial driver at Takoradi. Robert Johnny has received no formal education.  He is married and has 7 dependents. Robert Johnny has been driving commercially since 1985. He is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. His loan will be used to buy car spare parts. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy car spare parts

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D., 42 ans, mariée et 8 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de MEDINA DIAMBERE depuis 2 ans et y a bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursé avec succès. Avec ce prêt elle fait un petit commerce en vendant de l'huile, du lait en poudre, de la kolas, du sucre, de la cigarette etc. Elle n'a pas de boutique mais elle vend à domicile. Elle soutien son mari pour l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariama D., age 42, is married and has eight children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de MEDINA DIAMBERE for two years and has obtained from it four loans, each of which she repaid successfully.  With the current loan, she's operating a small business selling oil, powdered milk, kola, sugar, cigarettes, etc.  She doesn't have a store, but she makes sales out of her house. She supports her husband in improving the family's living conditions. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her capital

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu B.  is currently in the business of selling books at the bookshop and is requesting a loan to stock more books to sell. 

 Dudu is 32 years old and is Married with a husband that is a police man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and provide them with scholarstic materials like School shoes, uniforms etc.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more books to sell

loans.name: Sohibdjon

texts.en:
B. Sohibdjon is 35 years old. He is married with 4 children. Sohibdjon is very diligent and hard-working man. On his car he is providing the taxi services inside the city of Istaravshan. For the last 5 years the current business had been the main income for the family allowing Sohibdjon to improve the living conditions of his large family. As any business generating the incomes the business of Sohibdjon also requires some investments from time to time. Thus, now the car needs the thorough fixing. For this reason Sohibdjon requests $1500 USD for purchasing spare parts. Sohibdjon promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Thorough fixing of the vehicle used for providing of taxi services.

loans.name: Michael Thuo

texts.en:
Michael is 57 years old, married to Rose, and they have five daughters and one son, all adults. He was introduced to Kiva Partner, KADET, through an existing KADET client and has been a shopkeeper for four years.

Michael is applying for his 3rd loan with KADET. He is intending to purchase more stock and expand his retail shop business.

With the extra profit generated from his business, Michael is planning to install electricity in his shop and purchase a deep-freezer. His hopes and dreams are to have a big business which can serve as both wholesale and retail. He describes himself as a hardworking man and very focused.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website:  www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more stock and expand his business

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en: Medelyn B. is from the village of Campo 2, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 30 years old and is married. Medelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bread in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Medelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Medelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ifeyinwa

texts.en:
Ifeyinwa is 30 years old and a fashion designer. She sews very well and a lot people patronize her business. She has been in the sewing field for four years. "I love my business and I love seeing people on fine wears say Ifeyinwa," she said.

She sustains and supports her family with this business. She hopes to expand her business in the future and add sarongs and tailoring material to sell. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase sarongs and tailoring materials to sell to meet customer demand, especially during this festive period. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase sarong materials to sell

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en: A. Nergui is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Khovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". His oldest son and daughter attend a local secondary school and his youngest son is in kindergarten. Nergui manages a small grocery trading shop in his town. He provides a wide variety of food products to his many customers. Nergui started his business in 2006 and has since gained much experience as a businessman. He has used this experience to grow his business and earnings to a consistent level. Nergui is a very hardworking businessman and is known for his kind personality. He works diligently to continue his success in the future. He requests a 2,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase grocery products for his shop. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click : here

loans.use: To purchase grocery products for his shop.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca A. is from the town of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 32 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Rebecca owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en: Arturo A. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 30 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Arturo owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to transport passengers in the local community. He is just starting this business. In 2009, Arturo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to repair a motorcycle used in his business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a motorcycle used in his business

loans.name: Azar

texts.en: Azar B. is 24 years old. He is a single. Azar lives in Baku city. This young man has been in this business for 3 years. Now Azar B. needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary things to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things to improve his business

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em N. is 63 years old and lives in Kouk Roka village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a four-hectare field to cultivate rice. In this venture they face a problem because the field's soil is infertile. So Mrs. N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the crop. Mrs. N. is the mother of two children — one employed in a garment factory, and the other a farmer who helps with his parents' farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquín  Hernández B.  tiene 41 y vive en el barrio Nuevo Milenio de Soledad, con su cónyuge y sus hijos; es allí donde tiene su pequeño negocio de vender calzado y simultáneamente de  remontarlos porque conoce el arte y también ofrece este servicio.
 Desde muy pequeño su madre, mujer cabeza de familia, le enseño a negociar  y  esa es hoy su más grande experiencia; Joaquin, trae calzado económico  desde la Guajira y lo comercializa a través de 4 vendedores ambulantes  él y su cónyuge  que también trabaja en el negocio, desde su casa en un local contiguo. En este, su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo está aplicando por un valor de $1.500.000, el cual invertirá en la compra de calzado deportivo que tiene encargado  por  clientes a través de sus vendedores.
Joaquín dice, que su madre le enseñó a perder la pena en la calle  desde muy pequeño, cuando lo mandaba a vender todo lo que se le ocurriera, para ayudarla a sufragar los gastos de su familia y eso lo considera su mejor experiencia, porque lo llevó a pensar en ser independiente y con su negocio compró la casa donde vive, pudo acceder a créditos con la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo y con ello adecuar un local, comprar vitrinas de exhibición  y hacer rendir su capital de trabajo.
 Como Joaquín es un hombre de grandes sueños que pertenece a una congregación cristiana, quiere que todos en la iglesia tengan fuentes de empleo, por eso su meta es extender su negocio  en zonas no abordadas, para lo cual  va a requerir de vendedores, así ayudaría a que sus hermanos de congregación que no tienen empleo  generen sus propios ingresos.  
Su desafío mas grande es cuando se presentan problemas de salud en su familia, es ahí donde algunas veces se han visto afectados sus ingresos, porque es un excelente miembro de familia, pero persiste en su negocio y es muy responsable por eso siempre sale adelante.
texts.en:
Joaquín Hernández B., 41, lives in the Nuevo Milenio de Soledad neighborhood with his wife and children; he has a small, shoe sales and repair shop. From a very early age, his mother, who was head of household, taught him how to negotiate; this is his greatest experience to date. Joaquin brings low-cost shoes from La Guajira and sells them via four traveling salespeople, himself and his wife, who also works in the business located next-door to their home. This is his third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; it's valued at $1.500.000 which will be used to buy athletic shoes for which his salespeople already have orders placed. Joaquín says that his mother taught him not to be shy in the streets when he was very young and she would send him out to sell all kinds of things to help her meet family expenses; he considers this to be the best experience because it taught him to be independent. His business made it possible for him to buy his house, he was able to get loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that allowed him to set up a shop, to buy display cases and to help his working capital go farther. Because Joaquín is a man with big dreams who is part of a Christian community, he wants all his fellow church members to have jobs. This is why he wants to extend his business into areas not currently served for which he will need salespeople. This way he intends to help his congregation's brothers who don't have jobs to produce their own earnings. His greatest challenge is when health problems arise in his family; this is when his income is adversely affected because he's an excellent member of the family. However, he is consistent in his work and is very responsible; this is why he always gets ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy athletic shoes.

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia L., se dedica a la Venta de Ropa, todos los días se ubica en puesto fijo en el mercado la terminal – León, oferta su producto desde las 6:00am hasta las 12:00Pm, pòr la tarde se está dedicando a vender frutas implemento el nuevo negocio de las ganancias que le está produciendo la venta de ropa con el objetivo de obtener mayor ganancia. 
Este crédito que solicito es  para aumentar su  inventario de ropa y poder ofertar a su clientela variedad de productos con el objetivo de satisfacer la necesidad de  sus clientes.
Cabe mencionar que se siente muy agradecida con los créditos de Ceprodel ya que ha logrado incrementar su negocio además de tener una nueva opción de obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Ofelia L. sells clothing every day from an established post at the terminal market in León. She offers her products from 6am until 12pm. In the evenings, she sells fruit. Ofelia started this new business using her earnings from selling clothes so that she could obtain a better income.

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her inventory of clothing so that she can offer her customers a variety of products. With this goal, she hopes to satisfy the needs of her customers. It is worth mentioning that Rita is very grateful for the loans from CEPRODEL. She has already succeeded in increasing her business as well as created a new option for generating more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Perjolen

texts.en:
Perjolen S. is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in Sto. Hunob, Brgy Salong, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by engaging in a vegetable vending business. Perjolen’s 49-year-old husband, Joseph, is a farmer. They have 5 children between 10 – 21 years old who are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Perjolen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in vegetables vending. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 13,000 from her business activities.

Perjolen is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 12,000 was used to fund operations of her vegetable vending and had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 22nd loan in the amount of Php 14,000, which she intends to use on her vegetable vending business. Perjolen is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family--to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.en: Jeaneth S. is from the lush green town of Jala-jala, Rizal. She is 39 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Jeaneth sells placenta soap and coco jam products in the village and nearby towns.  Jeaneth has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a week. Jeaneth joined ASHI in 1996 to secure access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASHI, and is now requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock of her placenta soap and inventories of coco jam products. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Jeaneth from ASHI.  She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and KIVA field partner, she can reach her ambition of moving away under the umbrella of poverty, expanding her business, and paying for the needs of her two children in school. For supplementary revenue, she also dreams of purchasing new tricycle for her husband, Gabriel, a carpenter who also closely works with her.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly joined CEVI in 2008 because she was in need of additional capital for her farm. She says that her loans were really helpful in maintaining her farm. With her income, she was able to open a sari-sari store at the front of her house. She aims to start raising pigs next so she can have another source of income. She wants her family to be happy and satisfied. Nelly is requesting to borrow 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) that she will use to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. She will also add merchandise to her store and, hopefully, she will also be able to acquire piglets that she’ll raise.

loans.use: For farm inputs and additional store merchandise

loans.name: Hajarah

texts.en: Hajarah is married to a trader and they have six children. Only two children go to school. Hajarah also takes care of her old mother. Hajarah deals in cattle and buys the cattle from  villages of Ngoma and Nakasongola.  She wants to use this loan of 1,000,000/= to buy more cattle for resale. She sells cattle to meat packers and Kmapala city abbatoir and the rest to bucheries in Kawempe. She works two days a week.  Hajarah doesn’t have any other side business. Hajarah has been in this business for two  years and with MCDT for seven years. Her business challenges include transportation, thievesand ever increasing prices of cattle.  She is aspiring of owning a delivery van. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was charging low interest compared to other MFIs in the area.  Hajarah resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she stays with eight people.  The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Hajara's biggest monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for resale

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio F. is from Barangay Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 47 years old. Arsenio is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arsenio owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for breeding. Arsenio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arsenio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Arsenio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Arsenio is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Arsenio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Nyame Ye Nyame Group

texts.en:
Jones describes himself as a nice man. He is 35 years old and he is the leader of the “Nyame ye Nyame” (translated as, "God is God") borrower group. Jones is a trader in Kente cloth. Kente cloth is a famous richly woven traditional fabric of single or multiple colors, usually worn during special occasions like festivals, parties, outdoor events and other social gatherings. 

Jones has operated his business for the past 12 years. His second business is farming. Jones is excited to be taking out this loan, with which he plans to purchase kente cloth in bulk. He dreams of owning a store to showcase his kente cloth.

Jones is married to a woman who is also a trader in kente cloth and they have four children from age 1-13.   He hopes to put aside more savings to be able to provide good education for all their children. The other members of the group are mainly kente traders and farmers.

loans.use: To purchase kente cloth in bulk

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is divorced. She lives with her teen-aged daughter and grown-up son. She operates a small business located at an open market in Nova Kahovka town. Larisa sells table-cloths and anti-mosquito screens.

Larisa has been in this business for 14 years. The inventories she sells are in high demand, so she always has many customers. Larisa enjoys her business and would like to develop it further. This business is the only source of income for Larisa's family.

Larisa would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to receive additional profit that would be spent on family needs.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flash disks and memory cards to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alarbe

texts.en:
Alarbe M. is from the village of Lapasan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old and single. Alarbe owns a retail store selling beauty products like Avon, Sarah Lee and Fullerlife. Alarbe has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Alarbe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alarbe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Alarbe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana P. is from the village of Libertad, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 53 years old. Juana is married and has one adult children. To make a living, Juana owns & operates a business buying and selling bananas in the local community. Juana has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Juana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juana is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Juana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mela

texts.en: Mela P. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 45 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Kalawaig, Banisilan, Cotabato. Mela has been in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Mela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase products to sell. Mela is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Hem's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Hem H., 66, is the village bank president, having been selected by the members of this village bank loan, located in Tboung Kdei village, Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses. 

Hem H. is a wedding chef and also owns a wedding hall to rent out. From the two occupations, he is able to earn a small income to support his family. For the wedding hall, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more chairs, tables and supplies to support his business. Hem H. is a widower with five children, who are students and also help with their father's businesses.

loans.use: To buy more chairs, tables and wedding hall supplies

loans.name: Wilfridah Bunoro

texts.en:
Wilfridah Bunoro J. is a hardworking lady of 52 years. She is married to Walter J. and together they have four children, aged 27 years, 22 years, 18 years and 16 years, respectively. She has been farming for about five years and she earns a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings.

When she learned about KADET LTD. and happened to have no history with any other MFI (microfinance institution), she immediately applied for her first loan of Kshs.15,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to buy stock of poultry feeds and more poultry to keep so that she may have more eggs to sell to her customers. She plans to use the profits from the expanded business to start dairy farming, which is also very marketable in this area.

Wilfridah hopes to grow her business and become the leading local entrepreneur and to see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To buy stock of poultry feed and more poultry

loans.name: Nyakiju Tukore C, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
Hard-working, dependable and die-hard agriculturalist, M. Jennifer of Nyakiju group, is 35 years old. She has been maintaining a livestock farm, alongside milk and ghee sales, in her home area of Nyakiju, Rukungiri for more than 6 years. This fetches an average amount of 350,000 Ugandan shillings per month but is not enough to sustain her extended family.
Jennifer has persevered in keeping the enterprise going. Her aim for this loan is to restock her farm as part of her expansion plan to transport her products to bigger markets. This will help her to increase productivity, earn more revenue and enable her to live a more sustainable life and educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cows for fattening

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Evangelina tiene 50  años, es madre y padre para su hijo, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella distribuye a diferentes mercados y también vende a choferes, cobradores de diferentes agencias de transportes, ella vende ropa como por ejemplo casacas, pantalones, buzos, muchas ropas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Evangelina desprende una imagen de una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Evangelina que espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar más ropa como por ejemplo pantalones, camisas, casacas, etc.  

Evangelina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Evangelina belongs to Asociación Arariwa's “Mosoc Killa” community bank in the city of Cusco.  She lives in the same city.  Cusco is a charming city which dates back to Inca times.  It was built on the site of the ancient Inca city.

Evangelina is 50 years old.  She is both mother and father to her son.  She has a small business selling clothes.  She distributes clothes to different markets and also sells to drivers and conductors from different transport agencies.  She sells clothes such as jackets, pants, sweatshirts, and many others.  She has been in this business for several years and her business is doing very well thanks to the great effort which she puts into her work.  Evangelina is the very image of a hard-working and responsible woman.  With her loan for 1,500 nuevos soles, Evangelina would like to increase her business and buy more clothes such as pants, shirts, jackets, etc.

Evangelina is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To increase her business and buy more clothes such as pants, shirts, jackets, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 49 years old and a resident of Muranga Town in Central Kenya. She has been doing mixed farming for 25 years, producing bananas and milk, both of which are sold within the local market.She has one farmhand on casual terms.

She has applied for this loan of 33,604 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank to secure water for the bananas as well as for domestic use. She says much time and money is spent on fetching water and the provision of the loan would be a great relief.

She reckons the future is bright with Juhudi Kilimo's loan services. She has successfully paid a loan of 10,000 KES.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.fr:
Client de 46 ans, célibataire avec deux enfants a charge dont l’âge varie entre 15 et 16 ans. Ayant arrête ses études au lycée par manque de moyens financiers, il se lance dans les petits métiers pour se prendre en charge.
En 1986, il ouvre un parking –lavage et gardiennage auto.
Ses services n’étant pas très fiables, tant bien que mal, il se débrouillait comme il pouvait, des qu’il a été 
finance il avait acheté d'un cracheur d'eau, des tuyaux,il avait aussi réhabilité l'abonnement de la SNE d'eau et achete des tonneaux pour conserver l'eau au moment des coupures.
Ce premier prêt a eu un impact considérable dans sa vie , il a tenu une gestion est plus saine, il a appris a contrôler le prix de revient, le bénéfice, la valeur de l’entreprise	Il a épargné comme jamais il l’a fait ;
Avec le second prêt, il va renforcer son activité en achetant un autre appareil pour laver les voitures, des différents détergents pour laver vitres, pare brises .
Tres enthousiaste ,il compte aller loin avec HOPE
texts.en:
This client is a 46 year old single man with two children, who are between the ages of 15 and 16. Due to a lack of funds, he stopped his education in high school and started taking odd jobs in order to support himself. 

In 1986, he opened a car wash and car-guarding business. Although public services were not very reliable, he managed what he could and with financing, he purchased pipes and a spigot for access to water, he also renewed his account with the national water supply services ("SNE d'eau") and purchased barrels to conserve water during cuts in water service. 

This first loan had a considerable impact on his life. His business management is much healthier: he has learned to control costs, profits and the value of his business. As always, he has been keeping savings. 

With this second loan, he would like to strengthen his business by buying another device for washing cars and different detergents for washing windows/ windshields. 

He is very enthusiastic and intends to go further with HOPE (the micro-finance institution he belongs to).

loans.use: To purchase water pipes, a spigot and soaps for washing cars

loans.name: Rose  Jerotich

texts.en:
Rose Jerotich K. is a 28-year-old married women.  She and her husband have two children, ages eight years and five years. They live in Iten, outside of Eldoret, Kenya. Rose has a grocery store where she sells food products to earn her income. She has been in this business for the past five years making an income of 15,000 KES per month.

Rose was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and she is applying for her sixth loan of 60,000 KES with KADET LTD. With this loan she plans to buy bananas, tomatoes, carrots, and irish potatoes for sale.

She hopes to operate a large scale grocery, whereby she can be able to supply hotels and sell the best quality products for her customers and in future to extend these services to the city center.

loans.use: To buy bananas, tomatoes, carrots, and irish potatoes

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco de 61 años, tiene 10 años con una tienda que le ha costado trabajar con esfuerzo y dedicación obtenerla. Con la buena administración que le ha dado durante todo ese tiempo ahora su tienda esta surtida. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha trabajado desde las 06h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días vendiendo enlatados, frutas, granos, bebidas a un bajo costo. La esposa le ayuda con los gastos familiares vendiendo comida. Para seguir con su negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo aceite, enlatados, granos etc. 

Para seguir progresando en su negocio él quiere comprar en el futuro un carro para tener más facilidad al obtener la mercadería para la tienda.
texts.en:
Francisco is 61 years old.  He has had his store for ten years.  It cost him great effort and dedication to get the store.  With the good administration that he has exercised during this time, he now has a store that is stocked.

He lives in a periurban zone called Perimetral.  He works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 11:00 p.m.  He sells canned goods, fruit, grains, and drinks for a low price.  His wife helps him with the family expenses by selling food.  In order to continue with his business he wants to use the loan to buy oil, canned goods, and grains, etc.

In order to continue progressing in his business, he wants to buy a car in the future.  This will make it easier to get the merchandise for the store.

loans.use: To buy oil and canned goods

loans.name: Nesa

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Nesa P. is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has five children. Her eldest child is 17 years old, while the youngest is only 6. Nesa is engaged in rice farming. She and her husband make sure their rice crops are healthy and that the farm is free of weeds and pests. Nesa also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells various kinds of products. Nesa wishes to be successful in life.

Nesa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nesa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Nesa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Mrs. Pho S. is a 29-year-old married woman, and she is a villager who lives in Ta Kdol village in Kandal province. 

She is a seamstress in a garment factory and her husband, Mr. Prum Sareth, is a security guard. With their careers, they are able to make a little salary to support their family. 

This couple has two children. One is attending a local school and the younger one is 2 years old. 

They don't have a lavatory in their house. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a lavatory.

loans.use: To add her savings to build a lavatory

loans.name: Mirarikye Abaryakamwe Group-Bushenyi

texts.en: 45-year-old Naume B. is a member of Mirarikye Abaryakamwe group-Bushenyi. This happy-go-lucky, married mother of 5 has been retailing in Mirarikye for 5 years. Her retail shop attracts many people within her local area. Naume says to take root in this business she got ideas from a close friend. Before that she was doing mostly farming. She still farms, though it is on a smaller scale now. Weekly, this business generates her 200,000 UGX. Naume says with this loan she is going to purchase more retail stock to sell.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail stock to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe José

texts.es: El  Sr O.  labora como fontanero es Acompañado tiene  tres persona a su cargo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece la oportunidad que le  que  brinda esta institución con  este  desembolso para realizar  compra de  materiales  de construcción bloque, cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín, estribo, alambre y pago de mano de obra para hacer pared de su vivienda.
texts.en: Mr. O. works as a plumber.  He has a partner and 3 dependent children.  This the first loan that he has been granted by CEPRODEL, and he is grateful for the opportunity that this institution is providing him.  With this loan, he will buy construction materials such as cement blocks, cement, sand, steel, gravel, braces, wire and labor to make a wall around his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Cerrito Group

texts.es:
El comité D. mujeres "Emprendedoras D. Cerrito" es D. la ciudad del Chaco. Actualmente se encuentran en el décimo ciclo.
En su mayoría las clientes se dedican a la venta D. comestibles y artículos D. limpieza o lencería (despensa general), hay otras que sin embargo, están iniciando recién ahora sus negocios.
Gracias al apoyo concebido por la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva tienen el deseo D. superarse cada vez más, y seguir avanzando más.
La sra. Olga Idalina posee una despensa donD. principalmente venD. comestibles, bebidas, artículos D. limpieza y lencería, ella se encuentra en una zona donD. provee D. todos los productos D. primera necesidad a sus vecinos, y como desea poder abastecer y satisfacer esas necesidades, solicita el préstamo D. Kiva, D. modo a que pueda obtener la lealtad D. sus clientes y un mayor ingreso económico para su familia.
texts.en:
The group of women "Emprendedoras D. Cerrito" is from the city of Chaco.  They are currently in their 10th loan cycle.

Most of these women sell food, cleaning supplies or dry goods (general pantry), however, some are just starting businesses.  

Thanks to the support provided by the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, they have a desire to excel and to continue to advance each day.

Olga Idalina has a store where she sells mainly food, drinks, cleaning supplies and dry goods.  She sells in an area where she provides all of the basic consumer goods to her neighbors.  Since she wants to be able to satisfy the needs of her customers, she requests a loan from Kiva, so that she can have the loyalty of her customers and a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy food products for her store (meat, vegetables, fruit, condiments) and water, drinks, dry goods, cleaning supplies, etc.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clorinda; la socia tiene 58 años de edad, separada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros para venderlos  a sus amistades, la socia lleva años en este negocio siendo de esta manera como saca a su familia adelante, a la vez la socia prepara alimentos para los distintos compromisos que le soliciten como matrimonios,bautizos,fiestas de 15 años entre otros ,ambas ocupaciones son las que realiza la socia para salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería de ropa como polos, chompas, camisas,casacas entre otros y así poder ofrecer más a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Clorinda, 58, is a member of the “SOL Y LUNA” (Sun & Moon) communal bank which is located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

She is separated and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with selling clothes for women, children and men among her acquaintances.  She’s been in business for years and this is the way she’s supported her family.  At the same time, she prepares food to order for various social events like weddings, baptisms, 15-year-old birthday parties, among others.  Both activities are what make it possible for her to get ahead.

She needs the loan to buy clothing like: polo shirts, sweaters, shirts and jackets, among others, to be able to offer more to her customers.

She is happy with the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth J. M. is a lady of thirty-three years, married and a mother of three children. They live in Waunifor in the outskirts of Eldoret town. Her husband, Hillary Sirma, works with the Kenya police and brings in income to the family. Ruth does maize farming and has been in this business for eleven years, and she gets a monthly income of three thousand shillings.

This will be Ruth's third loan from KADET LTD, and with this loan she plans to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. The income that she will get from selling the maize will be used to buy another piece of land. 

In future she wants to buy twenty acres of land, educate her children and buy vehicles for transporting her produce to her customers.

loans.use: to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Stanlaus

texts.en:
Stanlaus M. is thirty-five years old, married, and has three children between ten and five years old. His business is located at Malinya in Kakamega. Kakamega is a rich agricultural area found in the western region of Kenya. The area is known for large-scale production of sugarcane and thus commonly referred to as the sugarbelt region. He sells such items as rice, flour, oil, detergents, soft drinks and others to the local people.  He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business in the area.  Customers are not loyal, as they are spoiled for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more items to expand his business. The items include rice, flour, cooking fat and detergents. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He also hopes to give his children quality education to the university level.  In the future, he sees himself owning a plot of land on which he will build a house for his family. He describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, cooking fat, detergents etc

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es originaria de Ocampo un lugar lleno de naturaleza ya que ahí se encuentran los santuarios de la mariposa monarca que es un atractivo turístico en los meses de noviembre a febrero, ella cuenta con 25 años de edad y esta casada con el señor Eliseo el cual tiene un local donde arregla y da mantenimiento a motosierras, ellos tienen un niño de nombre Franco el cual tiene 5 años de edad. Doña Guadalupe esta pidiendo un préstamo para la compra de colchas, sabanas, cortinas, toallas, batas de baño, manteles etc. Ella tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 5 años y comenta que vende sus colchas con sus conocidas y vecinas y que empezó con este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Guadalupe esta agradecida por el préstamo que le están otorgando ya que así podrá tener colchas en existencia, ella dice “si tengo productos en existencia como que las clientas se animan a comprarme las colchas por eso estoy pidiendo el crédito ya que de la vista nace el amor por las cosas y ríe”. La meta que tiene la señora es poder tener un local estable para asi estar mas al pendiente de su hijo.
texts.en: Guadalupe is originally from Ocampo, a place full of nature including a monarch sanctuary which functions as a tourist attraction from November to February. She is 25 years old and married to Mr. Eliseo who has a mechanic shop where he repairs power saws. They have a 5 year old son named Franco. Mrs. Guadalupe is requesting a loan to buy bed spreads, sheets, curtains, towels, bath robes, table clothes, etc. She has been in this business for approximately 5 years and says she sells her linens to neighbors and people she knows. She says she also started this business to help her husband pay their house bills. Guadalupe is thankful for the loan being offered with which she will have linens available to sell. She says, "if I have products available then clients will be more likely to buy them since love for things develops from sight." Her goal is to have her own shop so she can take better care of her son.

loans.use: to buy bed spreads, sheets, curtains, towels, bath robes, table clothes, etc

loans.name: Te Agradesco Señor Group

texts.es:
