El grupo Te agradesco Señor lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Jesenia de 21 años quien tiene una pulpería la cual inicio con granos básicos ahora la tiene bien surtida. Esta joven estudiante de secretariado sueña con que su negocio crezca y llegue hacer una miscelánea. 
Las otras integrantes son María de 58 años se dedica a la venta de hojas para tamales y nacatamales la cual compra por lote y Rosa Amanda vende zapatos y cosméticos desde hace 6 años.
texts.en: The “Te Agradezco Señor” Group is comprised of three hardworking and enterprising woman.  One of them is Jesenia, who is 21 years old and has a store which she started with basic grains and is now well stocked.  This young secretarial student dreams of her business growing to become a variety shop.  The other group members are 58-year-old María who sells leaves for tamales and nacatamales, which she buys by the batch, and Rosa Amanda who has sold shoes and cosmetics for the past six years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Alicia has been in this business for 4 years.

Alicia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as rice and soft drinks to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.  In the future, Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice and soft drinks to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He is 57 years old, married to Mary and they have one school age child.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fifth loan.  He paid all of his previous loans off and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.  He will sell his produce at the local market as he does small scale farming.

In future,he hopes to become a successful farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ndeye Mareme

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une jeune femme âgée de 36 ans.Elle est divorcée et vit avec un enfant.Elle avait entamée une formation en couture qu'elle a arrêtée faute de pouvoir payer ses frais de scolarité. Elle s'est alors engagée dans le commerce de produits vestimentaires et cosmétiques. Elle s'approvisionne à l'extérieur dans un pays limitrophe et revend ses produits dans sa localité. Son activité lui permet de prendre en charge ses besoins alimentaires, de santé, vestimentaires ainsi que ceux de son enfant. Elle n'a jamais sollicité de crédit à l'IMCEC. Le montant de 100 000F qu'elle sollicite en ce moment lui permettra d'acheter 2 cartons de parfum, 2 cartons de crème, 1 basin de 30m, 2 tissu maylouss. Ces achats vont renforcer son stock et lui permettre d'accroitre ses bénéfices. Avec ces bénéfices, elle pourra vivre dans de meilleurs conditions, elle et son enfant.
texts.en:
The borrower is a young woman, 36 years of age. She is divorced and lives with one child. She had started training in sewing but stopped it since she could not pay her tuition. She then involved herself in the retail of clothing and cosmetics.
She gets her supplies from a neighboring country, and resells these items in her town. Her activity allows her to support herself and her child for their food, healthcare and clothing needs. She never requested a loan from IMCEC before. The 100,000 XOF amount she is now requesting will make it possible for her to purchase two boxes of perfumes, two boxes of lotion, 30 meters of brocade cloth and two "maylouss" garments.
These purchases will strengthen her stock and allow her to increase her profits. With these, she and her child will be able to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy two dozen perfumes, two dozen body lotions, 30 meters of boubous (fabric) and two ready-to-wear items.

loans.name: Emmaculate

texts.en:
Emmaculate is 36 years old and married to Jackson. She supports a family of six members. Her husband does driving services in order to produce additional income. Her children are 10, 8, 7, 6 and 3 years old. 

She does farming and she has been in business for 10 years. She is borrowing a loan of KES 15,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer. She plans to purchase a posho mill with the anticipated profit.

This is her first loan. Her hope and dream is to buy a posho mill, which will help in generating more income and even buying land.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angelica; ella tiene 54 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. mistura que es hecho D. papel D. colores que se utiliza para fiestas, bautizos y matrimonios, la socia también se dedica al negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes, ella trabaja desD. las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar e implementar el negocio D. mistura y tienda D. abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mistura al por mayor y comprar productos D. primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y leche.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Manos Juntas (Hands Together)."  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, and department of Cusco.

The member is Ms. Angelica, she is 54 years old and married with 2 children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling mistura, a material that is maD. of colored paper that is used for parties, christenings and marriages, and she also works in the grocery business.   She works from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm.   Angelica wants to expand and improve her business of mistura and the grocery store.  She is requesting the loan to buy mistura wholesale and buy staples such as rice, sugar, noodles and milk.

Angelica is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her quota.

loans.use: to buy misturas(colored papers) wholesale and staples such as rice, sugar, noodles and milk.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Mary Grace has a retail shop that sells gasoline per liter. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gallons of gasoline to sell.
Mary Grace is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Alberth Uriel

texts.es:
Alberth es un señor de 41 años de edad, el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en  la Fuente, en la provincia de Cartago. El principal sistema de drenaje de esta zona es el río Reventazón que nace en el Cerro Cuericí. Por la fertilidad de sus suelos volcánicos y aluviales, Cartago es el centro de población que tiene en la agricultura y ganadería sus principales fuentes económicas.

Desde hace varios años que Alberth tiene una finca, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con el propiedad que le heredaron sus padres, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados.  El proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Alberth está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢200.000 (doscientos mil colones) para  darle mantenimiento a dicha finca por medio de fertilizantes y herramientas agricolas. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio, ya que su meta es tener un mejor lugar de trabajo donde se pueda instalar bien con sus animales y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Alberth es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Delirio, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Alberth is a 41-year-old man living with his wife and children in La Fuente, Cartago Province.  The main drainage system of this zone is the Reventazón River which arises on Cuericí Hill.  Because of the fertility of the volcanic and alluvial soils, Cartago is a population center that has farming and animal husbandry as its main economic sources.

Alberth has had a farm for several years now since he now owns property his parents passed down to him but he lacks the main thing needed for his business to take off and for his community to be benefitted.  The project is very interesting.

At present, Alberth is asking for a ¢200.000 (two-hundred thousand) colon micro loan to maintain his farm.  He hopes with this to help his business grow because his goal is to have a place of work where he can set himself up well with his animals and improve both his and his family’s quality of life.

Alberth is a member of the “Delirio” (Frenzy) communal bank, one of EDESA’s 110 social organizations in Costa Rica.  This will be his first loan and he hopes with it to continue growing both personally and economically as well as to participate actively in his community’s credit organization.

loans.use: to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.ru:
Андраник родился 1964 году в деревне Хдранц, окончил Ехвардскую  сельскую среднюю школу. Андраник женат, у него трое детей: сыновья учатся в Капанской средней школе, дочь в прошлом году окончила Капанское медицинское училище и сейчас не работает. Жена Андраника также не работает.  
С 1994 года Андраник занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью в деревне Хдранц. Вместе с женой он разводит крупный рогатый скот, кур, овец, свиней, пчел, выращивает овощи на собственном огороде. Также у Андраника есть небольшой участок земли, на котором он выращивает пшеницу и овес. Андраник реализует говядину, баранину, свинину, молоко, яйца, мед, шерсть и выращенные овощи своим постоянным клиентам в городе Капане. Благодаря сельскохозяйственной деятельности Андраник обеспечивает свою семью продовольственными товарами, а выручку от продажи сельхозпродукции использует для оставшихся нужд своей семьи. 
Кредит в размере 550.000 драм необходим Андранику для проведения посевных работ: покупки нового сорта зерна, дизельного топлива и удобрений.
texts.en: Andranik was born in 1964 in the Hdrants village and graduated from the Ehvardsk village school.  Andranik is married and has three children.  His sons attend the Kapan secondary school, daughter graduated from the Kapan medical college last year and is now unemployed.  Andranik's wife is also unemployed.  Andranik has been involved in an agricultural business in the Hdrants village since 1994.  Together with his wife, he keeps cattle, chickens, sheep, pigs and bees, and grows vegetables on his own land.  He also has a small plot of land, where he grows wheat and oats.  Andranik sells beef, lamb, pork, milk, eggs, honey, wool and vegetables to his loyal customers in the city of Kapan.  Thanks to the agricultural business, Andranik provides his family with food products and uses the profits from sales of agricultural products to support remaining needs of his family.  Andranik needs a loan in the sum of 550,000 dram to conduct sowing work, i.e. buy new types of seeds, diesel fuel and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new types of seeds, diesel fuel and fertilizers

loans.name: Asylkan's Group

texts.en: Asylkan is the leader of this group. She is 56, and unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised four children: two daughters work in a sewing workshop, the first son is in construction and the youngest son goes to school. Asylkan works as a bookkeeper in the police department. In order to earn additional money, she breeds cattle and resells it after fattening. With money received from the loan, Asylkan wants to purchase feed for her cattle. Some part of the loan she will use to purchase home furniture. In the future, she wishes to build a house for her sons. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Enhchimeg

texts.en:
Enhchimeg is 29-years-old and lives with her husband and a child in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Darhan-Uul province of Mongolia. Her husband is a construction worker and her daughter is in kindergarten. 

She started her garment business in 2010 by purchasing a counter in a local market for 450,000 MNT. Now her current assets are 800,000 MNT. Even though she is fairly new to the business, she has already gained recognition from her clients and customers. She is planning to expand her business in the future. 

She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I have a plan to expand my business and to increase my income." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase caftans and slippers.

loans.use: to purchase caftans and slippers.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, age 41, describes himself as God-fearing and honest. He operates a cereals sales business, selling such items as maize, beans, and green beans. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a shopping center in Mombasa. He describes his biggest business challenges to be competition and the seasonality of certain cereals. 

David and his wife have four children between the ages of four and 12.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add to his stock of beans. His business goal is to grow his business into a wholesale endeavor within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to build a big residential house for his family.

loans.use: to add to his stock of beans

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret fries fish at Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana. She is divorced, and currently taking care of 5 children. She has been in this trade for 6 years. She is responsible for educating, feeding and providing shelter for the children. Her loan will be used to procure fresh fish to fry for resale.

loans.use: to procure fresh fish to fry for resale.

loans.name: Apolline

texts.en:
Apolline is 49 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children, ages 16 to 30. 

Apolline sells used clothes in a store she has run for 4 years. She would like a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the profits to make renovations on her house and provide food for her family. She would like to continue to buy clothes in bulk and sell them for a profit.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Knight

texts.en:
Knight has been in farming for 10 years, with her produce going to the local market. She produces mainly maize and beans. She is married with 6 children aged between 12 and 2 years.

Knight has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says farming is her family's sole source of income and the acquisition of an additional cow will boost her milk income and improve her family's financial security.

She is concerned with high costs of production and unreliable rains. Knight is aged 34.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mungakha Group

texts.en:
Shatome is the facilitator of the Mungakha group. Shatome and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Shatome takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Shatome had a good maize yield harvesting six bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Shatome was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Shatome and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Shatome will educate his children and repay the loan.

In 2012, the members of Mungakha group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase tubes, glue and tires.

loans.name: Caacupe Poty 1 Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé. Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva. Ellas están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida. Se encuentran en el ciclo numeron 1 con sus 12 integrantes.
Una de las miembros es la señora Virginia, quien nos comenta que se dedica a la costura. Ella por medio de su arduo trabajo ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia, cubriendo los gastos que surgen. Ella se define como una persona humilde, honesta y muy luchadora, desea poder seguir creciendo para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Virginia solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás insumos necesarios para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women who belong to this group are from the town of Caacupé. They are very happy with the support they receive from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. They are expanding their small businesses and increasing their income which provides them with a better standard of living.

One of the members is Sra. Virginia who is a seamstress. Because of this difficult job she has been able to help her family get ahead and cover household costs. She calls herself a simple, honest, and hardworking woman who wishes to continue growing her business so she can help her family. Virginia is seeking a loan to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, and other supplies so she can fulfill her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, and other supplies

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael, 34 years old, is married and has one child, aged 4.  Raphael has been doing dairy and crop farming for 8 years and employs one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to increase his  farm production. He hopes to grow his dairy business in the future. Raphael has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to add to his savings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To add to his savings to buy a cow

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Kuña Kyrey”, están en el Segundo Ciclo con 13  integrantes. Es un grupo conformado por personas muy unidas, solidarias y responsables. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, cuyo objetivo es poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y familiares. 
Maria es la presidenta del grupo, ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se esfuerza por darle lo mejor a su familia. Maria comenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas, como ser camisas, remeras, pantalones y demás tipos, gracias a lo cual ella puede ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano para que de esa forma pueda surtirse y tener mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee is called “Kuña Kyrey” and is in its second cycle with 13 members.  It’s a group composed of very united, supportive and responsible people.  They are hardworking, enterprising women whose objective is to move their children and families ahead.

María is the group President.  She defines herself as a hardworking, tenacious woman who strives to give the best to her family.  María comments that she sells all kinds of clothes like shirts, t-shirts, pants and others.  Thanks to this she’s able to help her family and cover daily costs that arise.

She asks for the loan to buy summer clothes so that she can be stocked up and have a wider variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes to resell.

loans.name: Julio Manuel

texts.es:
Julio tiene 45 años de edad, el vive al lado de su esposa con la cual tiene 3 maravillosos hijos los cuales tiene 22, 18 y 8 años y por quienes trabaja muy duro para poder darles una vida digna y sobre todo hacerlos personas de bien. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros; asimismo podemos encontrar muchos lugares turísticos como la “Laguna de Huacachina”, la cual recibe a muchos turistas en todo el año. Julio es muy trabajador, pero cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho pintar y en ocasiones disfrutar de uno de sus platillos típicos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. 

Día a día Julio trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de cuadros, retratos, entre otros, el trabaja alrededor de 8 joras al día, mayormente puede atender hasta 5 clientes al día ya que el realizar los retratos le toma tiempo; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque realiza su trabajo con mucha creatividad.

Julio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le  han brindado el podrá materiales para realziar sus trabajos como oleos, pinceles nuevos, entre otros, asi el podra tener los implementos necesarios para realizar sus trabajos y poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad su mas grande seuño:" Tener su casa propia".
texts.en:
Julio is 45 years old.  He lives by his wife’s side and they have three wonderful children, ages 22, 18, and 8.  He works very hard to give his family a decent life and above all, bring them up to be good people.  His home is located in Ica, a city known for its warm, welcoming atmosphere, as well as for its agricultural development, particularly in the cultivation of cotton, grapes, asparagus, paprika, and other products.  In addition, there are many tourist areas such as the “Laguna de Huacachina”, which receives many tourists throughout the year.  Julio is hard working but when he has free time available, he enjoys painting and sometimes enjoys one of his country’s typical dishes, the delicious “Arroz con Pollo” (chicken with rice)”.

Julio works daily in his small business selling paintings, portraits, and other items.  He works about eight hours a day.  Mainly, he serves five customers a day because making portraits takes time.  He believes that his business is going well because he is very courteous to his customers and because he is very creative in his work.  

Julio is very grateful to Kiva for the loans because thanks to their help, he will be able to buy materials such as oils, new brushes, and other items.  In this way, he will have the tools he needs to paint his paintings and continue striving to make his great dream a reality: “Having his own home”.

loans.use: to buy materials such as oil and paint brushes.

loans.name: Menardo

texts.en:
This is Menardo. He previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help with their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Menardo dreams that his business will grow bigger and hopes that his children will have a better life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Dagbe 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DAGBE 2 est composé de trois personnes qui sur  le même lieu de vente. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de  ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Yétondé Claudine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Yétondé Claudine est âgée de 28 ans et vit au Bénin. Yétondé Claudine est mariée à un vulgarisateur du nom de Edouard. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Yétondé Claudine vend depuis cinq ans de la bouillie de maïs et de mil. Yétondé Claudine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Yétondé Claudine, ensemble  avec les membres du groupe DAGBE 2, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et du mil.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonse aged 45 years. She is married with 6 children aged between 7 and 21 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 7 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay wokers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay wokers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sarah. She is a 41-year-old woman who lives in the area of Kitale. It is a thriving area full of people like Sarah, who, with hard and honest work, make this town a very productive one. 

Sarah is a woman eager to get ahead. She is married and lives with her husband. She is blessed with six children, who are her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to give them a better future. 

Sarah herself was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Through her dairy cows, she is able to get between 10 and 15 liters a day, and this helps her to support her family. 

Sarah also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements, and this is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will also be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence increased profit levels. 

Sarah is really visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Sarah believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Sarah’s way out of poverty.
Help Sarah to accomplish her dreams with this loan she´s requesting.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy a bull for manure production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Munyenye Ntusero leng’irra would like to buy different varieties of beadwork materials.

loans.name: Rusmini

texts.en: Rusmini  is 45 years old and married with four sons.  Rusmini supplements her husband’s income by going around her village on foot, selling sheets and bed covers on credit. In a week, total payments collected from her customers comes to about $20, of which approximately $7 is profit. Thus, this yields about $28 profit per month. She needs a loan of $100 to buy more sheets and bed covers to sell and thus approximately double her income. Rusmini very much wants to earn more money  for her children's education and to give them a better life than the one she had as a child.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung's husband has weak kidneys; he works as a farmer, growing rice for his family’s food. Dung sells sweet soup at a small market. They raise 2 small cows to be able to save a little to continue their children's schooling. Two of their children are students in Ho Chi Minh City; they also do odd jobs to pay their expenses. Their other child has cerebral palsy. The family's average income is $10 per month per person.

Dung wants to borrow $ 75 so that they can raise more pigs. She plans to repay the loan over the space of 9 months.

loans.use: raising pigs

loans.name: Cleotilde De Jesús

texts.en:
Cleotilde is the kind of woman that wants to do everything she can to succeed and improve her situation in life.  She is 45, married and the mother of 3 children, 2 boys and a girl.  When she’s not in her beauty salon, that she has owned now for almost 25 five years, she’s selling Jafra’s cosmetics and skin care products to the people of her community.

Her salon was the first one built in her area and customers come for the quality and professionalism of her work.  She’s one of the few people that have an electric generator so her salon can work even with the power cut.   Even though she studied Nursing, Cleotilde had never had to work in a hospital or a health center, because her business provides her a higher income than working as a nurse.  In fact, she earns between 10.000 and 15.000 Dominican pesos a month (US $ 1.00 =33 pesos)  from her beauty salon.  Now, she really thinks things could be better if she could remodel the salon.  She also plans to put a showcase into the salon to exhibit some beauty samples to her customers.  All those plans will be possible if she can borrow US$ 375.00.

loans.use: To buy more products and a showcase to promote a line of skin care products.  The entrepreneur also needs money to cover operating expenses.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. A. has had his business selling various meats and tropical fruit for one year and his wife helps him attend to his customers. Currently sales are growing because he supplies various stores and restaurants in the area.

Loan Use

He wants to use the loan to buy merchandise and improve his store, as it is very small and he would like to be able to better attend to his clients.

Personal Information

He is 46 years old and has no children. His house is made of cane and his goal is to grow his business in order to one day be able to be in a better financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor A. se dedica a la venta de carnes varias y frutas tropicales, este negocio lo inicio hace 1 año y en la atención a sus clientes le ayuda su esposa, actualmente sus ventas esta creciendo ya que el es el proveedor de las diferentes tiendas y comedores que existen en el sector.

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere invertir el crédito en la compra de mercadería y adecuar el local ya que en la actualidad el espacio es muy pequeño para poder atender de una mejor manera a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Tiene 46 años y no tiene hijos, su vivienda es de caña y su meta es crecer en su negocio para un día poder tener una mejor forma de vida en cuanto a su economía.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and improve his store

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en: Rauf is a lorry driver. He is 33, married with two children and lives  in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Rauf has been driving a lorry for 14 years. He is looking for credit so that he can make repairs to his vehicle, which is his main source of income.

loans.use: To repair lorry

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos, a member of the Communal Bank for Enterprising Women, lives in Moyobamba, which is in the San Martín region of Peru. She has a post in the city's central market, where she sells bread and other products of high necessity. She was driven to start the business out of the need to generate her own income and help her husband with rearing and education their children. She had experience selling wholesale goods, but saw that retail had better profit margins so she switched to that.

With the $700 loan, which she will repay in six months, she will purchase various goods like bananas, yucca, oranges, lemons and other fruits and vegetables in high quantities so her post is well stocked and can satisfy her customers' demands.

Santos is 57 years old, divorced and has nine children, four of whom still live with her. She is a person with enthusiasm to do a good job no matter the effort. Her dream is to have her own home with a well-stocked convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Santos, socia del banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras, vive en del distrito y provincia de Moyobamba, departamento de San Martín. Tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad en donde vende productos de pan llevar o de primera necesidad. Se inicia en el negocio motivada por la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos y ayudar a su esposo en la crianza y educación a sus hijos. Tenía experiencia en la venta de productos al por mayor, pero observó que este tipo de negocio generaba mayores márgenes de ganancias por lo que decidió cambiar. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diferentes productos como plátanos en racimos, yucas, naranjas y limones en sacos, frutas y verduras y de esa manera tener bien surtido su puesto de venta y poder satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes. Santos tiene 57 años , separada y con 9 hijos, 4 de los cuales aún viven con ella. Es una persona con entusiasmo para hacer las cosas bien sin medir esfuerzo, sueña con tener en su propia casa una bodega de abarrotes bien surtida.

loans.use: Purchase bananas, yuccas, oranges, lemons, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
My name is Nasreen S. from Multan, Pakistan. My husband is a rickshaw driver. His rickshaw is not in good condition, and he wants to replace it with a new one. The rickshaw is our only source of income, so we are in urgent need of this loan.

My fellow loan members also need loans: Rasheeda B. will use her share of the loan to pay off the remaining installments on their rickshaw; this early payment will save them some money. Rukkiah B. sells cloth. Parween B.’s husband runs an electric goods store. Yasmeen B. would use the loan to expand their wholesale betelnut business. All these women play a major role in earning income for their families.

loans.use: Replace old rickshaw with a new one

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Mrs. Rafaela C. lives in her own house in the Pasankeri area of the Ciudad de La Paz (La Paz City) with her 12-year-old daughter. Mrs. Rafaela is an entrepreneur and sells household items in a public market.

With her prevous loan, she bought building materials and built the foundations of the front wall of her house, which allowed her to finish half the required construction. Currently, the previous loan has been fully paid.

The loan that she is asking for now will be used to finish the construction of the front wall plus the bathroom which currently has no bathroom fittings.

This is the third time that Mrs. Rafaela is asking for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis made on her reveals that she qualifies for the loan and can be granted one.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

La señora Rafaela C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz con su hija de 12 años, la señora Rafaela es comerciante y vende artículos domésticos en un puesto de venta en vía pública.

Con el crédito anterior realizó la compra de material de construcción y la construcción de cimientos en el muro frontal de su vivienda teniendo un avance de la mitad de la obra requerida. Dicho crédito a la fecha está completamente pagado.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la conclusión del muro frontal más la habilitación de un baño que se encuentra sin los artefactos sanitarios.

Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To build a front wall and to buy bathroom fittings for a bathroom.

loans.name: Balqees' Group

texts.en:
Balqees N. is married and a mother of two boys. Her eldest son attends a local school in grade two and she would like to see both her kids finish their schooling successfully. Balqees helps her brother-in-law to embroider and decorate clothes while her husband works as a sweeper at a local school. She is borrowing from Asasah, a microfinance institution, to invest in her brother-in-law’s embroidery business which gives her a reasonable monthly income.

The other women in her group who are also requesting loans include: Zeenat B., whose husband repairs roads; Rubina B. who sells cloth; and Haneefa B. who wants to buy construction supplies.

loans.use: Invest in a clothing embroidery business

loans.name: Elvira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elvira del Carmen S. is a hard working woman who, for the past 5 years, has worked selling cooking fuel in her home-based business in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua. The sales process begins when she requests that the cooking fuel company bring full cylinders to her house. Her business cycle is that after receiving these and selling them she places new orders and returns the empty cylinders when the new ones are delivered.

It is necessary to highlight that Elvira has been supported by Ceprodel to improve her business through the acquisition of higher quality cooking fuel tanks. She is currently seeking the support of Ceprodel again and trusts that her credit application will be approved so that she can obtain a higher income and invest it in the education of her young daughter and household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Elvira del Carmen S. es una esforzada dama que desde hace cinco años se ha dedicado al negocio de la venta de tropigas para la cocina vendidos en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua. El proceso de venta del negocio inicia cuando ella solicita que la agencia de Tropigas le lleve los cilindros llenos a su hogar luego al obtenerlos y venderlos realiza nuevos pedidos los cuales al serle entregados ella de igual manera entrega los cilindros vacíos siendo este un ciclo en el negocio.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Elvira se ha apoyado de Ceprodel para mejorar su negocio en la adquisición de mayores tanques de tropigas para la cocina. Hoy en día una vez mas busca el apoyo en Ceprodel confiando que su solicitud de crédito será aprobado para así obtener mayores ingresos e invertir en la educación de su pequeña hija y en los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of cylinders of liquid gas to sell them in homes

loans.name: Saifudin

texts.en: Mr. R. Saifudin was born in 1958 in the Utkansoi region of Tajikistan and is married with five children. His family was not able to provide him with a higher education, but he has raised and sold livestock for the past 40 years and is very skilled at it. Mr. Saifudin has applied to Kiva for a loan to expand his business by buying a new bull. This is his second loan through MicroInvest. He used his first loan, which he received earlier this year, for the same purpose of expanding his business.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying a pedigree bull

loans.name: Mamata

texts.fr:
Mamata D. is 39 years old, married, and mother of five. She lives in Wome, a city about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She resells loincloths and other products. Mamata would like to use her loan to buy two rolls of cloth, boxes of milk, bags of rice, boxes of soap and jars of jam. This would allow her to grow her business, increase her income, and provide for her children.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Mamata D. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle réside à Wome, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé la capitale togolaise. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes et des produits divers. Mamata souhaite par ce crédit acheter 2 balles de pagnes, des cartons de laits, des sacs de riz, des cartons de savons et des boîtes de conserves. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, de tirer plus de profits et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other goods to grow her business

loans.name: Haleema Abdul Razaaq Group

texts.en:
Haleema baji is the wife of Mr. A. R.. She lives in an area of Multan called Shah Rukn-e-Alam. It is famous for its beautiful handmade things. Haleema baji has been living in this area for the last 25 years. She has one son. Her husband is a street-side medic. Her son is a medical rep in a clinic. She is a housewife and prefers to do household works. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now, she is applying for a loan for her son who wants to buy medicines to start his own medical shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rashida baji wants a loan to buy more cloth to resell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies for her electric shop. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy milk for her milk-selling business. Saddaqat Begum baji wants a loan to buy cloth for her cloth business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy medicines for medical store

loans.name: Thi Nhung

texts.vi: Chị Nhung tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 2007 . Hiện nay công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là đánh bắt cá. Hàng ngày vợ chồng chị đi đánh bắt cá  và bán cho các đại lý thu mua cá tại địa phương cho thu nhập từ 100.000đến 150.000đồng/ ngày. Vì gia đình chị sống ở cạch sông Đáy  nên công việc đánh bắt cá cũng có rất nhiều thuận lợi. Anh chị hiện có 2 con đều đã trưởng thành và có công việc ổn định vì thế với thu nhập từ đánh bắt cá gia đình chị không chỉ sử dụng đủ để chi tiêu mà còn có thể tiết kiệm và tiếp tục đầu tư làm ăn. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay thêm 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm bộ lưới mới phục vụ cho việc đánh bắt cá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung has joined the TYM Fund since 2007. Currently, her family's income comes mainly from fishing. Everyday, she and her husband fish and sell to the fish retailers in the village, earning 100,000 to 150,000VND (about 6USD to 9USD) each day. Her family lives near Day river so fishing is very convenient. She has 2 children. They are all grown up with stable works and incomes, so the income from fishing is not only enough for daily expenses but also enough for them to save and invest in further business. This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to purchase new net for fishing.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy net to fish

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel  P.  vive en la calle Barrio Lindo  de la zona Alto Chamaco Chico en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Daniel vive junto a su esposa y su hija de 8 años en la casa de  sus suegros

Mientras él es chofer de una empresa, su esposa trabaja como vendedora en un negocio de artículos alimenticios.

El crédito será destinado para poder iniciar un negocio propio el cual será atendido por su esposa en una zona comercial de la ciudad de El Alto. 
 
Este es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica favorablemente, por eso, esperamos que lo ayuden a impulsar su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Daniel P. lives in the Barrio Lindo neighbhorhood, Alto Chamaco Chico zone, in the city of El Alto.

Daniel lives with his wife and 8-year old daughter in the home of his in-laws.

While he works as a chauffer for a company, his wife works as a saleswoman at a food products business.

The loan would be destined to start their own business, which would be tended to by his wife, in a commercial zone in the city of El Alto.

This is his first credit with IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted indicates he is favorably qualified. For this reason, we hope that you will help him get started in his endeavor.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Danelia tiene 47 años de edad, con cinco hijos los cuales tres trabajan y dos están estudiando, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Villa Venezuela, su esposo trabaja como maestro de obra en una empresa privada y cuando tiene libre trabaja por cuenta propia, es un trabajo duro pero se gana bien. Doña Danelia tiene una pulpería desde hace dieciocho años, lo cual inicio con ayuda de su esposo, y luego decidió hacer préstamos para invertir más en su inventario, lo cual hasta ahora ha podido mantenerse en las ventas pues con esta solicitud de crédito en AFODENIC es la sétima lo cual le permite crecer en las ventas con esta desea comprar productos de limpieza, productos enlatados y otros de variedad para ofertar a sus clientes. A largo plazo es comprar otro frezeer para vender más productos de carne roja como carne blanca, tener mejores ganancias y ver por su familia.
texts.en:
Daniela is 47 years old and she has five children, three are working and two are attending school. She lives in a district within the capital of Villa Venezuela. Her husband is a master labourer in a private company and when he works for his own account in his spare time - it's hard work but his earnings are good. Daniela has been running a convenience store for eighteen years. She started it with the help of her husband and later she decided to take loans to invest in her inventory which until now she has been able to maintain. This will be her sevent loan through Afodenic and it will permit her to increase her sales by purchasing cleaning products, canned foods, and other items to offer her clients. In the future she will purchase a freezer to sell products such as red and other meats. She wishes to have better earnings to look after her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase canned foods and cleaning products.

loans.name: Lai Sroeun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lai Sroeun Chaem leads a group of four borrowers all of whom live in Phteah Khpos Village in Kampong Cham Province. She has a half-hectar plot of land on which to cultivate rice and earn a living. But she is not able to grow rice now because she does not have enough seeds to plant. To solve with this problem, she is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to make her field more productive. Her husband, Mr. Thuch Sorn, works as a security guard. Mrs. Lai Sroeun Chaem is 34 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school while the youngest, who is three years old, stays at home.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr:
Cette jeune dame de vingt cinq (25) ans habite le quartier d’Agoè abové au Togo. Elle exerce le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale et a même temps un bar qu’elle  appelé BAR OCEAN, elle exerce cette activité depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne au marché locale d’Agoè et au grand marché de Lomé. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de chez WAGES et sollicite son premier crédit pour  approvisionner son stock d’alimentation générale et des casiers de boissons.
Elle est mariée à monsieur ABBEY Kodjovi qui est un informaticien et ils ont ensemble 02 enfants. Avec son commerce  elle aide son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes du ménage.
texts.en:
This young woman of 25 lives in the Agoè Abové neighborhood in Togo. She sells various foodstuffs and, at the same time, has a bar that she calls BAR OCEAN. She has been in this business since 2005 and does her buying at the local open-air market in Agoè and the big market in Lomé. She has never received a loan from WAGES and is asking for this first one to expand her stock of foodstuffs and buy some crates of drinks.

She is married to Mr. Kodjovi Abbey who works with computers and they have 2 children together. With her business income, she helps her husband with the daily household expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en: Chhan N., age 46, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She has been a vegetables seller for about 10 years and makes US $7 in net profit a day. Her husband grows vegetables and provides them to his wife daily, to sell at the market. This couple, together, have seven children, three who are students.  Mrs. Chhan N. would like to use this loan to purchase a vegetable stand in the market, to help reduce the monthly rental fee.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable stand in the market.

loans.name: Mrs. Hei Kory Village Bank Group

texts.en:
There are fifteen members of this village bank in Chrok Sangke Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They will use the loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Hei K. is the village bank president. She is 47 years old and sells firewood. She is the mother of nine children; two of whom are employed in a garment factory, three help their parents work, and the others attend the local school. Her husband, Mr. Vong Khorn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Even though they try to work hard, they still do not have enough money to provide a better house for their family. Mrs. Hei K. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a better house.

Mr.Vuthy S. is not participating in this loan, but his wife is, so she is shown in the photo instead of him.

Nine members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Chizurum

texts.en: Chizurum sells pure water wholesale and retail to his customers. He hopes for the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more pure water to sell. He is 33 years old and married without any children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pure water to sell

loans.name: Susy Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Susy Carolina C. Vásquez tiene 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella estudio hasta el 2do año de secundaria, tiene 1 hija la cual depende económicamente de ella.
Susy se dedica a la venta de comida (menú), su negocio lo comparte (en asociación) con su suegra, esto desde el mes de Enero del presente año, su negocio lo desarrolla en la casa de sus suegra. 
Con el primer crédito de 200 soles, que recibió de su Banco “Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, lo invirtió en la compra de utensilios para la cocina.
Con el crédito de 500 soles , que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de víveres para la preparación de menú y arreglo de su local.
Susy tiene como sueño, administrar su propio negocio, independizarse como empresaria en la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Susy Carolina C. Vásquez is 20 years old. She lives in the Salaverry district, in Trujillo province, in the apartment La Libertad. She studied until the second year of high school and has a daughter that is economically dependent on her. Susy sells food (the special of the day). She has run her business with her mother-in-law since January of this year. The business is based in her mother-in-law's home.

With the first loan of 200 soles that she received from her Bank "Comunal Las Triunfadores de Salaverry II" she bought cooking utensils. With this loan of 500 Soles, that will be repaid over 4 months, she will purchase supplies for preparing her menu and fixing up her location.

Susy dreams of managing her own business and becoming independent as businesswoman selling food.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for preparing food and fixing up her location

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият Курбанова – женщина 55 лет. Вдова и мать 5-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается продажей мужской одежды на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Так как ее муж умер, она растит 5-х детей в одиночку и конечно же ей очень трудно. Хосият закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан.  Хосият хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента.
texts.en:
Khosiyat K. is a 55 year old woman. She is a widow and the mother of 5 children. Khosiyat has a high school education. She sells men’s clothing at the Farovon market in Gafurov. Because her husband died, she is raising 5 children on her own and of course it is very difficult for her. Khosiyat purchases her products at the wholesale market in Istaravshan. She would like to expand her product assortment, because a good selection attracts more customers. She would like to take out a loan in order to expand her assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase men's clothing for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria Magdalena B. M. tiene 40 años de edad. Ella vive en su casa propia donde tiene una despensa la cual adquirio gracias a un pequeño ahorro que logro juntar.

Inicio su negocio en el año 2002 y está llevando el negocio adelante gracias a la dedicación y la buena atención que le brindan a sus clientes.

Doña Maria M.B. es una señora muy sacrificada por que se tiene que levantar muy temprano para viajar hasta el mercado de Abasto de donde compra las mercaderías para su despensa y así tenerla bien surtida.

Empezo a trabajar con la Fundacion Paraguaya en el año 2006 y comenta la misma que gracias a los préstamos su negocio va creciendo.

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de mas variedad mercaderías ya que crece la clientela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Magdalena B. M is 40 years old. She lives in her own home where she has a convenience store that she acquired thanks to some small savings that she was able to put together. She began her business in 2002 and she is growing her business thanks to her dedication and good customer service. Maria Magdalena B. M is very hard working as she has to get up very early to travel to the Abasto market where she buys merchandise for her store and in this way have it well-stocked. She began her businesses through the Fundacion Paraguaya in 2006 and she says that she is grateful for the loans to grow her business. The loan she seeks will be used to buy a variety of merchandise as her clientele is growing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store: sugar, rice, noodles, oil, milk, general merchandise

loans.name: Nazer Muhammad Group

texts.en: Nazer Muhammad is the leader of the three-member Nazer Muhammad group, and they want to take out a loan to expand their businesses. Nazer Muhammad wants a loan for his taxi business, Matab wants a loan for her embroidery business, and Farnaz wants a loan for her tailoring business. They are very happy that these small loans are available in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Esperanza Y Esfuerzo 1 Group

texts.en:
Raquel is a mother of two young children ages 4 years and 7 months. Raquel lives in the remote community of Consuelo.  Often times when people in her community want to buy new clothes for a special occasion they have to spend a considerable amount of money in transportation to get to San Pedro de Macoris, the nearest city. She will use this loan to buy new clothes and serve this demand in her community. She hopes to expand her business as time permits. She hopes to better her life and the lives of her children. 

Please help Raquel become a successful business woman in her community. Thank you.

loans.use: Buy new clothes to resell

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon T., 51, is married and lives with two of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She sells cakes and grocery items in front of a garment factory, making $2 US each day. Her husband does some farming and works as a security guard, making about $2 US each day as well. This couple is also supported by two of their children who are security guards.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these difficult times, Chhuon T. is asking for a loan of $1000 US to expand her grocery store. She sees this as a good economic investment and will use it to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Johanna Del Carmen

texts.es: Johanna del Carmen R. D. tiene 38 años. Es madre soltera tiene 8 años con esta actividad económica. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y calzados. Johanna tenía muchas dificultades, por lo que sus hijos necesitaban el pan de cada día, y así sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda, que está ubicada en su casa de habitación, por lo que cada día salía a ofrecer sus productos y con el paso del tiempo logro establecer su tienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra ropa y calzado. Su deseo es brindarles las facilidades económicas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Johanna del Carmen R. D. is 38 years old. She is a single mother and has been working in her business for 8 years. Her business is the sale of clothing and footwear. Johanna had many difficulties meeting her children’s basic needs and moving her family forward. She owns a store that is located in her home, she used to go out every day to sell her products but over time she has established her own store. The funding she has requested is for working capital to purchase clothing and footwear. Her desire is to provide financial facilities for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Jeni

texts.en:
Jeni is a member of the Mgodi North borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. Her children are aged 14, 7, 5, and 1 years.

Jeni started her own business selling clothes 4 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Jeni’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Jeni hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Los Geranios Group

texts.en:
Virginia C. (third from the right) is a 33-year old woman who is taking out her first loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza. As the mother of four children (16, 12, 9, 7), she is excited about strengthening her business so she can better prepare them for their futures.

With this loan, Virginia will purchase jewelry from an area in the capital called Villa con Suelo, which is about an hour from her Los Alcarrizos home. In the past, she tried to sell perfume; however, she is now switching to smaller, less expensive items because she can sell more. Eventually, she would like to sell perfume again and open a small shop.

Virginia is also the group coordinator for the Bank of Hope Los Geranios. As the coordinator, she recognizes that it is her responsibility to help the other women invest wisely and attend the bimonthly repayment meetings punctually.

On behalf of Virginia, the Bank of Hope Los Geranios, and the microfinance institute Esperanza International, thank you for providing opportunities to those who need them most!

loans.use: To purchase jewelry for resale

loans.name: Rosa Cándida

texts.es: Rosa Cándida L. H. reside en Sensuntepeque en el departamento de Cabañas. Rosa es madre soltera de su único hijo Diego de 16 años de edad, estudiante de bachillerato. Rosa se ha esforzado mucho a lo largo de estos años por darle una estabilidad económica y emocional a su hijo, hace varios años aprendió cosmetología para lograr poner un negocio propio y así fue como Rosa, se instalo en un local donde ahora ofrece variedad de servicios en cosmetología,  así también ofrece a sus clientes de los productos de belleza que ella tienen en su local, el crédito que Rosa necesita es para invertir en productos de belleza  para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Cándida L. H. lives in Sensuntepeque in the Department of Cabañas. Rosa is a single mother. She has an only son, Diego, who is 16 years old. He is studying for his high school diploma. Rosa has tried very hard through the years in order to provide economic and emotional stability to her son. Several years ago, she learned cosmetology in order to be able to have her own business. This is how Rosa installed herself in a shop where she offers a variety of cosmetology services, and also offers her clients beauty products that she stocks in her shop. The loan that Rosa needs is to invest in beauty products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 23-year-old married mother of four school-age children. Her husband, who is also in business, sells mobile phones and accessories.  Jackline specializes in selling school uniforms at the Kibuye market.  She started her business three years ago.  She gets her stock at the same place during market days.  Her business has done well and she hopes to improve it with a loan of 20,000 KES.

loans.use: Buy more stock

loans.name: Villa Ingavi Group

texts.es:
Aida C. de 35 años, es integrante del grupo “Villa Ingavi”, que pertenece al Centro Focal “German Busch” es madre de 2 hijos pequeños, tiene el negocio de trensado de mantas, cuenta que una amiga la había enseñado cuando era soltera, ella venda sus productos en una tienda ubicado en la 16 de Julio. Aida pertenece a este grupo aproximadmente unos 7 años, en esta ocación necesita el préstamo para comprar cortes de tela y fleco.
Al igual que Aida las demás integrantes del grupo tienen diversos negocios como la confección de faldas, venta de ropa, mochila, frutas, jugos y servicio de filmaciones. Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercaderia y materia prima.
texts.en:
Aida C., 35 years old, is a member of the group "Villa Ingavi" that meets in the "German Busch" regional office of Pro Mujer. She is a mother of two small children. She has a business weaving blankets; she tells us that a friend taught her to do this when she was single. She sells her products in a store located on the Avenue 16 de Julio. Aida has belonged to this group for approximately 7 years. This time, she requests a loan to buy cloth and fringe. As with Aida, the other members of the group have small businesses involved in a variety of activities such as: the production of skirts, the sale of clothing, backpacks, fruit, juices and film services. They need the loan to acquire merchandise and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 27-year-old married businesswoman with three children. She runs an entertainment business, the Salome Playstation, in the Mathare slums of Nairobi. The business shows movies and is in high demand with young people in the area. Salome is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy ice-cream making materials and maize flour for porridge.

Salome hopes to expand her business further and lead a better life. She says that through Kiva partner Faulu she has also learned the importance of saving. She describes herself as a hardworking and visionary client.

About Faulu Kenya
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Microfinance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy ice-cream making materials and maize flour

loans.name: Florencia Antonio

texts.pt:
Florencia António Z. nasceu na Matola, Província de Maputo, tem 29 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos, de 10 e 3 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez 10ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições por parte dos progenitores. Vive numa casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu da cidade onde vive, é comerciante e dona de seu negocio há mais de 10 anos, trabalha sozinhas das 7h as 16h. Esta actividade aprendeu com a sua mãe que também faz a mesma ha longo tempo. Vende mais a loiça de cozinha, consegue um rendimento diário de cerca de 500mt a 1.000.00mt com os quais sustenta a família e poupa algum com as amigas através do sistema tradicional de poupança (Xitique).

Já teve empréstimos com uma organização internacional da Suiça (Helvetas) e a GGLS, outra instituição de crédito, todos foram para o comércio. Conheceu a Hluvuku através das amigas que a informaram a cerca da mudança de instituição da dona Isaura (oficial de credito da Hluvuku) e preferiu seguir a ela porque trabalharam juntos na antiga instituição.
Este é o seu 4º empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema e no valor de 10.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar mais produtos para o seu negócio (loiça de cozinha, e produtos de mercearia). Os empréstimos passados foram de 4.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro, pretende solicitar mais empréstimos, para a construção de sua residência e fortificar ainda mais o seu negócio
texts.en:
Florencia António Z. was born in Matola, Maputo Province, in Mozambique. She is 29 years old and a single mother of a 10 and a 3 years old, the older one goes to school. She finished 10th grade but couldn't keep studying because of her parent's financial situation. She lives in her own house with her children and does not support anyone else. She owns a business and she's been working on it for 10 years, every day by herself from 7AM to 4PM. She mostly sells kitchen utensils and makes between 500MT and 1.000,00MT a day (U$15 and U$35). With that money she supports her kids and tries to save some. She is asking for a 10.000,00MT loan (U$350) which she'll use to buy more inventory for her business (kitchen utensils and food products). She hopes to pay this loan without a problem so she can ask for another one in the future to finish building her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her business place

loans.name: Urtnasan

texts.en:
H. Urtnasan lives with his wife and three children in a house in the Bayanzurkh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His youngest son and daughter attend secondary school and his oldest daughter is 19 years old. Urtnasan operates a transportation service as well as a business in the city making wood products. He transports goods and supplies for people throughout the city and in his free time makes a variety of wooden furniture which he sells. Urtnasan is a very hardworking person and is known for his good personality. He has worked hard over the years to grow his businesses and stabilize his income. He has used his earnings to support his family and improve their quality of life. He says, "I want my children to be educated so they will become good and happy people." Urtnasan is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to finish the workshop he has been building for his wood-products business. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To finish the workshop he has been building for his wood products

loans.name: Nedilen

texts.en:
Nedilen O. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Nedilen is married and has 4 school-aged children. Nedilen owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector rating a fishing business, buying fish for sale. Nedilen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nedilen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nedilen is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used towards expansion of her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Nedilen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny S. is 30 years old and lives in Chambok village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare field for growing rice. She faces some problems because her soil is infertile and the field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine, hoses, fertilizer, rice seed, and pesticides for rice farming. Her husband, Mr. Bo Rat Orn, is also a farmer.  Mrs. Ny S. is the mother of two children who both attend school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine, hoses, fertilizer, rice seed, and pesticides to grow rice.

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mean S., age 63, is a married woman and the mother of four children. Two attend the local public school and other two are employees in a sewing cloth industry. Mean S. is a cultivator who plants rice and vegetable crops. She has a partner in her husband, who assists her in the farming business. In the paste, Mean S. hired a neighbor’s cow to allow her physical labor in plowing her farmland and she right now wants to reduce this fee by asking for a loan to purchase a couple of cows, which she will use them to alleviate her in plowing farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a couple of cows.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Mrs. Chann V. lives in Kdei Ta Hok village in Takeo province and is 43 years old. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Torn Torng, is a horse-cart driver who earns a small income from this. 

In the rice field they have some problems because the soil is infertile and there are a lot of insects that can cause damage. They have not had enough money to maintain it. Mrs. Chann V., therefore, decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide to improve their rice field and increase the yield this year. 

She is the mother of five children, one of whom is a farmer. The others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticide to improve their rice field

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 39 years old, married to Teresiah Wambui and has two school-going children.  He has been in dairy farming for the last four years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this will be his next loan after paying his first loan of Kshs 50,000 well and on time.  He plans to use proceeds from this loan to buy another dairy cow to increase his milk production.

Paul also has plans to venture into real estate in future, by buying a piece of land and building houses for rent.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Jesenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Jesenia del Socorro U. Cuadra, es  una joven  de 33 años quien  Labora como conserje en la planta gerencial en las oficinas del  Mercado Mayoreo Managua, ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado tres crédito con CEPRODEL durante tres  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento y mano de obra para reforzar más las paredes de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Jesenia dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jesenia del Socorro U. Cuadra is a young woman of 33 years od age. She works as a receptionist on the management floor in the offices of the Mayoreo Managua market. She has 2 children in her care, who are of school age, and she is married. Jesenia has worked with loans from Ceprodel for 3 years, and in this period she has invested the three loans in improving her house, thanks to the finances granted by Ceprodel. She is seeking this loan to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement and labour hire, to reinforce the walls of her home. All this is to give better security and a better standing of living to her chidren. Jesenia said that the loans have been to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Dominga's Group

texts.en:
Dominga B. is from the village of Catabban. She is 44 years old. Dominga is the group leader of a 14-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Dominga B.'s Group'.

Dominga is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Dominga owns & operates a furniture making business. The main source of income for the business comes from making & selling general household furniture for local businesses and community members. Dominga has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Dominga joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dominga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Dominga is requesting a new loan of 28,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Dominga from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a busy entrepreneur, Myrna has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for almost four years. Her husband, Danilo, is a carpenter in the neighborhood.

To build her business, Myrna would like to receive a loan of 30,000 PHP to increase the inventory of goods sold in her sari-sari store and to support her secondary business of hog-fattening. She is planning to purchase additional products such as rice, sugar, gasoline, eggs, and other supplies, and feed for the hogs. She believes that offering a wide assortment of goods to customers will increase traffic to her store and maintain customer loyalty in their village.
