Since 2005, Myrna has been a committed member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva micro-finance partner in the Philippines. She has been a model member with a 100% credit rating on her previous loans from ASHI.

Myrna’s long-term goals are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her store, and start a savings account for her children’s education. Through hard work and determination, she is focused on improving her quality of life with the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her sari-sari store and feed for her hogs

loans.name: Edeltrudes

texts.en:
Edeltrudes L. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Edeltrudes is married and has 3 adult children. Edeltrudes owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells firewood & charcoal. Edeltrudes has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Edeltrudes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edeltrudes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to increase her working capital. Edeltrudes is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Edeltrudes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon who has two children.

Ali has been running a construction business since 2001. He specializes in filling in the gaps of walls and buildings and then smoothing them. He has over seventeen years of experience in this field of work. He says that he has an advantage in his work because there are few competitors in his region. His clients include local community members. In the future, he hopes to expand his business. He is very proud of the quality of his work.

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to purchase a pulley device that allows him to move up and down a building structure. The device is similar to that used by window cleaners on skyscrapers. He believes that the loan will help improve his work and increase his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a pulley device

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope D. P. is from the village of Christine Village, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 28 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child.

Hope owns and operates a business venture into food sector which is making and selling food, she prepares and sells crackers (a kind of snack) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Hope joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI.

Hope is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Oumarou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumarou Touré est un homme marié de 39 ans et sans enfant. Il vit dans la famille paternelle dans le quartier Naniérila de Bougouni.
Très tôt, Monsieur Oumarou Touré commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment  la charge des batteries qu’il a appris dès son jeune âge auprès de son oncle. Avec une expérience de plus 10 ans, Monsieur Oumarou Touré maîtrise parfaitement son activité et compte utiliser son propre compteur électrique (ne plus dépendre de ses voisins avec qui ils partageaient le même compteur).
Pour ainsi améliorer son entreprise Monsieur Oumarou Touré décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Monsieur Oumarou Touré compte utiliser ce prêt pour payer les frais d’abonnement  d’un compteur électrique auprès de la Société Énergie du Mali (EDM s.a.), exploitation de Bougouni.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Touré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice, il envisage agrandir son entreprise et assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Oumarou Touré, aged 39, is a married man who has no children.  He lives in his father's family in the Naniérila district of Bougouni.  Early on, he started working in revenue-generating businesses, especially battery charging, which he learned at a young age from his uncle.  With over ten years of experience, he has mastered his business and plans on using his own electricity meter (to depend no longer on his neighbors with whom they have been sharing the same meter).  Thus, to improve his enterprise, Oumarou decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first individual loan.  He intends to use this loan for paying the registration fee for an electricity meter from the Société Énergie du Mali (EDM s.a.) for use in Bougouni. With this loan, he plans to make a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA.  With the profit, he envisions expanding his enterprise and ensuring that family expenses are covered.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fee for the electrical network

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Mrs. Pol M., 53, supports her family by selling fish paste in a small market located in her village. She either gets the fresh fish from her husband’s fishing or buys them from other fishermen. Then she turns the fresh fish into fish paste to sell for a profit. She is able make a least $2 a day to solve the financial problems of her family.

Pol M. is married with five children: two are married and live independently while three are single and live at home. Her husband fishes in the river to earn a living.

In addition, the family always takes time to farm a rice crop for the dual purpose of eating and selling. It is an annual business this couple has done with great success for a long time.

The heavy rainfall is starting which is good for growing, but Pol M. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So, she is looking for a loan to use towards planting her rice crop.

loans.use: To use towards planting her rice crop

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 24 años de edad, ella vive con sus padres en la casa de ellos. Pese a su juventud demostró ser una persona muy responsable y es así que gracias a sus ahorros que tenía desde hace varios años, pudo instalar una tienda de comestibles. Ahora muy tranquila trabaja, además que le agrada comunicarse con sus amigos, los cuales siempre la visitan por ser una de las tiendas más cercanas de la zona en la que vive. En el futuro desea implementar su tienda con mostradores y vitrinas, además de abastecerse de artículos de librería y bazar para que su negocio sea completo y pueda captar mucho más la atención de la clientela. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete de a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprarse mayor cantidad de productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Julia is 24 years old. She lives with her parents in their house. Despite her young age, she demonstrated being a very responsible person and it is thanks to her savings that several years ago, she was able to set up a grocery store. She works very calmly now. In addition, she likes talking with her friends, who always visit her since her store is one of the closest in the zone where she lives. In the future she wants to set up a counter and showcase, in addition to stocking up on bookstore and hardware items so that her business is complete and can capture much more attention from her customers. This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more items to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up her store with assorted items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a wall, such as: stone, sand, cement, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda T. is from the village of Mahayahay, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Erlinda is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice to sell. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza S. is from the village of Research Minante 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 31 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She is also a rice retailer/wholesaler in her village. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $405 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Flordeliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
The two people in the photo above are Mrs. Vorn S. and her husband. 

Making furniture is a significant part of this couple’s daily routine. They work from home producing their items which they also sell to make a daily income. Most of their output consists of beds and cupboards, which they accumulate and sell as a set. Their furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. 

The couple has two children, both of whom are in primary school. 

In addition to their furniture business, Vorn S. has applied for an $1,000 loan to buy a cultivating machine that she will provide as a plowing service to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine that she uses to provide a plowing service to farmers for a fee.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia B. is 40 years old and married to a soldier . She has 6 children who go to school.  She currently operates a small business selling beer, local alcohol, etc.  She is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business and build a bar.

loans.use: to stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 54-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has six children who are 2, 4, 6, 8, 14 and 20 years old. He has four additional dependents, who live with him to help the business. Mohamed also educates two of them.

In 1989, Mohamed established his ready-made clothing sales business and is a very hard working and determined businessman. He began his business to generate income, educate his children and take care of the family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. 

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 to purchase more clothing items in bulk. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 1,000,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to extend sales to co-traders on market days, as well as in nearby villages. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons and bales of ready-made clothing

loans.name: Ruth Pascuala

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Ruth;   ella tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención y administración de sus tienda de abarrotes, ella tiene una tienda en su casa en la planta baja que da  a la calle principal, la socia vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y los alterna también con materiales de escritorio, y un poco de adornos y regalos, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mayor mercadería como fideos, leche, azúcar, arroz aceite todo al por mayor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN” communal bank. The communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Ruth; she is 52 years old, married and has 3 children. The member alternates her activities in the home as well as the duties and management of her small grocery store. Mrs. Ruth has a store in the first floor of her home that leads to the street; she sells all types of basic household goods in addition to office products, decorations and gifts. Mrs. Ruth needs the loan to buy a greater amount of merchandize like spaghettis, milk, sugar, rice and oil, all wholesale. The member needs the loan to buy merchandize.

The member is very grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium she is also committed to meet her payment quotas in the time agreed.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy merchandize.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José David, de 38 años de edad, posee una tienda de granos básicos (café, maíz, arroz, frijol), vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad, este negocio lo administra desde hace dos años ofreciendo a los vecinos y clientes todo lo relacionado a los granos básicos que son tan necesarios en cada hogar.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio ya que quiere comprar granos por cantidades grandes y la única manera de hacerlo realidad es obteniendo un préstamo, ayudando así al negocio y ofreciendo a los clientes el mejor servicio.
Con respecto al préstamo él aspira que le funcione la inversión que realizara, que el negocio sea estable y le dé los ingresos para tener una vida cómoda con su familia.
texts.en:
José David is 38 years old.  He owns a basic grains store where he sells coffee, corn, rice and beans.  He lives with his wife and two children aged 8 and 10.  He has been running this business for two years, offering his neighbors and customers all kinds of basic grains which are so necessary in every household.

He is requesting ta loan to invest in his business since he would like to buy grains in large quantities and the only way to achieve this is by obtaining a loan.  This will help his business and offer his customers a better service.

With regard to the loan, he hopes his investment will pay off, that his business will be stable and that it provides him with the necessary income to have a comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: To buy coffee, beans, corn and rice

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Amadou D.  est âgé de 26 ans et sans enfant. Il vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec ses parents au  quartier Darsalam  de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Titulaire de deux  diplômes, enseignant de profession parallèlement à cette activité, il vend des habits pour hommes. Il appris ce commerce lorsqu’il était au lycée par souci d’aider ses parents qui avaient des difficultés pour prendre en charge les dépenses familiales. Il mène cette activité depuis 7 et jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. Sa force de vente est due à son dynamisme mais également à la qualité de ses habits qui sont de bonnes qualités.
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices, il fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso.  Il est à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’il  compte utiliser pour acheter, 20 pièces de bazins riches. Il  s’approvisionne sur place auprès des grossistes. Monsieur Amadou D. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  majoritairement d’hommes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, qui lui servira à rembourser son prêt et à aider ses parents dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mr. Amadou D. is 26 years old. He has no children. He lives in a traditional family with his parents in the neighborhood of Darsalam, in  the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali).

He holds two degrees and is a teacher by profession. Along with this activity, he also sells men’s apparel. He learned this trade while in high school in order to help his parents who were struggling to cover the family expenses. He has been doing this for seven years, has a large customer base and enjoys great notoriety. His strength is his enthusiasm but also the high quality of his merchandise.

Wanting to bolster his working capital to boost his profits, he turned to the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. This is his first individual loan, which he intends to use to buy 20 pieces of rich bazin (a type of damask). He gets his stocks from local wholesalers, and sells for cash and credit to a clientele composed mainly of men.

He expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan and help his parents with the family expenses.

loans.use: To purchase damask

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 28 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería,  ella tiene mucho tiempo de experiencia en su negocio, es una persona responsable que disfruta de su actividad. Disfruta de mantener a su familia para brindarles el pan de cada día, está ubicada en su vivienda en donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, detergentes entre otro. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de mercadería y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Juana is 28 years old.  She owns a general store and her experience in this business spans a long period of time.  She is a responsible person who enjoys running her business.  She also enjoys providing the daily bread to support her family.  Her general store is located in her home where she offers a large variety of products such as candy, soft drinks, grains, and detergents, among other items.  She will use the loan for working capital to buy merchandise and, in this way, improve her profits.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren, age 35, lives with her husband and two daughters in a traditional housing tent called a ger in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She has been living with her family at their permanent address for the past 11 years. Her husband provides transportation with his own car and her two daughters both attend a local school. Since 1998, she has been operating a meat trading business, purchasing meat at wholesale prices. She has a rented stall in the biggest market of the province. After many years owning this business, her working capital has reached a level of 600,000 MNT and her monthly sales income exceeds 2,000,000 MNT. She purchases a large amount of meat when prices for such products are cheap and preserves it for sale in the winter when it is in high demand. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Mechelyn

texts.en:
Mechelyn A. lives in the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married and has for the last 10 years made a living by buying and selling fish. She makes about 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2005, Mechelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid three previous loans of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC and is applying for a new one, for 15,000 PHP, to buy more fish to sell. She plans to use the  additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en: Tumenjargal is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son Ankhbayar attends a local secondary school, and her daughter is one year old. Tumenjargal has been operating a transportation business for the last four years by renting a bus from “Myaralzaa” Transportation Company. Her husband used to work in this company as a bus driver. Tumenjargal is a very polite and persistent person who is providing a proper education and morals for her children. She says she has already paid most of the money to the transportation company, but still owes 4,000,000 MNT. She will finish paying for the bus this spring and register it in her name. She is asking for a loan to purchse some spare parts for the bus.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for bus

loans.name: Aleida Del Carmen

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la cuidad de león, es madre soltera solo tiene un hijo , el cual estudia en los colegios de león, actualmente ella trabaja como maestro en el colegio Sara maría parrales del poblado de san Jacinto jurisdicción de telica, esta señora es el segundo crédito obtenido atraves del convenio de financiamientos con él antes mencionado, el cual le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida
texts.en: She is originally from the city of Leon. She is a single mother and she has only one son and he is attending school in Leon. She works as a teacher in the Sara Maria Parrales school in the community of San Jancinto, of the Telica jurisdiction. This is the second loan she has obtained through Convenio. The loans have helped her improve her living conditions and their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Jose Alonso

texts.es: Jose Alonso A. P. de 64 años de edad, habita en su casa junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. El tiene una barberia y la atiende con tres barberos mas donde ahi la amabilidad es su lema, dicho negocio lo tiene establecido en su misma casa de habitacion ubicada en colonia Monserrat, San Salvador. Don Jose ya goza de una clientela fija pues tiene varios años de dedicarse a ser peluquero y esto ha hecho que tenga gran calidad en su trabajo. José ha sabido sacar provecho al gran movimiento de personas que transitan por la zona. Es por eso que ha solicitado a INTEGRAL un credito con el que pueda ampliar  el negocio a un local mas comodo y agradable y comprar utencilios nuevos como maquinas de afeitar, navajas, tijeras, sillas adecuadas para la barberia entre otros; que permitan mantener la calidad de su trabajo y asi cada dia dar un  mejor servicio y al mismo tiempo mantener a sus clientes y atraer a nuevos. Jose al ser ya un hombre de avanzada edad necesita mantener activa su fuente economica pues el sueña que en algun momento pueda serle util tambien a sus hijos y tiene una gran confianza que asi podra seguir manteniendo su hogar.
texts.en:
José Alonso A. P. is 64 years old.  He lives in his home together with his wife and four children.  José owns a barber's shop and serves in it together with three other barbers.  In his shop, 'kindness' is his motto.  His business is located in his home which is in Montserrat district, in San Salvador.  José already has an established customer base since he has been a barber for several years.  He provides good-quality work.  José has known how to take advantage of the influx of people who pass by his shop. 

José is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which he will use to expand his business into more comfortable and pleasant premises.  He will also buy new tools such as electric shavers, shaving knives, scissors, barber's chairs, etc.  This will allow him to maintain the quality of his work and provide a better service every day.  It will also allow him to keep his existing customers and attract new ones.

As José is a man who is getting on in years, he needs to keep his source of income active as he dreams that at some point it will be useful to his children.  He is also very confident that, through his work, he will be able to keep supporting his household.

loans.use: to buy new tools such as electric shavers, shaving knives, scissors and barber's chairs

loans.name: Mi Amigo Jesus Group

texts.es: Arsenia es  integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Mi amigo Jesús” ella promovió su formación con personas emprendedoras del anexo  Corcona. Viene participando en el programa desde el año 2006. A sus 60 años y con ocho hijos de los cuales 02 aun son dependientes. Junto asu esposo lucha día a día para enfrentar los gastos familiares y salir a delante  con sus hijos. Arsenia se dedica a la preparación y venta de tamales además vende bebidas en su casa como: Gaseosas y refrescos. El préstamo recibido será invertido en la compra de insumos como: maíz, aceite y bebidas diversas además apoyara en el pago de la pensión de estudios de uno de sus hijos y si es posible ayudara a otro para que realice un trámite para sacar un brevete de conducir y  a si pueda trabajar como chofer. Arsenia sueña con establecerse en su propia vivienda y llegar a tener una fuente de soda amplia  y tener jardines con flores en donde junto a su esposo que es cerrajero puedan seguir trabajando. En la reunión de desembolso realizada en su comunidad podemos apreciar a los socios convocados y unidos, ellos agradecen la oportunidad y el capital de trabajo recibido para seguir trabajando, por motivo de  distancia no llegaron a tiempo dos de los socios como son: Eli Humberto y milena Iris por lo cual no están en la fotografía.
texts.en:
Arsenia is a member of the “Mi Amigo Jesús” (My Friend Jesus) communal bank. She spearheaded its formation with enterprising people from Corcona Annex.  It’s been participating in the program since 2006.

At the age of 60 and with 8 children, two of whom still dependent, Arsenia makes tamales to sell; she also sells beverages at home like soft drinks and sodas.

She will use the received loan to buy ingredients like corn, oil and assorted beverages; she will also contribute to the tuition costs of one of her children and, if possible, help the other child with the paperwork to get his driver’s license so that he can learn to work as a driver.

Arsenia dreams with having a house of her own and to have a spacious soda fountain.  She’d also like to have gardens with flowers where she and her husband, who’s a locksmith, can continue working.

We can see the members gathered together at the payout meeting that took place in their community.  They are grateful for the opportunity and for the working capital received to continue working.  Due to distance, two of the members did not arrive on time: Eli Humberto and Milena Iris so they do not appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and beverages.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is 42 years old, married to Emmanuel Wughoma. They have been blessed with three children. She is a tailor and she has been in this business for the last eight years.

This being her third loan from KADET, she plans to purchase a sewing machine and cloth materials for her business.

The anticipated profits will be directed into the repayment of the loan and expansion of her business. Rose’s dream is to open a dressmaking institution.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and cloth materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Jimena

texts.es: La señora Jimena se dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife, y trabaja en una empresa constructora. El crédito lo requiere para comprar cemento ya que realizara el vaciado en el patio de la casa donde vive. Vive en casa de parientes  la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Villa Avaroa en la ciudad de La Paz; Jimena  es casada  y tiene un hijo. Es cliente nuestra desde el año 2006 con un excelente historial de pagos.
texts.en: Jimena sells Herbalife products and works in a construction company. She needs the loan to buy cement since she is going to pour it on the patio where she lives. She lives in a house that belongs to some relatives, located in the Villa Avaroa area of the city of La Paz. Jimena is married and has a son. She has been our client since 2006 and has an excellent payment history.

loans.use: to buy cement to cover the patio in the house where she lives.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eulogia; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pasto y negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, pollos y chanchos y el negocio de venta de pasto lo vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y los animales lo vende en los distintos mercados, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pasto y negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pasto y comprar alimentos para los animales.                
                                                      
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eulogia belongs to the “Kanchary” Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 53 years old, married, and has 2 children. Eulogia alternates her daily activities between her business of selling fodder and raising animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs, without a fixed stall, from 5:00 am until 10:00 pm. She sells in distinct local markets.

Eulogia wants to expand both her feed business and her raising and selling of animals. She is requesting a loan to buy fodder and feed for her animals.

Eulogia is happy about the loan and commits herself to complying with her payments.

loans.use: to buy fodder to sell and food supplies for the animals she raises and sells.

loans.name: Leorie

texts.en:
Leorie is 34 years old and married with four children. The oldest child is 12 years old. 

Leorie is a farmer. She grows corn crops and vegetables. Leorie sells her harvest at her town's market. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Leorie works hard to help support her family. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and feed. Leorie hopes to be rich someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with three children. They live in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Marilou and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice and corn crops to sell.

Marilou has requested a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizers and one sack of corn seeds and pay for labor. She hopes to earn better and be able to improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizers and one sack of corn seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Maria Elsi

texts.es:
María, vive en compañía de su esposo, aun no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y refrescos, tiene 20 años de dedicarse al negocio, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 4:00pm, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en materiales para preparar la venta como maíz, chicharrón y quesillo, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para el negocio de María, pues dispondrá de lo necesario para continuar atendiendo a la clientela.
Su objetivo es apoyar a su esposo, brindar un buen servicio a los clientes y generar más ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and they have no children.  She has had a business selling pupusas (a traditional Salvadorean dish based on a thick corn tortilla) and drinks for 20 years.  She works every day from 6am until 4pm.  She started this business on her own initiative.

At this time she requests a loan to invest in ingredients to make her products, such as corn, pork and cheese.  This loan will be a great help for Maria's business, because she will have the inputs she needs to continue serving her customers.  

Her goals are to help her husband, to provide good service to her customers and to generate more earnings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare pupusas: corn, pork  and cheese

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cassava, millet and peanuts

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  El lugar es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos la señora Ana, tiene 25 años de edad y tiene un hijo, y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú), vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y donde trabajo en un laboratorio dental, Yo soy técnica en odontología y trabajo ayudando a elaborar prótesis dentales pero también en mi domicilio en mis horas libres elaboro prótesis para el mismo laboratorio. Tengo algunas máquinas, herramientas y materiales para hacer mis productos”. 

Desde los 18 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Este crédito es para comprar materiales acrílicos.
texts.en:
The “Vamos Juntas” ["Come Together"] communal bank meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco. This area is known for being very touristy and commercial, for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi, and because it is where you can find one of the new seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu. 

This is where Asociación Arariwa met Ms. Ana, who is 25 years old and has one son. She tells Asociación Arariwa:

"I was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and I live in the same city where I was born. I also work here in a dental laboratory. I am a dental technician and I work helping to make dental prostheses. I also work at my house in my free time to make dental prostheses for the same laboratory. I have various machines, tools, and materials to make my products."

Ana has been working in this business since she was 18 years old and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. This loan is for buying acrylic materials.

loans.use: to buy acrylic materials for making dental prostheses

loans.name: Kikweete Mixed Farmers Group

texts.en: Moses wants a loan to set up a photo studio. Moses, age 23,  has been a photographer for the last three years. He is a hardworking man renting a house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Initially he was renting a camera but he now owns one and his desire is to set up a studio since not having a base has been his major challenge in the business. He is a member of Kasongodde Twegatte group where each member guarantees the other to assess a loan.

loans.use: To set up a photo studio

loans.name: Teodomira

texts.es: Tedomira de 41años de edad, convive con víctor de 38 años con quien tiene 5 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Teodomira es una mujer de coraje que después de los desmanes ocasionados, por la violencia política en el Perú, ella decidió no tenerle miedo a nada por que su corazón ahora es tan dura que esta dispuesta a todo por lograr su objetivo.Ella antes de dedicarse a este negocio trabajaba en el área agrícola cultivando cacao y café, donde si obtenía buenas ganancias.Ahora se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores como son cuyes, gallinas y pavos claro que ya no le es tan forzado como el trabajo en el campo, ahora quien se dedica al cultivo de su campo agrícola es su querido esposo, quien en ocasiones también le brinda su apoyo.Teodomira esta feliz con el trabajo que realiza por que es también una fuente por donde capta buenos ingresos, ella debe de a veces de madrugar para repartir las gallinas alas carderías y recreos campestres quienes son sus clientes potenciales.Pues ella al ver que tiene mucha demanda de estos animales por los recreos y restaurant desea incrementar su capital para poder abastecer ese nicho de mercado insatisfecho decide recurrir y solicitar un crédito.Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.Con los 3000 nuevos soles ella comprara mas animales para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Teodomira is 41 years old and lives with Victor, with whom she has 5 children. They live in their own house, located in the district of Pichari. Teodomira is a courageous woman who has decided to not be afraid of anything. Following the disorder caused by political violence in Peru, her heart is so hardened that she is ready to do anything to achieve her goals. Before she had this business, she worked in agriculture, cultivating cacao and coffee, and obtained a good income. 

Now she makes her living selling smaller animals like guinea pigs, chickens and turkeys which clearly is not so physically demanding as working in the fields.  At present, her beloved husband is the one who cultivates the fields; on occasions, he also assists her. Teodomira is pleased with the work that she is doing because it is also a good source of income. Sometimes she must wake up very early to distribute chickens to her prospective clients at rustic retreats and workshops where they card wool. Upon seeing that at retreats and restaurants there is a great demand for these animals, she wanted to increase her capital in order to supply this niche market and therefore came to request a loan. 

This is her second loan through MFP, for which she has confirmed her agreement to punctually pay her account. She will buy more animals for resale with the 3000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for resale.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 55 years old and married, with 6 children.  Adelaida is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines.  Adelaida requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and to repair her piggery cage.

Adelaida has been raising pigs for 3 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  Adelaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and to repair her piggery cage

loans.name: Sari Pertami Group

texts.en:
Sari Pertami group is a new pig farmer group numbering 10 members with a  loan amount of Rp.15,000,000. They are joined in groups to get funding and training from MUK. They receive information about pig groups from the groups in other villages.

Ni Ketut, 42 years old, has two children. The first one is married, and the second is in college. Her husband works as a farmer. In addition to helping her husband as a farmer, Ni Ketut pursues efforts to raise pigs. With the loan she bought two pigs that will be bred. She plans to be a piglet seller. Ni Ketut hopes to be able to fix her house with the profits from raising pigs.

loans.use: To buy two pigs.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 47 years old. She is married and has four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Annabelle is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pig.

Annabelle has been raising pigs for five years. She also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 40 years old, married to Jedida, and they have 4 children. He has been in carpentry for the last 16 years and earns a monthly profit of 28,000 KES.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a group of registered KADET LTD clients. He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD to buy wood and carpentry materials. With the anticipated profits, Martin will save and pay school fees for his children. 

In the future, he hopes to grow his business, and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy wood and carpentry materials

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El Comité " San Cayetano" está conformado por 14  mujeres que residen en la ciudad de Curuguaty, son  mujeres de escasos recursos, pero todas cuentan con una actividad fija, y se reúnen con el objetivo de adquirir el préstamo para invertir en sus respectivas actividades. Se encuentran en el Primer ciclo y están aprendiendo el valor de la comunicación y el trabajo en equipo, reciben capacitación y asesoramiento y aprenden a ahorrar para usos futuros.
Nansy, es una de las integrantes del comité, ella vende todo tipo de lencerías. Comenta que tiene clientes y clientas que siempre compran de ella, lo cual la trae muy buenos ingresos. Ella por medio de este trabajo logra mantener su hogar y también a su familia, por lo que le gustaría poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, por ello solicita el crédito para la compra de lencerías, tanto para hombres como para mujeres con lo cual podrá renovar su stock.
Ella al igual que sus compañeras está muy agradecida con la fundación y Kiva por esta oportunidad
texts.en:
The “San Cayetano” committee has 14 women members living in the city of Curuguaty.  They are women of scarce resources but they all have a steady activity.  They meet with the goal of acquiring a loan to invest in their various activities.  They are in their first cycle and are learning the value of communication and teamwork; they are receiving training and assessment and they are learning how to save for future eventualities.

Nansy is one of the group members; she sells all types of lingerie.  She comments that she has both men and women customers who buy from her which produces good income.  

Through this work she’s able to support her home and her family too so she’d like to continue investing in her business and is asking for a loan to buy lingerie for women and underwear for men to renew her stock.  She, as well as her fellow group members, is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy women's lingerie and men's underwear for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in Uganda's Kampala North region. She is married and has two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. For the last three years, she has worked hard at her business, which consists of selling clothes. To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell, and use the additional income to increase her profits and pay her children's school fees. Her goal for the future is to continue expanding her business. 

Hadijah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Hadijah's prospects by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: Ivania Del Socorro con sus amigas,  Alejandra catalina quien se dedica a vender productos de la Avon, Dora del Carmen  se dedica a la venta de pan y cuajada, Audelis Del Carmen tiene una mini pulpería  su sueño es ampliar mas el negocio, Aurelia Maria se dedica  a la venta de golosinas su objetivo es comprar más producto y mejorar su clientela, Yesenia Marcelina quiere mejorar la venta de cuajada para salir adelante con su familia, Anielka se dedica a la venta de cerdo ella quisiera comprar más concentrado, Vilma Isabel se dedica a la venta de golosina, y pascual Arnulfo se dedica al destace de cerdo. Todas estas personas tienen un objetivo que cumplir para salir adelante. La señora Audeli de 47 años de edad tiene una mini pulpería ella es una persona con mucha cualidades  responsable, honrada con muchas ganas  de trabajar y salir adelante con su negocio. Audelis le gustaría comprar arroz, aceite, maíz, frijoles huevo, fosforo, canela, gas  y detergente y otros,  al por mayor para satisfacer las necesidades de los cliente.
texts.en: Ivania del Socorro is in this group with her friends, Alejandra Catalina, who sells Avon products, Dora del Carmen, who sells bread and curd, Audelis del Carmen, who has a small grocery store and whose dream is to expand her business, Aurelia Maria, who sells candy and whose goal is to buy more products and improve her clientele, Yesenia Marcelina, who wants to improver her sales of curd in order to get ahead with her family, Anielka, who sells pork and who would like to buy in a more concentrated way, Vilma Isabel, who sells candy, and Pascual Arnulfo, who butchers pork.  All of these people have a goal to reach to get ahead.  Forty-seven-year-old Audelis has a small grocery store.  She is a person with a many qualities, she is responsible, honest, and has a great desire to work and get ahead with her business.  Audelis would like to buy rice, oil, corn, beans, eggs, matches, cinnamon, gas, detergent, and other things wholesale in order to meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: rice, oil, corn, beans, eggs, matches, cinnamon, gas, and detergent

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 36-year-old business woman, who lives in Juba. She is married and has 5 children between the ages of 19 and 3. Three of her children go to school. 

Jane runs a food store, and she has been in the business for two years. She has no employees. Jane heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients. She is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase more food items such as tomatoes, green vegetables, onions, and many other products. This business is Jane's only source of income.  

In five years time, Jane likes to hope that her business will grow and she will have a good store only selling food. 

Her major challenges include paying for her children to go to school because the school fees in Juba are expensive.   

Jane says that she is happy at Finance Sudan’s support which is especially aimed at helping women to get capital to start up a business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items such as tomatoes, green vegetables and onions.

loans.name: La Droiture Group

texts.fr:
Mme FANTA est la représentante du groupe LA DROITURE. Elle est  mariée  et mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé  a 18ans et  le moins âgé a 15ans. Tous vont  à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes  en charge.

Elle vend des condiments depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au  marché de pissy en ville. Ses clients sont  les femmes et hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter 03 plats de gombo, 02kg de poisson sec, 03 plats d’arachide pour la fabrication de la patte d’arachide, 01 sac de savon kabakourou et 01 sac de savon citec.

 Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
Mme FANTA is the representative of the group called LA DROITURE. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 18 and the youngest is 15 years of age. She is responsible for five persons.  

She has been selling condiments for six years. She buys her merchandise at the Pissy market in town. Her customers are women and men.  

She wants to buy three trays of okra, 2 kg of dried fish, 3 trays of peanuts to use for making peanut butter, 1 sack of "Kabakourou" soap and one sack of "Citec" soap. 

 Mme Fanta uses her profit to help cover the cost of school fees for her children. Her ambition is to own a shop.

loans.use: to buy okra, dried fish, peanuts for peanut butter, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Aleyda

texts.es: Aleyda, de 34 años, es una mujer buena y amable, esta casada y es madre de cuatro hijos, quienes aún son menores y dependen de ellos para su educación y alimentación, ellos viven en una casa propia desde donde todos los días salen a trabajar para así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Aleyda consiste en la compra y venta de pescado, y lo hace de manera ambulante, distribuye a sus caseros su producto, el cual compra a precios muy cómodos. Ella tiene muchos clientes, ya que vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso y es una vendedora muy alegre, que siempre saca a sus clientes una sonrisa. Cuando se inicio en este negocio tenía muchas dificultades en encontrar el pescado adecuado o el producto que este en mejores condiciones, pero con el tiempo aprendió, tanto así que ahora es una de las mejores vendedoras de la zona. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientas y bromear entre ellas, lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es soportar el intenso olor que sale de los pescados, ya que éste se le pega en la ropa y prácticamente tiene que soportarlo todo el día. Espera tener en el futuro un pequeño frigorífico donde pueda vender sus pescado sin temor a que se malogren con el calor del sol. Este será el préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal en donde la quieren mucho por que es muy responsable y solidaria. Espera que le puedan brindar el préstamo que será un respaldo para ella y seguir aumentando su negocio, esta convencida que seguirá siendo una socia muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como todos los prestamos que tuvo hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará más productos (pescados de todo tipo) para ofrecer en mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Aleyda  is 34 years old.  She is a good, friendly woman.  She is married and the mother of four children who are still minors and depend on her for their education and sustenance.  They live in their own house and every day she goes to work in order to give her family a better quality of life.  

Aleyda buys and sells fish as a street vendor for a living.  She delivers her products, which she purchases at affordable prices, to people's homes.  She has many customers since she sells the freshest fish and she is a cheerful saleswoman who always greets her customers with a smile.  When she started this business it was very difficult for her to find suitable fish or a product that was in good condition.  She has learned a lot over time and now she is one of the best vendors in the region.  

Conversing and joking with her customers is what she likes most about her job.  She has been doing this for 14 years and she considers the odor from the fish the most difficult thing to bear as it sticks to her clothes and she has to bear it most of the day.  In the future, she hopes to have a small refrigerator from which she can sell her fish without fear that it will go bad in the heat of the sun. 

This will be her 13th loan with MFP.  She has always been a good member of her communal bank where they love her very much because she is very responsible and supportive.  She hopes that she will get this loan which will be backing for her and she will be able to continue growing her business.  She believes that she will continue being a very punctual member and will make her payments on time like she did with all her previous loans.  

With the 1500 soles [Peruvian currency] requested she will buy more products (all types of fish) so she can offer her customers more variety.

loans.use: purchase a diverse variety of fish.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 31 años de edad esta casada con el señor Ezequiel y tiene 3 hijos pequeños, desde hace un poco mas de 3 años se dedica a  cultivar aguacate en su comunidad ya que su papa le heredo un terreno amplio y ella decidió ponerse a trabajar para sacar ganancias para el futuro de sus hijos, ella dice “en esta época para vivir mas o menos las parejas tenemos que trabajar para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a nuestros hijos ya que no alcanza si nada mas trabaja el esposo, es por eso que quiero salir adelante con mi familia para vivir mejor”. Irma  esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de árboles de aguacate,  abonos orgánicos, calidra para que no le caiga plagas a los arboles y fertilizantes orgánicos para no dañar la tierra. Dice que cuando no es temporada de cosecha se pone hacer artesanía de Ocoshal y la saca a vender a centros turísticos de su estado. La meta que tiene Irma es seguir invirtiéndole en el negocio del aguacate ya que si deja un poco mas de ganancias que la venta de la artesanía.
texts.en:
Irma is 31 years old, married to Ezequiel, and has three small children. She was worked farming avocados for a little more than three years on a big plot of land she inherited from her father. She decided to begin working to earn money for her children's future. She says "at this time, in order to live, both spouses have to work in order to give a better quality of life to our children. It's not enough if just the husband works, and I want to help my family get ahead and live better."

Irma is asking for a loan to buy avocado trees, Calidra, to protect the trees from plagues, and organic fertilizers that will not harm the land. She says when it is not harvest season she works making Ocoshal handicrafts to sell at tourist shops in her state. Irma's goal is to keep investing in her avocado business since it provides a little more profit than selling handicrafts.

loans.use: buy avocado trees, Calidra (to prevent plagues), and organic fertilizer so as not to harm the land

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 51 year old woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to help pay for home improvements. With her last loan she purchased new furniture and now is planning on repainting her home. In the future she would like to expand her house. Her dream is to buy a family home. Iman prefers that her photo is not on the internet; the photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Hiam

texts.en: Hiam is a 38-year-old, married woman who has 5 family members from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,200 JOD to buy clothes and blankets to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same of area she wants to expand her project. In the future, she hopes to open a project and to buy a home for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and blankets to resell

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance has operated a poultry selling business for the past years, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of inadequate working capital and stiff competition. Her dream is to establish a boutique in the near future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase poultry feed and add more chicken to sell. She decided to join Yehu because of favorable loaning procedures, and she appreciates the previous Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and add more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 31-years-old student living with her mother and 9-years-old daughter. 
Lilit started her education two years ago in Accounting and Audit department. 
Besides studies, she also works at military unit as a cellphone operator. Lilit works day and night to manage her studies, work and also take care of her school aged daughter Lusine. The requested loan will greatly help Lilit to pay for her university tuition and continue her studies. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her and change her life for the better. Lilit strongly believes that her career as an accountant is the right place for her future, and it will help her to find a job by her profession and make her family's life better.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition to pursue her studying as Accountant

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel lives in Tampico, Tamaulipas and she is married and has two children. One of her kids is married but her daughter, a beautiful girl, works with her mom in the making of fashion jewelery. Their business has allowed them to cover the basic family living expenses. Isabel comments that every day she gains more clients and her earnings in crease, but she cannot meet the increase in demand, for which she requires $925USD. She needs to buy more merchandise to meet the high demand, especially during this time of year.

You can help Isabel and her daughter keep working and their business growing. They thank you for your support and caring.

Translated by Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

Isabel vive en Tampico Tamaulipas tiene una familia de 2 hijos; uno de ellos esta casado pero la otra es una hermosa hija la cual trabaja con su mamá en la elaboración de productos de joyería de fantasía. Este trabajo les ha permitido cubrir con los gastos básicos de la familia y los personales. Isabel comenta que cada día sus clientes están aumentando así como sus ingresos, sin embargo ya no tiene la capacidad económica para hacer frente al incremento de su demanda por lo que requiere de $925 USD para la compra de mercancía que le permita atender la alta demanda que se le presenta en esta temporada navideña porque Isabel no quiere dejar pasar la oportunidad de generar mayores ingresos.

Tú puedes apoyar a Isabel y a su hija para que sigan trabajando y sigan creciendo en su negocio. Ellas agradecen tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase raw material and merchandise.

loans.name: Brictor

texts.en:
Brictor is about 65, married with eleven children, five of them still in school. She is a peasant with no formal training but has experience in guidance and counseling. She is also an active member of a community-based organization: Korisai.

Brictor is a very active member of Jairos Muungano Self-Help Group, registered with PEMCI. Her 1st loan of $150 was repaid in a timely fashion. With the 2nd loan she has applied for, she plans to increase the stock in her business so as to improve her income levels. With her fish mongering business, she is able to supplement the food of the local community whose diets mainly consist of carbohydrates (sorghum and cassava).

At her age, Brictor is a good role model to the rest of the women who should be engaged economically.

loans.use: Fishmonger/Shopkeeper

loans.name: Saroh

texts.en: Saroh  is 32 years old and married with two children. Saroh and her husband Embang grow rice on a farm. They harvest their crop once every 4 months, earning about $120. Saroh needs a loan of $50 to buy more seeds and fertilizer to raise her family's income. She really wants to have more income to pay for her children's education and to give them a better life than the one she had growing up.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly's parents-in-law are very old (77&78 years old); their son and Ly are farmers who grow green dragon plants (for fruit) and vegetables. Their average income is $11 per month per person. Ly wants to borrow $ 75 to raise rabbits so as to get more income from their farming venture. She plans to repay the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: raising rabbits

loans.name: Ni Luh Kerti

texts.id:
In addition to her daily work as a farmer at a field, Luh Kersi also has side business at home by growing up 4 pigs.

The working capital loan from DINARI will be used to buy pig feed which will be used to feed the pigs twice a day. The daily feeding cost is Rp 20,000 (US$ 2).

In the next 6 month period, the pigs will be ready to be sold for Rp 5,200,000 (US$ 547), minus all of the related expenses of Rp 3,600,000 (US$ 379), she will get a net profit of Rp 1,600,000 (US$ 168).

With this money Luh Kersi will be able to put her 2 children to school. She needs a lot of money as one of her child has graduated from highschool and now is entering to the university.

In addition to that she will be also to use part of the profit for her family's daily needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Selain sebagai seorang petani yang setiap hari bekerja di ladang Luh Kersi juga memiliki kesibukan di rumahnya yaitu memelihara babi penggemukan sebanyak 4 ekor. Modal yang diperoleh dari DINARI dipergunakan untuk membeli pakan seperti; dedak, konsentrat dan jagung, yang setiap harinya diberikan kepada ternak sebanyak 2 kali yang mengeluarkan biaya perhari Rp.20,000,-. Selain Konsentrat juga diberikan makanan selingan berupa hijauan seperti batang pisang dan daun talas yang sudah direbus dan dicampur dengan dedak. Dalam jangka waktu 6 bulan babi sudah siap untuk dijual dengan pendapatan kotor Rp.5.200.000,- dikurangi pengeluaran per panen sebesar Rp.3.600.000,- jadi pendapatan bersih yang diperoleh Luh kersi sebesar Rp.1,600,000,-.dari hasil ini Luh Kersi bisa menyekolahkan 2 anaknya yang memerlukan biaya yang cukup banyak karena 1 anaknya sudah tamat SMU dan akan melanjutkan ke perguruan tinggi disamping itu untuk membantu keperluan rumah tangganya.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Huy

texts.en: Mrs. Huy S., aged 26, is employed at a garment factory, making on average $3 each day. Her husband is a broker purchasing and selling fruit, making around $4 each day. They have one child who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase more fruit to expand the inventory of their family's fruit stand. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy a motor-bike to transport the fruit to a market.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to expand their fruit stand.

loans.name: Yolanda Elsa

texts.es:
Yolanda Elsa is 44 years old. She completed 5th grade and has 8 children, only 5 of which still live with her. She lives in the district of Mache, in the Otuzco province, in the state of La Libertad. In Mache she has her own little farm in which she grows wheat, barely, and dry potato. She also raises swine, cattle, goats, chicken, ducks, and guinea pigs which she sells in the market.

Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank of Progressives. She obtained her first credit from them for S/. 300.00 ($100.00) and purchased pigs to raise and sell at a higher price. With this loan of S/. 1,100.00 ($400.00), which will be repaid in 4 months, Yolanda intends to purchase small cows and the food that they will need.

As a small child Yolanda learned from her parents how to manage a farm, and she has dedicated herself to a farming life ever since. As an adult she incorporated the idea of raising animals and selling them at the fair in Mache. Little by little the profits from this project have added up and with the loans received she has been able to purchase additional animals and larger animals.

Yolanda is a member of the communal kitchen “Maria’s Heart.” Her dream is to own her own home in the center of the district of Mache.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yolanda Elsa tiene 44 años de edad, estudió hasta el quinto grado de primaria, tiene 8 hijos, pero sólo 5 hijos dependen de ella, vive en el distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco departamento La Libertad. En este lugar tiene su chacra donde siembra trigo, cebada, papa seca, también compra cerdos, reses y carneros para volver a vender en el camal, además cría animales menores como gallinas, cuyes y patos.

La señora Yolanda pertenece al banco comunal “Progresistas”. Con el primer crédito que obtuvo de S/.300.00 compró cerdos para engordarlos por cierto tiempo y sacarle mayor precio. Con el préstamo de S/.1,100.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará reses pequeñas y el alimento que estas necesitan.

Desde pequeña la señora Yolanda se ha dedicado a la siembra gracias a que sus padres le enseñaron como hacerlo. Cuando ya era mayor tuvo la idea de criar animales menores para venderlos en la feria de Mache y poco a poco con las ganancias que recolectaba y con los créditos que recibía compraba mas animales menores y a la vez unos cuantos de mayor peso.

La señora Yolanda es socia del comedor popular “Corazón de Maria”. Su mayor sueño es tener su propia casa en el centro del distrito de Mache.

loans.use: Purchase of animals and food to raise them on.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity O. is 38 years old, married with 5 children, she hails from Iba in Lagos State. She is a fashion designer. She learnt her trade in 3 years. She has been in business for 4 years. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more cloth for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for sale

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Having grown up around an agricultural land and stock farm has enable Betty to obtain the necessary skills to perform successfully in this business. For now, and before having had a baby, she worked on her father's corn and barley farms. Her intention is to increase the quality and quantity of her products so as to increase her revenue and establish her own stock farm closer to her home. For this reason she asks for a loan. Your important support will help contribute to the realization of this dream in due time.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Haber nacido en una tierra agrícola y ganadera han hecho que Betty, obtenga los conocimientos necesarios para desempeñarse con éxito en estas labores, por ahora y después de haber tenido un bebé, se desempeña en los cultivos de papa, maíz y cebada; con el objetivo de incrementar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos a fin de acrecentar sus ingresos para establecer una espacio ganadero cerca de su hogar, solicita un préstamo.Tu importante ayuda colaborará con el cumplimiento de este noble anhelo a mediano plazo.

loans.use: To invest capital to increase the quality and quantity of her products

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
My name is Mussarat A., I am married and a mother of seven children. I reside with my family in Raiwind, Pakistan where all my children attend a nearby school. Both my husband and I work, he runs a salon, while I am a health worker. I received one year training on health services under the government health programme. My husband would like to expand his business, thus we required a loan to buy more items for his salon.

My group has four other women who also require loans to expand their businesses: Zareen F. sells cloth; Koser S. needs to expand their restaurant; Rubina B. wants to buy wood and Kalsoom B. would like to start a fruit-selling business.

loans.use: Expand beauty salon

loans.name: Kakeda Sun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirty five members have formed a group in ChrO. OmpE. Village in Kandal Province with  Ms. Kakeda S. as the Village Bank President. She is 25-years-old and a single woman in the village. Last year, Ms. Kakeda S. got appendicitis and she spent $300 to cure herself. 

She is a scarf weaver, a profession she learned from her mother. Her business is doing very well and she would like to increase her scarf inventory by purchasing additional thread.

loans.use: To obtain a loan to purchase  more thread to weave scarves

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru:
Tohir Q. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is a middle school teacher, and has been working for many years, but his salary is so small that he must make extra money on the side. He has been working in retail sales for seven years. His business helps him support his family – he is married with two children. He would like to expand the range of goods at his market stall, to increase his customer base and make needed goods available in this area, which is far from the city. To do this he decided to get a loan, which he will repay over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Кайнаров Тохир житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Учитель в средней школе. Работает уже много лет , но заработная плата очень маленькая , поэтому ему приходится подрабатывать. Уже семь лет . как он занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. И этот бизнес помогает ему обеспечивать свою семью. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Хочет завести на свою торговую точку другой ассортимент товара, для того , чтобы увеличить количество клиентов , а так же обеспечить рынок дальнего от города района наобходимыми товарами. Для этого он запланировал получить кредит , погасить который планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase range of goods

loans.name: Solidaridad Y Union Group

texts.es:
Hello, our group is called “Solidaridad y Union” (solidarity and union). Our group’s characteristic is that we are truly united and we are all responsible with our payments, meaning that we are on time with our payments. This is the second loan we request.

We have been working as a group for five years, during this time we have been able to get organized and form our own businesses, in which we do very well. We make lollipops, jelly, "flan" (cream caramel), candy, etc. We make desserts. One of us goes out to sell and the rest stay at home because we also have clients come to the houses to buy our products. Thanks to the first loan we were able to grow our businesses. At this time the sales are high and we can’t keep up with the demand, this is why we need your help, so that we can make our businesses grow more and this way meet the needs of our clients. Thanks to this activity we have been able to get our families ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

hola nuestro grupo se llama Silidaridad y Union, la cualidad de nuestro grupo es que somos bien unidas y todas somos resposables en nuestros pagos es decir que somo puntuales en nuestros pagos, este es el segundo credito que estamos solicitando.

tenemos cinco años de trabajar como grupo, en estos años hemos podido organizarnos para crear nuestros propios negocios en los cuales nos va muy bien, nosotras nos dedicamos a elaborar paletas, gelatinas, flanes, dulces etc, todo lo que hacemos son postres, unas de nosotros sale a la calle a vender nuestos productos y otras se quedan en las casas porque ahi tambien llegan muchos de nuestros clientes a comprar nuestros productos, gracias a la primer ayuda logramos hacer crecer nuestros negocios, pero en este momento las ventas son bastantes y no nos damos abasto para tener la demanda de nuestros productos, por tal razon estamos solicitando nos ayuden una vez mas para poder hacer crecer mas nuestos negocios y asi poder cumplir con las necesidades de nuestros clientes. gracias a estas actividades hemos logrado salir adelante con nuestras familias.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make desserts

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Thouk K., 54, is a widow with two daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives outside the family home, and the other one is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Thouk is a cook for workers in a construction company that operates near her village. Her daughter doesn't have a vehicle to get to work in Phnom Penh. Therefore Thouk is requesting a loan of US$300 to add to her own money and use to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To help buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work

loans.name: Agbéi

texts.fr:
Née à Nada en 1970, madame G. est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle n’a pas fréquenté et n’a appris métier spécifique. Elle a quand même appris à se battre dans la vie. Son mari étant chauffeur, elle en profite pour sillonner les villages pour acheter du charbon de bois et du céréale auprès des fermiers qu’elle revend dans la ville de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1991.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock de. et de céréales tels que 2 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs de haricots, un sac de mil et 14 sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en:
Born in Nada in 1970, Mrs. G. is married and the mother of 3 children. She was not able to attend school nor to learn a specific trade. She has however learned how to make her way through life successfully. Since her husband is a chauffeur, she takes advantage of the opportunity to travel through the villages buying up charcoal and cereals from the farmers, goods she re-sells in the city of Lomé. She began this business in 1991.

She is asking for this, her first loan to increase her stocks of charcoal and cereals by buying 2 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of dried beans, 1 sack of millet, and 14 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals and charcoal

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie A. F., 37, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the tomatoes, cabbages, and cucumber business. She sells to the villagers and the public 7 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Jessie's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to purchase chemicals, pesticides, vegetable seeds, a spade and a shovel in order to make her vegetable farm more reliable.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, pesticides, vegetable seeds, spade and shovel

loans.name: Darren's Group
loans.use: D

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel R. is 41 years old. He is married and the father of five children. He is a carpenter. He makes and repairs home and office furniture (e.g. tables, chairs, beds, wardrobes, etc.)

He is applying for a loan of two hundred thousand Rwandan francs (200,000 Rwf) which will enable him to add to his stock of wood. This will enable him to satisfy demand easily. Mr R. encounters some difficulties with not being able to satisfy demand for his goods and with customers who delay payment.

This is the first time he is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company s.a. He says that once he gets this loan he will make profit and pay the school fees of his children and improve the welfare of the family.

He is seen by the community as a hard-working and a trustworthy man. He wants to see his business flourish and have a positive social impact on the neighborhood. For instance he feels happy when he sees that he has hired four employees so far.

loans.use: To increase his stock of wood

loans.name: Florencia Corina

texts.es:
La señora Corina es socia del Banco Comunal "Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo" del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 74 años de edad, es casada y se encarga de apoyar a sus nietos que están en edad escolar.

Con el primer préstamo que recibió aumentó su capital y mejoró su local para atender mejor a sus clientes. Tiene casi 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que su esposo es una persona discapacitada y que ella se encarga de él con mucha dedicación.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, pintará su restaurante, comprará mesas e insumos para mejorar sus ventas durante las fiestas de navidad.

Corina desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su esposo y a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Ms. Corina is a member of the Village Bank "Women United to Triumph" in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 74 years old, married and in charge of her school-aged grandchildren. With the first loan she received, Corina increased the amount of capital in her business and improved the condition of her restaurant in order to better serve her clients. Corina has been working with the village bank for four years and tells us that her husband is handicapped and that she cares for him with great dedication. With this loan of 3000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will paint the restaurant, buy tables and other goods to improve her sales during the holiday season. Corina wishes to continue working to support her husband and grandchildren.
