Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and products for the restaurant

loans.name: Lizer

texts.en:
Lizer M. owns a chemist shop in Likoni neighborhood of Mombasa, Kenya. She bought the business from its owner after being an employee in the shop. Lizer had seen the profitability of the shop while she worked there – when she had the opportunity to purchase the business, she took it and has been working to expand it ever since.

The shop sells medicines and cosmetics and also has a photocopier. Lizer purchases the medicines in Mombasa town and restocks her supplies weekly. She says that she makes a profit of about 25,000 KSH each month. This figure used to be higher, but went down due to post-election violence in Kenya. Lizer says that her profits are slowly going back up to where they were before the elections last year. 

Lizer has applied for a loan of approximately 275 USD in order to purchase more supplies of medicines and to repair the photocopier in the shop. This will be her first loan with K-MET.

Lizer is 26, single, and has two children who are both in school. She has plans to expand the chemist’s shop and hopes to open a second shop sometime in the future.

loans.use: Expansion of Chemist and Cosmetic Shop

loans.name: Razia M. Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Razia Baji is a 36-year-old married lady and has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 25 years. 'My husband's name is M. R., an animal seller for the past 10 years. He buys animals from the famous animal market of Multan and sells them to the different butcher shops.' Razia Baji has three kids: one son and two daughters. All of her kids are getting an education from the school which located near their house. Razia Baji shares the financial burden of her husband by doing embroidery on dresses. She gets orders from her neighbors and charges $3 for per embroidered dress. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more livestock (goats and sheep) to sell.

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Mubarak Baji and Manzooran Mai Baji and Shamim Baji each want a loan to buy buffalo for their milk selling businesses. Zafran Baji wants a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga is married with two children. She sells mill cakes, animal food, sunflower oil and other similar products at the local market in Pavlograd. Olga has been in this business for 9 years. When she started the business, the competition was low. During this time it has not changed. Today there are only 2 or 3 other people that sell similar products at the market. This business is the only source of income for Olga’s family. Olga would like to get a loan of 7,500 UAH to purchase 90 bags of mill cakes. Her business goal is to buy a small truck so she can transport her supplies.

loans.use: to purchase 90 bags of mill cakes for resale

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna es una mujer muy cariñosa y dedicada a su familia, tiene 29 años y vive en una casa alquilada, junto a sus 3 hijos, Sonia de 11, Deysi 4 y Fernando de 1 año, desea verlos profesionales y siendo útiles a la sociedad. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de habas saladas, gracias a este negocio ha podido darle a su familia el sustento económico que necesitan para vivir, vende de manera ambulatoria por la calles de Juliaca, su producto es muy delicioso por eso es vendido rápidamente. Ella sale a vender junto al más pequeño de sus hijos, a quien cuida con mucho cariño y amor, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede decidir en qué momentos trabajar y en qué momentos dedicarse a las tareas del hogar, esa libertada le ha dado la facilidad necesaria para cuidar bien a su familia. Lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es caminar todo el día, puesto que el clima no siempre es el más favorable. Reyna quiere comprar una carretilla donde pueda vender sus habas saladas y otros productos más; como maní, papas fritas, etc., ya que sabe que si trabaja duro podrá salir adelante por el bienestar de sus hijos. Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, tiene muchas ganas de pagarlo a tiempo y sin demora, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su banco comunal es muy tranquila, pero siempre participa en las decisiones se que toman entre todas las socias. Con los quinientos soles que solicita incrementará su capital de trabajo, y podrá comprar más ingredientes para preparar sus habas saladas y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Reyna is 29 years old. She is affectionate and dedicated to her family. She lives in a rented house with her three children; Sonia 11, Deysi 4, and Fernando 1. She wishes to see them become professionals and useful members of society. She prepares and sells salted beans. Thanks to this business she has been able to provide for her family. She sells on the streets of Juliaca. Her product is delicious and sells quickly. She takes her youngest, who she takes care of with much affection and love, with her. What she likes best about her work is that she can decide when to do her business work and when to do housework. This freedom has allowed her to take good care of her family. She has been doing this for 13 years. What she likes the least is walking all day because the weather is not always good. Rayna wants to buy a cart where she could sell her salted beans and other products like; peanuts, French fries, etc. She knows that if she works hard she can get ahead for the good of her children. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to paying it back on time without fail. She would like to be able to have more loans. She is very quiet, but she always participates in the decisions of her community bank. With the 500 PEN she will increase her working capital. She will buy more ingredients to make her salted beans and improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients for the preparation of her salted beans

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru: Мунавар - женщина ,которая является заёмщицей в Микроинвест с 2005 года.Она торгует на центральном рынкегорода Худжанда "панчшанбе".Она продаёт различные конфеты и печенья.В начале своей кредитной истории Мунавар привозила товар с Истаравшана, а на сегодня она завозит уже с Бишкека.Т.к. её позволяет её получаемая прибыль, которую она получает со своего бизнеса.Она благодарна кредитам,при помощи которых она смогла расширить свой бизнес.На следующий кредит она планирует съездить ещё за товаром в Бишкек.
texts.en:
Munavar is a woman who has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005. She sells on the central market of town of Khudjand "panchshabe." She sells different types of candy and cookies. In the beginning of her credit history Munavar was bringing the merchandise in from Istaravshan. Today she brings it from Bishkek as the profit which she makes from her business allows it. She is grateful to all the lenders with whose help she was able to expand her business. She plans to use her next loan to travel to Bishkek for more merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Продажа кондитерских товаров.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa B. T. tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña María tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña María es la venta de ropa nueva y usada. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación del negocio de María es en las afueras del mercado, y desde muy pequeña comenzó a vender por su propia cuenta y con muchos sacrificios ha salido adelante con su negocio.  Debido a la difícil situación económica su propósito es de invertir cada día en productos que sus clientes solicitan. María  tiene 7 financiamientos con Fundación León 2000 y es por medio de esta microfinancieras que recibe el apoyo de las organizaciones amigas y el record crediticio es muy bueno. El financiamiento es solicitado solamente para capital de trabajo para comprar ropa nueva y usada. María sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda y el día de mañana sus hijos tengan un lugar humilde para vivir.
texts.en:
María Teresa B. T. is 44, single, and has 3 children who attend school. For over 20 years María has been selling new and used clothes. Her business is located outside the market. She started selling on her own when she was very little. Through much sacrifice she has gotten ahead in her business. Due to difficult economic times, she plans to invest every day in the products her customers ask for. María has had 7 loans with Fundación León 200. She has received support from friendly organizations via this micro financier. Her credit history is very good. The loan is solely for working capital to buy new and used clothes. María dreams of making improvements on her home so that in the future her children will have a humble place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice J. is currently selling clothes and is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.  She is 33 years old, married and has four children whom all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a sewing machine.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy more clothes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, a sus 50 años, tiene en anhelo de seguir trabajando en beneficio a sus seres queridos, que son sus dos hijos y su esposo, quien tuvo que salir fuera de la ciudad para trabajar dejándola como cabeza del hogar. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a elaborar diversas prendas de vestir, las cuales diseña según los modelos que observa en catálogos y revistas para hacer un trabajo novedoso que llame la atención de las personas. Esta actividad le demanda de mucha creatividad y rapidez, debido a los pedidos que le hacen constantemente, por lo que trata de agilizar su labor trabajando hasta altas horas de la noche, lo cual ha llegado afectarle la vista por el esfuerzo que realiza, pero esto no es una barrera que pueda detenerla, por el contrario la motivó a proyectarse a nuevas formas de seguir trabajando, siendo una de ellas las compra de una máquina de coser que le ayude agilizar y mejorar su labor. Para un futuro cercano, Carmen desea instalar una tienda de abarrotes, pues está convencida que con el paso de los años no podrá seguir trabajando en la costura y desea tener un negocio el cual cubra los gastos en su vejez. Este es su quinto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, en el tiempo que viene trabajando con su banco comunal ha sabido compatibilizar con sus compañeras, y unánimes tratan de realizar las actividades que lleven al progreso a todo el grupo. Los 1000 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de lana para elaborar chompas, pues ya tiene varios pedidos a medida que se acerca el invierno.
texts.en:
Carmen, at 50 years old, wishes to continue working to benefit her loved ones, who are her two sons and her husband. Her husband had to leave the city to work, leaving her as the head of household. For the past 20 years she has made a variety of clothing items, which she designs according to models that she sees in catalogs and magazines, to make her clothing something new that attracts people’s attention. This activity requires a lot of creativity and speed, due to the orders that she is constantly receiving. She tries to speed up her work until late at night, which has begun to affect her vision because of the effort that she makes. However, this is not enough to stop her; on the contrary, this motivated her to find new ways to keep on working, one of them being the purchase of a sewing machine that helps her speed up and improve her work. In the near future Carmen would like to open a general store because she is convinced that over the coming years she will not longer be able to work as a seamstress and she would like to have a business that can cover her expenses during old age. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. In the time that she has been working with her communal bank she has been compatible with the other members, and together they try to do activities that will bring progress to everyone in the group. The 1,000 soles that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of wool for jackets as she has various orders because winter is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool to make jackets

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Донияров Махмуджон- мужчина 1975-го года рождения, женат, детей пока не имеет.Он работает сварщиком в техстанции.Но этих денег недостаточно,  чтобы накопить на покупку дома.Поэтому вот уже больше шести лет он вместе со своим отцом занимается откормком скота.На полученный кредит Махмуджон решил купить молодых  бычков и перепродать их по хорошей цене осенью. Махмуджон благодарен КИВА за поддержку его бизнеса
texts.en:
Born in 1975, Mahmudjon D. is married and does not yet have children. He works as a welder at a service station. But this money is not enough to save for a house. This is why, Mahmudjon, together with his father, has been involved in livestock feeding for over six years. He decided to use this loan to buy young bulls and resell them at a good price in the autumn. Mahmudjon is grateful to Kiva for supporting his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Marysol

texts.en:
Marysol B. owns and operates a specialized retail business selling cellphone load in her community. She is 33 years old, married and has two small children. They are from the village of Brgy. Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin. Marysol has been in this business for over ten years. She earns approximately 3,360 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marysol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marysol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marysol is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her house.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a cellphone load business

loans.name: Maqbol Group

texts.en:
Maqbol is the group leader of Maqbol group. There are four members in this group and each of them wants to take a loan to progress their business and make it larger. So they are requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani.

Faridon wants to take a loan for his business as a butcher.

Sarder M. wants to take a loan for his shop selling fruits and vegetables.

Bibi Saeb wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.

They are very happy with this process of loans in Afghanistan and around the world.

loans.use: To progress their businesses

loans.name: Loetitia

texts.en:
Loetitia is married and has one girl, who is 19 months old.  She lives with her family in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin.  She sells a variety of products , including cosmetics, fabrics, hairstreaks, shoes, and jewelry.   Loetitia is also a talented seamstress; she makes beautiful African clothing that is sold in Italy.  

Loetitia sells her products from her home.  As seen in her picture, she has a large sign that she displays outside to advertise for her business.  Her clients order at her home and she delivers the products when they are available.  Loetitia buys her goods in Togo and Nigeria, two countries that surround Benin.  She is thankful that she has loyal clients who always pay her on time.  

Loetitia has been involved in this business activity for four years.  She is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin, in order to buy more beauty products and to increase her sales.  Loetitia hopes to someday have her own boutique in which to sell her goods.

loans.use: Beauty Products

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: La señora Rosa Amelia de 53 años de edad mujer emprendedora que formalizo su negocio hace 16 años en la elaboración de tazas, platos, Valdez y otros de plásticos, ella inicio con ahorros y prestamos para comprar todo las maquinaria para su elaboración. Reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, con tres hijos, de 12,15 y20 años de edad, los cuales estudian y apoyan junto con su esposo a elaborar las bonitas tazas de la familias Nicaragüenses, sus planes es poder seguir aumentando de inventario, tecnificarlo para producir a escala. Con este préstamo es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual invertirá en compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, golosos, clavos y otros para entechar el local donde trabaja para mejorar las condiciones laborales. Da las gracias a la institución por los logros adquiridos y por los beneficios que ah otorgado a su familia como a su empresa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Amelia is 53 years old. She is a very enterprising woman and 16 years ago started a business to make plastic cups, dishes, pails and other household items. She started the business with savings and loans, which she used to buy the equipment needed for the manufacture of these items. She lives in Managua, Nicaragua’s capital, in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte with her three children, ages 12, 15 and 20. The children attend school and, along with her husband, also help manufacture the pretty cups used by families in Nicaragua. Eventually, she would like to increase her inventory and introduce technology that will allow production on a large scale. This is the fourth loan she has secured from Afodenic. She will invest it to buy construction materials, such as corrugated iron, beams and nails to put a roof on the building where she works and improve working conditions there. She thanks the institution for the progress she has made and for the benefits afforded to her family and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corrugated iron, beams and nails to put a roof on the building

loans.name: Ladislao Domingo

texts.es: Don domingo  de 55 años de edad casado con sies hijos  con residencia final de la zona uno Totonicapan actualmente tiene dos fuentes de ingreso uno como talabartero y la otra como albañil, el cuenta que tiene su pequeño taller de calzado en donde los clientes lo busca para  arreglar su calzado como una reparacion, necesita un poco de capital para la compra de materiales para calzado como lo demuestra la fotografia.

loans.use: Compra de Materiales

loans.name: Lemilda

texts.en:
Lemilda A. is 41 years old and married to Renato A., who is a 46 year-old tinsmith. They have seven children ranging in age from 6 to 18 years old, who are all going to school. The family lives in the village of Brgy. Rafaela Barrera, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Lemilda and her husband dream of sending their children to school and when they finish their studies, be gainfully employed in a stable job in the future. That’s why the couple strive so hard to achieve their dreams for their children.

Before she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, she and her husband already owned a tin shop because her husband was a skilled tinsmith. They made knives, tongs, different kitchen tools and farm equipment. Lemilda assisted her husband in producing some of the products, but she did most of the selling and managed the business. When demand for their products reached a critical point where they needed capital infusion so they could take it to the next level, Lemilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so she could borrow the capital to buy more materials to make more products to sell. With the additional capital, their income also increased and because she paid all of the installments on time and paid off the loans within its loan term, Lemilda was able to maintain a good credit record, and still earn an average net income of PHP 15,000 per month.

From the time she and her husband started the business 22 years ago, she has seen a big improvement to it, especially after she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon. To continue the momentum of her business, she borrowed PHP 19,500 on her previous loan to use as revolving working capital for her tin shop. Now she is borrowing the same amount again so that she will have enough working capital to continue buying the necessary materials for the production of the tools and farm equipment that they make and sell to earn their living.

Limilda and her husband Renato are shown in the picture in their tin shop.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase materials for their tin shop

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Насруллоев Сафарали проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 45 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Дети несовершеннолетние. Сам Сафарали более 12 лет работает в местной таможне. Кредит просит для закупа скота, т.к. он более 16 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот.
texts.en:
N. Safarali lives in the Kurgan-Tube region. He is 45 years old. He is married and has four children. His children are teenagers. Safarali works in the local customs for more than twelve years. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle as he has also been doing animal husbandry for more than sixteen years. He feeds and sells cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. sees her children as her inspiration thus she really works hard for their welfare. Furthermore, her husband Mario motivates her to become successful in her business. Their family happily lives at the village of Culalabat, Cauayan City. Marites proudly shared that their family has a bounded and harmonious relationship.

With regard to her business, Marites has been engaged in hog raising for almost three years now. She sells her raised animals every four months and she earns a net income of Php 3,000. She plans to utilize the income for their basic needs as well as for the education of their children. Wanting to purchase feed for her pigs and fertilizer for their rice farm, Marites decided to take out a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to Php 6,000. Marites is very optimistic that lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: Hog feed and pig pen and to purchase some fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her projects in business. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She would like to get a loan of N 150,000 to purchase more groceries for sale. Felicia is 29 years old and married to Mr. O., who is a commercial bike rider. She is an LAPO client. She says thanks you to all lenders for the support.

loans.use: purchasing more groceries to sell

loans.name: Orpha Nyanchama

texts.en:
Orpha Nyanchama M. sells cereals including millet and maize to locals in Keroka, a village outside Kisii. Her business challenges are drought and poor harvests. Orpha will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy ten bags of maize. Her goal in life is to have a larger cereals store.

Orpha is married and has two sons and two daughters. She describes herself as social and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy ten bags of maize

loans.name: Nitty

texts.en:
58-year-old Nitty is a married woman with one child. She is a rice farmer. She helps her husband till their land. When her husband is not too busy on the farm, he uses a motorcycle to transport people around the community. The income her husband gets provides for her family’s daily needs.

Nitty needs additional capital for her farm, which she cannot provide right now. She has applied to CEVI and requested a loan of PHP 9, 000. This loan will be used for seeds, fertilizers and other farm implements.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun P., 35, is married and lives with two of her children in the Siem Reap province. She runs a grocery store, typically making $8 of profit a day. Her husband is a local doctor and he averages about $3 in profits a day. 

Chhun P. is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase rice. She will then remove the husks with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice to process and resell.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mr. Sitha H. (pictured with his daughter), is a widower with two sons and four daughters. Two of his daughters are garment factory workers. He lives in a village about 10 miles outside of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sitha is a motor taxi driver. In the past, he used to drive siklo (a bicycle with a compartment in the front to carry goods and people). He now is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a motorcycle for his son to launch a motor taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his son to launch a motor taxi business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma S. is from the village of Baybay in Panalsalan Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Emma is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products, such as vinegar,shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and noodles in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2009 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Emma is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Emma's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es:
El señor Marvin José G. M. es soltero tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su familia en el barrio santa Ana es trabajador de la alcaldía desde hace cinco años como vigilante de el cementerio municipal. 
El señor Marvin G. tiene cuatro años que trabaja con créditos lo que ha demostrado ser una persona honesta y responsable con sus obligaciones. Todos los créditos que ha obtenido los ha utilizado para mejorar su vivienda brindando mayor seguridad a su familia,
texts.en:
Marvin José G. M. is a single dad of three and lives with his family in the Santa Ana neighborhood, he works for the municipality and has been a graveyard guard for five years. Marvin Gutierrez has been working with loans for four years and has demonstrated to be an honest and responsible person with his commitments. All of the loans obtained have been used to make improvements to his house; providing more security to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for children's tuition

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan E., 60, lives in Srae Pou village in Takeo province.  She and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice.  Aside from farming, Phan is a silk weaver to support her family.  She wants to expand her business.  Phan has decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to enlarge her business and to hire a weaver.  Phan is a mother of three children who are seamstresses in a garment factory. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: Buy more silk to enlarge her business and hire a weaver.

loans.name: Shina

texts.en:
Mrs. Shina C. lives in Preak Ta Choar village in Kandal province and she was born in 1960. She is a vegetable seller in the local market who earns some money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it, but she does not have the money. Thus, Mrs. Shina C. decided to apply for a loan to buy more vegetables. With the rest of the loan, she wants to buy a trailer for selling vegetables. 

Her husband, Mr. Boeurn Aum, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on to support his family. She is the mother of a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell and a trailer to sell out of

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok S. is a married man, 36 years old, and works very hard as a motor-taxi driver. He has a life partner in his wife who is shown in the photo here. She is a seamstress who provides a sewing service from home. The couple has four children, two of whom are married while the others are single. To help be responsible for the family, two of the daughters are employed as tailors.

Sok S. is taking out his loan to pay the fee to connect a new electricity line.

loans.use: To pay the fee to connect a new electricity line

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en: J. Shahodat is married with two children. She launched her enterprise five years ago with the assistance of her husband. Today, she is still selling fabrics for national dresses at the famous market of her city. Shahodat has about $2,000 invested in merchandise and her net profit is about $200 each month. Her affordable pricing policy causes good turnover of her inventory and brings Shahodat high profits. Shahodat is seeking a loan of 7,500 Somoni to increase her turnover and sales rates. Shahodat started this business when she couldn't find any other way to support herself and her family, so this venture is just like her baby, and she is very excited to see it expand and become sustainable. Shahodat is hoping to make good money in business and eventually do some repairs to her family's house. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Naku

texts.en:
Naku M. is currently in the business of baking and selling local Sudanese bread cooked in oil and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour.  Naku is 26 years old and is married to a husband who is a farmer. She has 3 children and two of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Production and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Liv

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as domestic cultivators; one of them is Mrs. Liv Y. who has been working in this sector since 1997. She grows rice and raises a few pigs on her own farmland that she inherited from her grandparents. She can generate an income of around US $3 per day from this business. She is a widowed mother who has four children: three are married and one is single.

For this rice-growing season, Liv Y. lacks some supplies to use on her farm field; however, she doesn’t yet have the money to purchase these items. Therefore, Liv Y. is applying for a Kiva loan to use towards buying fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting

loans.name: Martha Yasmina

texts.es: Martha Yasmina tiene 25 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos, anteriormente trabajaba en una tienda como dependiente, pero debido a las dificultades que atravesaban en la tienda no siguió laborando ahí, por lo que fue con estos años de experiencia que ha obtenido decide iniciar su propio negocio, como es la venta de mercadería en general. Por lo que sueña con establecer su propia tienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de perfumes, colonias, ropa interior, ropa en general.
texts.en:
Martha Yasmina is 25 years old. She earns money selling general merchandise. For more than two years, she has offered her customers a wide variety of products. She previously worked as a sales clerk in a store, but due to the difficulties that she encountered in the store, she did not continue working there. With those years of experience, though, she decided to start her own business selling general merchandise. She dreams of establishing her own store. The financing she is requesting is for the purchase of perfumes, colognes, undergarments, and other clothing items.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perfumes, colognes, undergarments, and other clothing items

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda A.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She is 39 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. Hilda has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Hilda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Hilda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Muqqadas

texts.en:
Muqqadas lives in a small city called Riwind with her husband and family. She is a housewife. She stays at her 3-room brick house and takes care of her family. She is the mother of three daughters and a son, all of whom are getting their education. She is 36 years old and has spent all of her life in Riwind. She married M. H. and moved to her husband’s home 12 years ago. It is also located in Riwind. 

Her husband has a business renting out cars to earn his daily income. He has two cars and his business is doing well currently. He purchased these cars on installment by receiving loans from Asasah. 

Muqqadas also invested in the purchasing of the cars, money which she earned from her sewing business. She is excellent at her work. She gets orders from her neighborhood clients who give her good money for her work. 

She has applied for a loan for the sixth time from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount her husband will pay off the remaining installments of his cars. Muqqadas is very confident because by paying the remaining installments, the cars will become her husband’s property and he will be able to work in a better manner.

loans.use: To pay off the remaining installments of cars for rent-a-car business

loans.name: Genevive

texts.en:
Genevive G. is from the village of San Juan, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Genevive owns & operates a service-based business, providing motorcycle services to the local community. Her husband is the driver. Genevive has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Genevive joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Genevive is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Mrs. Lach M., age 51, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main activity is selling rattan cupboards. She sells rattan that she and her husband weave or she orders from other weavers who live in the village. This couple uses their own motorcycle with trailer attached as transportation and it takes a week to sell all their rattan. 

Lach M. currently gets a lot of orders for rattan from her customers, but her output is not enough to serve them. In order to better meet the needs of her customers, Lach M. is humbly requesting a loan to buy more rattan cupboards to resell.

loans.use: To order buy more rattan cupboards to resell

loans.name: Remee

texts.en:
“To grow my business” is Remee F.’s objective in requesting a loan from CEVI. Remee is 33 years old, and she wants only to improve her family's living situation.

Remee has four children, all of whom go to school. She is working very hard to be able to pay the tuition, buy the books, and provide other school necessities.

Remee is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. This loan will help her increase her harvest. Remee is interested in trying other business opportunities to augment her family's income.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
Cecilio vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto zona villa Cooperativa. El trabaja en el colegio German Busch, el cargo que ocupa es de Director, está es su principal fuente de ingresos para su manutención. Cecilio tiene dos hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción como cemento, estuco y ladrillo. Esto le servirá para construir un garaje. 

Es su primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Cecilio lives in his own home, which is located in the Cooperativa area of the city of El Alto. He is the Director of the German Busch school. This is his main source of income to support himself. Cecilio has two children. 

Cecilio will use this loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, stucco and bricks. This will enable him to build a garage.

This is his first loan with Impro.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a garage

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa pertenece al banco comunal “Juntas y Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Justa tiene 42 años, es casada y fruto es esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza de forma independiente. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Justa es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que saca a delante a su familia. Con su próximo préstamo, Justa que espera recibir $ 400 USD. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar más cosméticos como por ejemplo perfumes, aretes, etc. 

Justa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Justa belongs to the “Juntas y Unidas” (Together and United) Communal Bank, of the Arariwa Association, in the city of Cusco, and she lives in that city.  Cusco is an enchanting city that goes back to Inca times.  It is constructed on the base of the ancient Inca city.

Justa is 42 years old, married, and the fruit of this union is 2 children.  She alternates her household activities with her small business selling beauty products independently.  Justa has been dedicated to the business for various years and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  Justa is a hard-working and responsible woman who leads her family forward.  

With this loan, Justa hopes to receive $400 U.S.  At present, she wants to increase business and she is going to buy more cosmetics, including, for example, perfumes, and earrings, etc.  Justa is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and, also, she is committed to complying with the payments as scheduled.

loans.use: BUYING MORE COSMETICS; FOR EXAMPLE, PERFUMES, AND ALSO EARRINGS, ETC

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald P. M., tiene la edad de 41 años, está en unión libre, y tiene 7 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere arreglar su camión para seguir con su negocio del transporte de carne un la zona sur del país y seguir generando  ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Tiene varios años que se dedica a manejar camiones de carga y ahora cuenta con varios rutas del transporte de carne por lo cual necesita arreglar el camión para un mejor servicio. Es el tercer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes problemas con su camión hasta ahora, pero si tiene el deseo de seguir con su pequeño negocio y seguir creciendo para mejorar su nivel de bienestar familiar. También el no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más bajas. El  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a su hijos y su pareja el alimento diario por lo cual necesita reparar su camión para seguir llevando el sustento a su hogar día a día.
texts.en:
Ronald P. M. is 41 years old and in a common law marriage.  He has seven children who are his biggest priority.

He wants to repair his truck so that he can continue his meat transport business in the southern zone of the country and continue generating income for the wellbeing of his family.  He has dedicated himself to driving trucks for many years and currently has many meat transport routes.  He wants to give better service, which is why he needs to repair the truck.

This is his third loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had problems with his truck until now, but he does want to continue growing his small business to improve his household and wellbeing.  He has not had loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR granted this loan with ease and much lower interest rates.

He also wants to provide his children and his partner with daily meals.  He can do this if he repairs his truck so that he can keep making a living from day to day.

loans.use: Truck repair for delivery business.
